en_test: Better than that,  the things that you and I  spent tens and hundreds of thousands of dollars for --  GPS, HD video and still images,  libraries of books and music,  medical diagnostic technology --  are now literally dematerializing and demonetizing  into your cellphone.
zh_test: 还有更棒的， 我们花费了 成千上百美金所获得的－ GPS，高清电视和 图形图像， 以及医疗诊断技术－ 被非物质化并非商业化 输入到你的行动电话中。
GOOGLE: 比这更好的是，你我花费数万和数十万美元购买的东西——GPS、高清视频和静态图像、书籍和音乐库、医疗诊断技术——现在正在真正地在你的手机中非物质化和非货币化。

en_test: Probably the best part of it  is what's coming down the pike in health.
zh_test: 这其中最好的 部分或许是医疗。

en_test: Last month, I had the pleasure of announcing with Qualcomm Foundation  something called the $10 million Qualcomm Tricorder X Prize.
zh_test: 上个月我很荣幸和高通基金共同宣布 1000万美金高通手持移动分析仪X大赛。
GOOGLE: 上个月，我很高兴与高通基金会一起宣布设立价值 1000 万美元的高通 Tricorder X 奖。

en_test: We're challenging teams around the world  to basically combine these technologies  into a mobile device  that you can speak to, because it's got A.I.,  you can cough on it, you can do a finger blood prick.
zh_test: 我们向全世界的团队发出挑战 来将这些科技 组合进移动设备。 你可以向它说话，因为它拥有人工智能 也可以对着它咳嗽，或者扎手指验血。
GOOGLE: 我们正在挑战世界各地的团队，将这些技术基本上结合到一个你可以说话的移动设备中，因为它有人工智能，你可以用它咳嗽，你可以做手指采血。

en_test: And to win, it needs to be able to diagnose you better  than a team of board-certified doctors.
zh_test: 要赢得竞赛，这个设备需要能为你提供比一组 经过委员会验证的医师更好的诊断。
GOOGLE: 为了获胜，它需要能够比经过委员会认证的医生团队更好地诊断您。

en_test: So literally, imagine this device  in the middle of the developing world where there are no doctors, 25 percent of the disease burden  and 1.3 percent of the health care workers.
zh_test: 想象这个设备 应用在缺少医师，25％的疾病负担 仅有1.3%的医疗人员 的发展中国家。
GOOGLE: 从字面上看，想象一下这个设备位于发展中国家中部，那里没有医生，25% 的疾病负担和 1.3% 的医护人员。

en_test: When this device sequences an RNA or DNA virus  that it doesn't recognize,  it calls the CDC  and prevents the pandemic from happening in the first place.
zh_test: 如果这个设备对病毒的RNA或者DNA进行测序后 无法识别， 它会呼叫疾病控制中心 第一时间防止大规模疫情的爆发。
GOOGLE: 当该设备对它无法识别的 RNA 或 DNA 病毒进行测序时，它会致电 CDC，并在第一时间阻止大流行的发生。

en_test: But here, here is the biggest force  for bringing about a world of abundance.
zh_test: 还有最能创造 富足的世界的力量。
GOOGLE: 但在这里，这里是带来丰富世界的最大力量。

en_test: I call it the rising billion.
zh_test: 我称之为“崛起的十亿人”。
GOOGLE: 我称之为“不断增长的十亿”。

en_test: So the white lines here are population.
zh_test: 这道白线代表人口。
GOOGLE: 所以这里的白线是人口。

en_test: And by the way,  the biggest protection against a population explosion  is making the world educated  and healthy.

GOOGLE: 顺便说一句，防止人口爆炸的最大保护措施是让世界接受教育并保持健康。

GOOGLE: 到 2020 年，互联网用户数量将从 20 亿增至 50 亿。

en_test: Three billion new minds  who have never been heard from before  are connecting to the global conversation.
zh_test: 30亿未曾 被注意的新用户。 将参与到这全球的对话中来。
GOOGLE: 三十亿以前从未听说过的新思想正在参与全球对话。

en_test: What will these people want?
zh_test: 他们想要什么？
GOOGLE: 这些人想要什么？

en_test: What will they consume? What will they desire?
zh_test: 他们将会消费什么？他们的愿望是什么？
GOOGLE: 他们会消费什么？他们会渴望什么？

en_test: And rather than having economic shutdown,  we're about to have the biggest economic injection ever.
zh_test: 我们将迎来的是最大的， 是经济活力的注入而不是衰退。
GOOGLE: 我们将迎来有史以来最大规模的经济注入，而不是经济停摆。

en_test: These people represent  tens of trillions of dollars  injected into the global economy.

en_test: And they will get healthier  and they'll become better educated by using the Khan Academy,  3D printing and infinite computing  [become] more productive than ever before.

GOOGLE: 通过使用可汗学院、3D 打印和无限计算，他们将变得更加健康，并获得更好的教育，变得比以往任何时候都更加高效。

zh_test: 30亿健康，接受教育， 富有生产力的人类社会成员 能为我们带来什么？
GOOGLE: 那么，三十亿正在崛起的、健康的、受过教育的、富有成效的人类成员能为我们带来什么呢？

en_test: How about a set of voices that have never been heard from before.

en_test: What about giving the oppressed,  wherever they might be,  the voice to be heard and the voice to act  for the first time ever?

en_test: What will these three billion people bring?
zh_test: 这30亿人会带来什么？
GOOGLE: 这三十亿人会带来什么？

en_test: What about contributions we can't even predict?
zh_test: 或许是我们都还未能预见的贡献？

en_test: The one thing I've learned at the X Prize  driven by their passion with a clear focus  can do extraordinary things,  things that large corporations and governments  could only do in the past.

en_test: Let me share and close with a story  that really got me excited.

en_test: There is a program that some of you might have heard of.
zh_test: 在座的有一些可能听说过这个项目。
GOOGLE: 你们中有些人可能听说过一个程序。

en_test: It's a game called Foldit.
zh_test: 是一个叫做Foldit的游戏。
GOOGLE: 这是一款名为 Foldit 的游戏。

en_test: It came out of the University of Washington in Seattle.
zh_test: 它来自西雅图的华盛顿大学。
GOOGLE: 它来自西雅图华盛顿大学。

en_test: And this is a game  where individuals can actually take a sequence of amino acids  and figure out how the protein is going to fold.
zh_test: 它是一个 能让个人获取一个氨基酸序列， 并分析出其中的蛋白质是如何折叠的。
GOOGLE: 在这个游戏中，个人实际上可以获取一系列氨基酸并弄清楚蛋白质将如何折叠。

en_test: And how it folds dictates its structure and its functionality.
zh_test: 其折叠的方式决定了该氨基酸的结构和功能。
GOOGLE: 它的折叠方式决定了它的结构和功能。

en_test: And it's very important for research in medicine.
zh_test: 这是非常重要的医学研究。
GOOGLE: 这对于医学研究非常重要。

en_test: And up until now, it's been a supercomputer problem.
zh_test: 直到目前，这都还是一个由超级电脑来处理的问题。
GOOGLE: 到目前为止，这一直是一个超级计算机问题。

en_test: And this game has been played  by university professors and so forth.
zh_test: 这个游戏起先 是给大学教授玩。

en_test: And it's literally, hundreds of thousands of people  came online and started playing it.
zh_test: 然后成百上千的人也上线 开始玩这个游戏。
GOOGLE: 事实上，数十万人上网并开始玩它。

en_test: And it showed that, in fact, today,  the human pattern recognition machinery  is better at folding proteins than the best computers.
zh_test: 它也展示出时至今日， 人类的模式辨识机能 仍然要比最好的电脑都要强。
GOOGLE: 事实上，它表明，今天的人类模式识别机器比最好的计算机更擅长折叠蛋白质。

en_test: And when these individuals went and looked  at who was the best protein folder in the world,  it wasn't an MIT professor,  it wasn't a CalTech student,  it was a person from England, from Manchester,  a woman who, during the day,  was an executive assistant at a rehab clinic  and, at night, was the world's best protein folder.
zh_test: 当大家排列出最好的 蛋白质折叠专家时， 并不是MIT的教授， 也不是加州理工学院的学生， 而是一位来自曼彻斯特的英国女性。 白天在一家康复治疗整所 行政助理的工作， 而夜晚也是全世界最好的蛋白质折叠专家。
GOOGLE: 当这些人去看看谁是世界上最好的蛋白质文件夹时，它不是麻省理工学院的教授，也不是加州理工学院的学生，而是一个来自英国、曼彻斯特的女人，她在白天，他是一家康复诊所的行政助理；晚上，他是世界上最好的蛋白质文件夹。

en_test: Ladies and gentlemen,  what gives me tremendous confidence  in the future  is the fact that we are now more empowered as individuals  to take on the grand challenges of this planet.
zh_test: 女士们先生们 给予我对未来 巨大信心的， 是我们每一位作为个人都被赋予 挑战全世界面临的难题的能力。
GOOGLE: 女士们、先生们，让我对未来充满信心的是，我们作为个人现在更有能力应对这个星球的巨大挑战。

en_test: We have the tools with this exponential technology.
zh_test: 我们拥有快速发展的科技和工具，
GOOGLE: 我们拥有采用这种指数级技术的工具。

en_test: We have the passion of the DIY innovator.
zh_test: 也有DIY发明家的激情。
GOOGLE: 我们拥有 DIY 创新者的热情。

en_test: We have the capital of the techno-philanthropist.
zh_test: 大家都有能力成为技术－慈善家。
GOOGLE: 我们拥有技术慈善家的资本。

en_test: And we have three billion new minds  coming online to work with us  to solve the grand challenges,  to do that which we must do.

GOOGLE: 我们有 30 亿新思维加入进来，与我们一起解决重大挑战，完成我们必须做的事情。

en_test: We are living into extraordinary decades ahead.
zh_test: 我们正要迎来卓越的几十年。
GOOGLE: 我们正生活在未来不平凡的几十年里。

en_test: Thank you.
zh_test: 谢谢大家。
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

en_test: I'm going to speak  about a tiny, little idea.
zh_test: 我要讲的是 一个很小概念
GOOGLE: 我要谈谈一个很小的想法。

en_test: And this is about shifting baseline.
zh_test: 与基准线的变动有关
GOOGLE: 这是关于改变基线。

en_test: And because the idea can be explained in one minute,  I will tell you three stories before  to fill in the time.
zh_test: 这个概念一分钟就能讲完了 所以我先讲三个故事 来混时间
GOOGLE: 因为这个想法可以在一分钟内解释清楚，所以我先给大家讲三个故事来填补时间。

en_test: And the first story  is about Charles Darwin, one of my heroes.
zh_test: 第一个故事 讲的是达尔文 我的偶像之一
GOOGLE: 第一个故事是关于查尔斯·达尔文的，他是我的英雄之一。

en_test: And he was here, as you well know, in '35.
zh_test: 他曾来过这里 大家都知道 那是1935年
GOOGLE: 正如你所知，他在 35 年就在这里。

en_test: And you'd think he was chasing finches,  but he wasn't.
zh_test: 你们可能以为他在追鸟雀 其实不是
GOOGLE: 你可能会认为他在追雀，但事实并非如此。

en_test: He was actually collecting fish.
zh_test: 他是在捕鱼
GOOGLE: 他实际上是在收集鱼。

en_test: And he described one of them  as very "common."
zh_test: 他说一条鱼 很”常见“
GOOGLE: 他形容其中之一非常“常见”。

en_test: This was the sailfin grouper.
zh_test: 这是一种石斑鱼
GOOGLE: 这是帆鳍石斑鱼。

en_test: A big fishery was run on it  until the '80s.
zh_test: 这种鱼被大量捕捉 到八十年代

en_test: Now the fish is on the IUCN Red List.

GOOGLE: 现在这种鱼已被列入世界自然保护联盟红色名录。

en_test: Now this story,  we have heard it lots of times  on Galapagos and other places,  so there is nothing particular about it.
zh_test: 这个故事 我们已经听过很多遍了 在加拉帕戈斯群岛和其他地方都听过 没什么新鲜的
GOOGLE: 这个故事，我们在加拉帕戈斯群岛和其他地方已经听过很多次了，所以没有什么特别的。

en_test: But the point is, we still come to Galapagos.
zh_test: 问题在于 我们现在还会去加拉帕戈斯群岛
GOOGLE: 但重点是，我们还是来到了加拉帕戈斯群岛。

en_test: We still think it is pristine.
zh_test: 还认为那是还是原生态
GOOGLE: 我们仍然认为它是原始的。

en_test: The brochures still say  it is untouched.
zh_test: 旅游宣传册上还说 这里未经开发
GOOGLE: 小册子上仍然说它没有受到影响。

en_test: So what happens here?
zh_test: 这里究竟是什么情况
GOOGLE: 那么这里会发生什么呢？

en_test: The second story, also to illustrate another concept,  is called shifting waistline.
zh_test: 第二个故事 讲的是另一个概念 叫做变动的"腰准线"
GOOGLE: 第二个故事，也是为了说明另一个概念，叫做改变腰围。

en_test: Because I was there in '71,  studying a lagoon in West Africa.
zh_test: （众人笑） 1971年的时候 我在那里 考察西非的一片西湖
GOOGLE: 因为 71 年我在那里研究西非的一个泻湖。

en_test: I was there because I grew up in Europe  and I wanted later to work in Africa.
zh_test: 我去那里是因为我在欧洲长大 我想以后到非洲工作
GOOGLE: 我在那里是因为我在欧洲长大，后来想在非洲工作。

en_test: And I thought I could blend in.
zh_test: 我以为我可以融入当地社会
GOOGLE: 我以为我可以融入其中。

en_test: And I got a big sunburn,  and I was convinced that I was really not from there.
zh_test: 我还被晒伤了一大块 结果我发现我的确不是非洲来的
GOOGLE: 我被严重晒伤了，我确信我真的不是那里人。

en_test: This was my first sunburn.
zh_test: 那是我第一次被晒伤
GOOGLE: 这是我第一次晒伤。

en_test: And the lagoon  was surrounded by palm trees,  as you can see, and a few mangrove.
zh_test: 这片泻湖 被棕榈树环绕 你们可以看到一些红树
GOOGLE: 如您所见，泻湖周围环绕着棕榈树和一些红树林。

en_test: And it had tilapia  about 20 centimeters,  a species of tilapia called blackchin tilapia.
zh_test: 这里有罗非鱼 大概20厘米长 这种罗非鱼叫黑颚罗非鱼
GOOGLE: 而且里面有20厘米左右的罗非鱼，一种叫黑钦罗非鱼的罗非鱼。

en_test: And the fisheries for this tilapia  sustained lots of fish and they had a good time  and they earned more than average  in Ghana.
zh_test: 人们捕捞罗非鱼 这让许多鱼存活了下来 它们活得很好 渔业的收入在加纳 高出平均水平
GOOGLE: 这种罗非鱼的渔业捕捞了大量的鱼，他们度过了一段美好的时光，他们的收入高于加纳的平均水平。

en_test: When I went there 27 years later,  the fish had shrunk to half of their size.
zh_test: 二十七年之后 我回到那里 这种鱼的大小缩减了一半
GOOGLE: 27年后我去那里时，鱼已经缩小到一半大了。

en_test: They were maturing at five centimeters.
zh_test: 它们成年时只有五厘米长
GOOGLE: 它们在五厘米时就成熟了。

en_test: They had been pushed genetically.
zh_test: 它们的发育在遗传上被改变了
GOOGLE: 他们是被基因推动的。

en_test: There were still fishes.
zh_test: 那里还有鱼
GOOGLE: 仍然有鱼。

en_test: They were still kind of happy.
zh_test: 它们还是活得不错
GOOGLE: 他们还是有点高兴的。

en_test: And the fish also were happy to be there.
zh_test: 鱼儿们也很喜欢生活在那里

en_test: So nothing has changed,  but everything has changed.
zh_test: 似乎没什么变化 但其实 一切都改变了
GOOGLE: 所以一切都没有改变，但一切都变了。

en_test: My third little story  is that I was an accomplice  in the introduction of trawling  in Southeast Asia.
zh_test: 第三个故事讲的是 将拖网捕捞 引入非洲东南部的 有我一份
GOOGLE: 我的第三个小故事是，我是东南亚拖网捕捞业的同谋。

en_test: In the '70s -- well, beginning in the '60s --  Europe did lots of development projects.
zh_test: 在七十年代--其实是六十年代初期-- 欧洲进行了许多发展项目
GOOGLE: 在 70 年代——嗯，从 60 年代开始——欧洲做了很多开发项目。

en_test: Fish development  meant imposing on countries  that had already 100,000 fishers  to impose on them industrial fishing.

GOOGLE: 渔业发展意味着对已经拥有 10 万渔民的国家实施工业化捕捞。

en_test: And this boat, quite ugly,  is called the Mutiara 4.
zh_test: 这艘船 挺难看的 叫Mutiara 4号
GOOGLE: 这艘船，相当丑陋，叫做 Mutiara 4。

en_test: And I went sailing on it,  and we did surveys  throughout the southern South China sea  and especially the Java Sea.
zh_test: 我乘上这艘船 我们一路做调查 沿着中国南海 尤其是爪哇海
GOOGLE: 我乘着它航行，我们在整个南中国海，特别是爪哇海进行了调查。

en_test: And what we caught,  we didn't have words for it.
zh_test: 我们捕捞到了 叫不出名字的东西

zh_test: 现在我知道了 我们捞到的 是海底的生物

en_test: And 90 percent of our catch  were sponges,  other animals that are fixed on the bottom.

en_test: And actually most of the fish,  they are a little spot on the debris,  the piles of debris, were coral reef fish.
zh_test: 实际上 大多数鱼 就是那堆杂物中的小点 它们是生活在珊瑚礁中的鱼

zh_test: 海底被端上了甲板 后来又被扔下去

en_test: And these pictures are extraordinary  because this transition is very rapid.
zh_test: 这些照片意义非凡 因为这个变化过程非常快

GOOGLE: 这是一只死乌龟。

en_test: They were not eaten, they were thrown away because they were dead.
zh_test: 它们没有被吃掉 而是因为死了而被扔掉的
GOOGLE: 它们没有被吃掉，而是被扔掉，因为它们死了。

en_test: And one time we caught a live one.
zh_test: 有一次 我们捉到一只活的
GOOGLE: 有一次我们抓到了一只活的。

en_test: It was not drowned yet.
zh_test: 它还没有淹死
GOOGLE: 它还没有被淹死。

en_test: And then they wanted to kill it because it was good to eat.
zh_test: 他们想杀掉它 因为海龟肉很美味
GOOGLE: 然后他们想杀死它，因为它很好吃。

en_test: This mountain of debris  is actually collected by fishers  into an area that's never been fished.
zh_test: 这堆积如山的杂物 是渔民们捞上来的 他们每次进入未经捕捞的海域 都能捞到这些东西
GOOGLE: 这座堆积如山的碎片实际上是由渔民收集到从未捕鱼过的区域的。

en_test: But it's not documented.
zh_test: 而这并没有被记录在案
GOOGLE: 但它没有记录在案。

en_test: We transform the world,  but we don't remember it.
zh_test: 我们改变了世界 但却不认账
GOOGLE: 我们改变了世界，但我们不记得它。

en_test: We adjust our baseline  to the new level,  and we don't recall what was there.
zh_test: 我们把基准线 调整到一个新水平 而把之前的水平抛在脑后
GOOGLE: 我们将基线调整到新水平，但我们不记得那里有什么。

en_test: If you generalize this,  something like this happens.
zh_test: 归纳一下 就会出现这样的情况
GOOGLE: 如果你概括这一点，就会发生这样的事情。

en_test: You have on the y axis some good thing:  biodiversity, numbers of orca,  the greenness of your country, the water supply.
zh_test: Y轴代表美好的事物 生物多样性 逆戟鲸的数量 你的国家的绿化 水资源供应
GOOGLE: y 轴上有一些好东西：生物多样性、虎鲸数量、国家的绿化程度、供水。

en_test: And over time it changes --  it changes  because people do things, or naturally.
zh_test: 随着时间的变化而变化 之所以变化 是因为人们的活动或自然的变化
GOOGLE: 随着时间的推移，它会发生变化——它会因为人们做事而发生变化，或者自然而然地发生变化。

en_test: Every generation  will use the images  that they got at the beginning of their conscious lives  as a standard  and will extrapolate forward.
zh_test: 每代人 都会 以他们有意识之初的画面 作为标准 并往前推测
GOOGLE: 每一代人都会使用他们在意识生活开始时获得的图像作为标准，并向前推断。

en_test: And the difference then,  they perceive as a loss.
zh_test: 所产生的差距 他们视为一种损失
GOOGLE: 他们将这种差异视为一种损失。

en_test: But they don't perceive what happened before as a loss.
zh_test: 但他们没有把之前发生的事情视为一种损失
GOOGLE: 但他们并不认为之前发生的事情是一种损失。

en_test: You can have a succession of changes.
zh_test: 一系列变化发生了
GOOGLE: 你可以有一系列的改变。

en_test: At the end you want to sustain  miserable leftovers.
zh_test: 最后你希望 保住最后可怜的幸存者
GOOGLE: 最后你想要维持悲惨的剩菜。

en_test: And that, to a large extent, is what we want to do now.
zh_test: 而这在很大程度上 就是我们现在要做的

en_test: We want to sustain things that are gone  or things that are not the way they were.
zh_test: 我们想要保护那些消失殆尽的东西 或者那些发生了变化的东西
GOOGLE: 我们想要维持那些已经消失的东西或者那些已经不再是原来样子的东西。

en_test: Now one should think  this problem affected people certainly when in predatory societies,  they killed animals  after a few generations.
zh_test: 现在人们应当认为 这个问题当然会对人产生影响 他们捕杀动物 而直到几代人之后
GOOGLE: 现在人们应该认为这个问题肯定会影响到掠夺性社会中的人们，他们在几代之后就杀死了动物。

en_test: Because, obviously,  an animal that is very abundant,  before it gets extinct,  it becomes rare.
zh_test: 才意识到他们的所作所为 因为 很显然 在一种动物灭绝 或濒临灭绝前 这种动物的数量还是很多的
GOOGLE: 因为，显然，一种数量非常丰富的动物在灭绝之前就会变得稀有。

en_test: So you don't lose abundant animals.
zh_test: 所以你不会失去数量多的动物物种
GOOGLE: 这样你就不会失去大量的动物。

en_test: You always lose rare animals.
zh_test: 你失去的是珍稀动物
GOOGLE: 你总是会失去稀有动物。

en_test: And therefore they're not perceived  as a big loss.
zh_test: 所以这些动物的消失 不会被视为重大损失
GOOGLE: 因此，它们并不被视为重大损失。

en_test: Over time,  we concentrate on large animals,  and in a sea that means the big fish.
zh_test: 随着时间推移 我们关注大型动物 在海洋中 这指的是大型鱼类
GOOGLE: 随着时间的推移，我们专注于大型动物，而在海洋中则意味着大鱼。

en_test: They become rarer because we fish them.
zh_test: 我们捕捞鱼类致使它们的数量越来越少

en_test: Over time we have a few fish left  and we think this is the baseline.
zh_test: 一段时间时候 我们只剩下少数鱼了 我们就把这个数量看做基准线
GOOGLE: 随着时间的推移，我们剩下了一些鱼，我们认为这是基线。

en_test: And the question is,  why do people accept this?
zh_test: 问题是 人们为什么对此安之若素呢
GOOGLE: 问题是，为什么人们会接受这一点？

en_test: Well because they don't know that it was different.
zh_test: 这是因为他们不知道情况变化了
GOOGLE: 好吧，因为他们不知道这是不同的。

en_test: And in fact, lots of people, scientists,  will contest that it was really different.

en_test: And they will contest this  because the evidence  presented in an earlier mode  is not in the way  they would like the evidence presented.

en_test: For example,  the anecdote that some present,  as Captain so-and-so  observed lots of fish in this area  cannot be used  or is usually not utilized by fishery scientists,  because it's not "scientific."
zh_test: 举个例子 有人讲了一个故事 说某某船长 发现这个地区有很多鱼 这个故事不能拿来当证据 渔业科学家通常也不会采纳这个故事 因为它不够“科学”
GOOGLE: 比如，有的轶事说，某某船长观察到这一带有很多鱼，渔业科学家不能利用，或者通常不利用，因为它不“科学”。

en_test: So you have a situation  where people don't know the past,  even though we live in literate societies,  because they don't trust  the sources of the past.

GOOGLE: 因此，即使我们生活在有文化的社会中，人们也不知道过去，因为他们不相信过去的来源。

en_test: And hence, the enormous role  that a marine protected area can play.
zh_test: 他们也不了解 一个海洋保护区域的重大角色

en_test: Because with marine protected areas,  we actually recreate the past.

en_test: That is for people  who can see a marine protected area  and who can benefit  from the insight that it provides,  which enables them to reset their baseline.

GOOGLE: 那些因为无法访问而无法做到这一点的人（例如中西部的人）又如何呢？

en_test: And the snippets of halting English  were exchanged between people  who had one thing in common,  they were starting again.
zh_test: 说着同样磕磕绊绊的英语， 人们相互交流着。 有一件事情是相同的， 又重新开始了。
GOOGLE: 人们之间交换着断断续续的英语片段，他们有一个共同点，那就是重新开始。

en_test: My mother worked on farms,  then on a car assembly line,  working six days, double shifts.
zh_test: 母亲一开始在农村干活， 后来去了汽车组装线， 一周工作6天，双班倒。

en_test: We were poor.
zh_test: 我们很穷，
GOOGLE: 我们很穷。

en_test: All the dollars were allocated  and extra tuition in English and mathematics  was budgeted for  regardless of what missed out,  which was usually new clothes;  they were always secondhand.
zh_test: 节约每一分钱。 剩余的钱都用来缴英语和数学的学费， 不管再难， 即使没有 新衣服穿， 穿二手的。
GOOGLE: 所有的钱都被分配了，英语和数学的额外学费也被编入预算，不管错过了什么，通常是新衣服；它们总是二手的。

zh_test: 上学时穿两双袜子， 一双遮挡另一双上的洞。

GOOGLE: 还有罕见但灼热的“裂眼”口号和偶尔的涂鸦：“亚洲人，回家吧。”

zh_test: 回家回到哪儿？
GOOGLE: 回家去哪儿？

GOOGLE: 一股坚定的决心和一个平静的声音说道：“我会绕过你。”

zh_test: 我、我妹妹和我母亲 睡在同一张床上。

zh_test: 关于男人的故事， 没有过渡， 生气，呆板， 问题小孩，就像两个世界。
GOOGLE: 女人们带来了她们的故事，讲述了无法过渡的男人、愤怒而僵化的男人，以及夹在两个世界之间的问题儿童。

en_test: Grants and sponsors were sought.
zh_test: 寻求资金和资助人，
GOOGLE: 寻求赠款和赞助商。

en_test: Centers were established.
zh_test: 建立了中心。
GOOGLE: 中心成立。

en_test: I lived in parallel worlds.
zh_test: 我生活在一个平行的世界。
GOOGLE: 我生活在平行世界里。

en_test: In one, I was the classic Asian student,  relentless in the demands that I made on myself.
zh_test: 一方面，我是典型的亚洲学生， 自己特别狠；

GOOGLE: 另一方面，我的生活岌岌可危，因暴力、吸毒和孤立而悲惨地伤痕累累。

zh_test: 但是如此多年的帮助，
GOOGLE: 但多年来有很多人得到了帮助。

zh_test: Tan Le一名Footscray普通居民， 现在是难民，社会积极分子， 被邀请演讲， 去一个从未听说过的 去一个无法想象是否存在的地方。
GOOGLE: 谭乐，一位匿名的富茨克雷居民，现在是难民和社会活动家谭乐，被邀请在她从未听说过的场所和她从未想象过的家庭中发表演讲。

en_test: I didn't know the protocols.
zh_test: 我不知道协议，
GOOGLE: 我不知道协议。

en_test: I didn't know how to use the cutlery.
zh_test: 不知道如何用刀具，
GOOGLE: 我不知道如何使用餐具。

en_test: I didn't know how to talk about wine.
zh_test: 不会谈论葡萄酒，
GOOGLE: 我不知道如何谈论酒。

en_test: I didn't know how to talk about anything.
zh_test: 不会讲话。
GOOGLE: 我不知道如何谈论任何事情。

en_test: I wanted to retreat to the routines and comfort  of life in an unsung suburb --  a grandmother, a mother and two daughters  ending each day as they had for almost 20 years,  telling one another the story of their day  and falling asleep,  the three of us still in the same bed.

GOOGLE: 我想回到一个默默无闻的郊区，过上例行公事和舒适的生活——一位祖母、一位母亲和两个女儿像近 20 年来那样结束每一天，互相讲述一天的故事，然后入睡，三个人我们仍然在同一张床上。

en_test: I told my mother I couldn't do it.
zh_test: 我告诉我母亲，我做不到。
GOOGLE: 我告诉妈妈我做不到。

en_test: No had never been an option.
zh_test: 没有任何选择。
GOOGLE: “不”从来都不是一个选择。

zh_test: “放手去做”，她说 “做真正的自己”
GOOGLE: “就去做吧，”她说，“不要做你不是的人。”

en_test: So I spoke out on youth unemployment and education  and the neglect of the marginalized and the disenfranchised.
zh_test: 因此我讲到了失业低龄化和教育问题 忽视边缘群体和剥夺政治权利。
GOOGLE: 因此，我就青年失业和教育以及对边缘化和被剥夺权利的人的忽视发表了看法。

en_test: I met people from all walks of life,  so many of them doing the thing they loved,  living on the frontiers of possibility.

GOOGLE: 我遇到了各行各业的人，他们中的许多人都在做自己喜欢的事情，生活在可能性的前沿。

en_test: And even though I finished my degree,  I realized I could not settle into a career in law.

GOOGLE: 尽管我完成了学位，但我意识到我无法从事法律职业。

zh_test: 这儿还有另一个拼图的片段。

en_test: Because being an insider  can so easily mean collapsing the horizons,  can so easily mean  accepting the presumptions of your province.

zh_test: 她17岁嫁给了一个Mandarin， 做二房，遭到婆婆的打骂。

en_test: "Because you have been holding it since this morning," he said.

en_test: "You have not let it go."

zh_test: 事实上整个操作非常简单 我一坐上去 它就把我的数据发送到谷歌健康
GOOGLE: 但问题是，它变得如此简单，每当我跳上车时，它也会通过 Google Health 发送我的数据。

en_test: And it's collected by my general practitioner as well,  so he can see what's my problem in weight,  not on the very moment  that I need cardiologic support or something like it,  but also looking backward.
zh_test: 同时我的全科医生也可以收到 然后他就能看看我的体重有什么问题 不是等到像心脏病发作 这样十万火急的时候才想到看体重 而是一路走来都会关注
GOOGLE: 它也由我的全科医生收集，这样他就可以看到我的体重问题，而不是在我需要心脏病支持或类似的东西的那一刻，而且还可以回顾过去。

en_test: But there's another thing.
zh_test: 但还有一点
GOOGLE: 但还有一件事。

en_test: As some of you might know, I've got more than 4,000 followers on Twitter.
zh_test: 你们有些人可能知道 我在推特上有四千多粉丝
GOOGLE: 你们中有些人可能知道，我在 Twitter 上有超过 4,000 名关注者。

en_test: So every morning  I hop on my WiFi scale  and before I'm in my car, people start talking to me,  "I think you need a light lunch today, Lucien."
zh_test: 所以每天早上 我用WiFi体重测量仪称重 在我上车之前 人们就开始跟我说话了 “我想你今天午饭还是就简吧，吕西安”
GOOGLE: 所以每天早上我都会跳上我的 WiFi 体重秤，在我上车之前，人们就开始跟我说话，“我想你今天需要吃一顿清淡的午餐，Lucien。”

en_test: But that's the nicest thing that could happen,  since this is peer pressure,  peer pressure used to help patients --  since this could be used for obesity,  it could be used  to stop smoking in patients.
zh_test: 但其实那再好不过了 因为这是同伴压力 同伴压力能帮助病人－ 它可以帮助治疗肥胖 可以帮助 戒烟
GOOGLE: 但这是可能发生的最好的事情，因为这是同伴压力，同伴压力用于帮助患者——因为这可以用于治疗肥胖症，它可以用于帮助患者戒烟。

en_test: But on the other hand, it also could be used  to get people from out of their chairs  and try to work together in some kind of gaming activity  to get more control of their health.
zh_test: 但是另外一方面，它也可以 把人们聚集到一起 参加一些类似游戏的活动 来更好地维护健康
GOOGLE: 但另一方面，它也可以用来让人们从椅子上站起来，尝试在某种游戏活动中合作，以更好地控制他们的健康。

en_test: As of next week, it will soon be available.
zh_test: 下一周这个功能就要上马了
GOOGLE: 从下周开始，它很快就会上市。

en_test: There will be this little blood pressure meter  connected to an iPhone or something or other.
zh_test: 届时会有一个像这样的小血压计 连接到智能手机或者其他设备上
GOOGLE: 将会有一个连接到 iPhone 或其他设备的小型血压计。

en_test: And people will be able, from their homes,  to take their blood pressure,  send it into their doctor  and eventually share it with others, for instance,  for over a hundred dollars.
zh_test: 然后人们便可在家中 测量血压 之后把数据发给他们的医生 同时也可同其他人分享 只要一百美元
GOOGLE: 人们将能够在家中测量血压，将其发送给医生，并最终与他人分享，例如花费一百多美元。

en_test: And this is the point where patients get into position  and can collect, not only their own control again,  be captain of their own ship,  but also can help us in health care  due to the challenges that we face,  like health care cost explosion,  doubled demand and things like that.
zh_test: 这就是关键之处，当患者各就各位 收集数据时，他们不仅能自我控制 亲自掌舵 还能帮助我们应付 医疗保健中面临的挑战 比如医疗费用剧增 或者需求成倍增加等等
GOOGLE: 这是患者就位并可以收集的点，不仅可以再次控制自己，成为自己的船长，而且还可以帮助我们应对医疗保健，因为我们面临着挑战，例如医疗保健成本爆炸，需求翻倍之类的事情。

en_test: Make techniques that are easy to use  and start with this to embrace patients in the team.
zh_test: 我们要让技术便于掌控 以鼓励已步入轨道的病人
GOOGLE: 制定易于使用的技术，并以此开始将患者纳入团队。

en_test: And you can do this with techniques like this,  but also by crowd-sourcing.
zh_test: 你可以通过这样的技术来实现 也可以将任务分派给普通大众
GOOGLE: 您可以使用这样的技术来做到这一点，也可以通过众包来做到这一点。

en_test: And one of the things we did  I would like to share with you introduced by a little video.
zh_test: 今天我将通过 一个短片来向各位展示我们做的一个项目
GOOGLE: 我想通过一段小视频与大家分享我们所做的一件事。

en_test: We've all got navigation controls in our car.
zh_test: 我们车里都有导航装置
GOOGLE: 我们的车里都有导航控制器。

en_test: We maybe even [have] it in our cellphone.
zh_test: 甚至手机里也有
GOOGLE: 我们甚至可能在我们的手机中拥有它。

en_test: We know perfectly where all the ATMs are  about the city of Maastricht.
zh_test: 我们知道马斯特里赫特市 所有ATM的位置
GOOGLE: 我们非常清楚马斯特里赫特市所有 ATM 机的位置。

en_test: The other thing is we know where all the gas stations are.
zh_test: 也知道所有加油站的位置
GOOGLE: 另一件事是我们知道所有加油站在哪里。

en_test: And sure, we could find fast food chains.
zh_test: 当然还有快餐店
GOOGLE: 当然，我们可以找到快餐连锁店。

en_test: But where would be the nearest AED  to help this patient?
zh_test: 但是最近的能拯救患者的 自动体外除颤器在哪儿？
GOOGLE: 但是最近的 AED 可以帮助这位患者吗？

en_test: We asked around and nobody knew.
zh_test: 我们到处问也没有人知道
GOOGLE: 我们四处打听，没有人知道。

en_test: Nobody knew where the nearest life-saving AED  was to be obtained right now.
zh_test: 没人知道的能救命的自动体外除颤器 现在能找到了
GOOGLE: 目前没有人知道在哪里可以获得最近的救生自动体外除颤器。

en_test: So what we did, we crowdsourced The Netherlands.
zh_test: 我们将属于整个荷兰的任务派发给群众
GOOGLE: 所以我们所做的就是众包荷兰。

en_test: We set up a website  and asked the crowd, "If you see an AED,  please submit it, tell us where it is,  tell us when it's open,"  since sometimes in office hours sometimes it's closed, of course.
zh_test: 我们建了一个网站 告诉人们，“如果你看到一个自动体外除颤器 就请在网上标出它的位置 并备注开放时间” 备注是因为它不一定24小时都开放
GOOGLE: 我们建立了一个网站并询问人群，“如果您看到 AED，请提交它，告诉我们它在哪里，告诉我们它何时开放”，因为当然，有时在办公时间有时它会关闭。

en_test: And over 10,000 AEDs already in The Netherlands  already have been submitted.
zh_test: 在荷兰已经有一万多个AED 被标注上了
GOOGLE: 荷兰已经提交了超过 10,000 份 AED。

en_test: The next step we took was to find the applications for it.
zh_test: 下一步就是开发相应的应用程序
GOOGLE: 我们采取的下一步是找到它的应用程序。

en_test: And we built an iPad application.
zh_test: 我们开发了一个iPad应用
GOOGLE: 我们构建了一个 iPad 应用程序。

en_test: We made an application for Layar, augmented reality,  to find these AEDs.
zh_test: 一个Layar的应用，扩增实境 来寻找AED
GOOGLE: 我们开发了 Layar（增强现实）应用程序来查找这些 AED。

en_test: And whenever you are in a city like Maastricht and somebody collapses,  you can use your iPhone,  and within the next weeks also run your Microsoft cellphone,  to find the nearest AED  which can save lives.
zh_test: 如果你在马斯特里赫特市 看到有人倒下了 你可以用iPhone 几周之内微软手机也可以了 找到最近的AED 来拯救生命
GOOGLE: 每当您在马斯特里赫特这样的城市，有人倒下时，您都可以使用 iPhone，并且在接下来的几周内还可以运行您的 Microsoft 手机，找到最近的 AED 来挽救生命。

en_test: And as of today,  we would like to introduce this, not only as AED4EU,  which is what the product is called,  but also AED4US.
zh_test: 今天 我想介绍的，不仅仅是AED4U 这是那个产品的名字 还有aed4.us
GOOGLE: 从今天开始，我们想推出的产品不仅是 AED4EU（该产品的名称），还有 AED4US。

en_test: And we would like to start this on a worldwide level.
zh_test: 我们打算将这项目推广到全世界
GOOGLE: 我们希望在全球范围内开始这项工作。

en_test: And [we're] asking all of our colleagues in the rest of the world,  colleague universities, to help us  to find and work and act like a hub  to crowd-source all these AEDs all around the world.
zh_test: 在这里我们也呼吁世界各地的同事 和大学来帮我们 让我们万众一心 一起将世界各地的AED标识出来
GOOGLE: [我们]请求世界其他地方的所有同事、大学同事帮助我们找到并工作，并充当一个中心，将世界各地的所有这些 AED 众包起来。

en_test: That whenever you're on holiday and somebody collapses,  might it be your own relative or someone just in front of you,  you can find this.
zh_test: 这样当你假日外出看见有人昏倒了 也许是你的亲人或者只是路人 你就能找到AED
GOOGLE: 每当你在度假时，有人倒下了，无论是你自己的亲戚还是你面前的人，你都可以找到这个。

en_test: The other thing we would like to ask  is of companies also all over the world  that will be able to help us validate these AEDs.
zh_test: 在这里我们还想呼吁 世界上的各个公司 能帮我们验证这些AED
GOOGLE: 我们想询问的另一件事是世界各地的公司是否能够帮助我们验证这些 AED。

en_test: These might be courier services  or cable guys for instance,  just to see whether the AED that's submitted  still is in place.
zh_test: 譬如，或许让快递员 或者电报员 去看看被标识的AED 是不是还在那个位置
GOOGLE: 例如，他们可能是快递服务人员或有线电视人员，只是为了查看提交的 AED 是否仍然存在。

en_test: So please help us on this one  and try to make not only health a little bit better, but take control of it.
zh_test: 所以请在这一项目上帮助我们 让我们不仅更健康，并且能将其掌握，胸有成竹
GOOGLE: 因此，请在这方面帮助我们，不仅努力让健康好一点，而且努力控制它。

en_test: Thank you.
zh_test: 谢谢大家
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

en_test: I'm here to share my photography.
zh_test: 今天我想在此跟大家分享一下我的摄影作品
GOOGLE: 我来这里是为了分享我的摄影作品。

en_test: Or is it photography?
zh_test: 或者说，这张也是摄影作品么？
GOOGLE: 还是摄影？

en_test: Because, of course, this is a photograph  that you can't take with your camera.
zh_test: 因为，这显然是一张照片 但却是你用相机拍不出来的
GOOGLE: 当然，因为这是一张你无法用相机拍摄的照片。

en_test: Yet, my interest in photography started  as I got my first digital camera  at the age of 15.
zh_test: 然而，我对摄影的兴趣 始于我拿到第一个数码相机后 那时候我15岁
GOOGLE: 然而，当我 15 岁时获得第一台数码相机时，我对摄影的兴趣就开始了。

en_test: It mixed with my earlier passion for drawing,  but it was a bit different,  because using the camera,  the process was in the planning instead.
zh_test: 这里面夹杂了我之前对绘画的热爱 但是有一点不一样 因为使用照相机的时候 整个过程已经提前计划好了
GOOGLE: 它与我早期对绘画的热情混合在一起，但有点不同，因为使用相机，过程是在计划中的。

en_test: And when you take a photograph with a camera,  the process ends when you press the trigger.
zh_test: 当你拿起相机拍照 当你摁下快门的时候整个过程也就结束了
GOOGLE: 当你用相机拍照时，当你按下扳机时，这个过程就会结束。

en_test: So to me it felt like photography was more about  being at the right place and the right time.
zh_test: 所以在我看来摄影更注重 适当的拍摄地点和时间
GOOGLE: 所以对我来说，摄影更多的是在正确的地点和正确的时间。

en_test: I felt like anyone could do that.
zh_test: 我觉得任何人都可以做这件事
GOOGLE: 我觉得任何人都可以做到这一点。

en_test: So I wanted to create something different,  something where the process starts  when you press the trigger.
zh_test: 所以我想做点特别的 特别之处就在于当你摁下快门时 整个过程才刚刚开始
GOOGLE: 所以我想创造一些不同的东西，当你按下扳机时这个过程就开始了。

en_test: Photos like this:  construction going on along a busy road.
zh_test: 比如这张照片： 一条繁忙的公路旁边正在进行施工
GOOGLE: 像这样的照片：一条繁忙的道路上正在施工。

en_test: But it has an unexpected twist.
zh_test: （题材平凡，）但手法出人意料
GOOGLE: 但它有一个意想不到的转折。

en_test: And despite that,  it retains a level of realism.
zh_test: 尽管如此 它仍然保留了一份现实主义感
GOOGLE: 尽管如此，它仍然保留了一定程度的现实主义。

en_test: Or photos like these --  both dark and colorful,  but all with a common goal  of retaining the level of realism.
zh_test: 或者像这样的照片 既有暗色也有彩色 但是其目的都是 为了保留一份现实主义感
GOOGLE: 或者像这样的照片——深色和彩色的，但都有一个共同的目标：保持真实感。

en_test: When I say realism,  I mean photo-realism.
zh_test: 我说的现实主义 指的是照片的现实主义
GOOGLE: 当我说现实主义时，我指的是照片写实主义。

en_test: Because, of course,  it's not something you can capture really,  but I always want it to look like it could have been captured somehow  as a photograph.
zh_test: 因为这的确 不是你可以真正抓住的东西 但是我总想让它看起来像是可以用某种方式 被抓拍下来一样
GOOGLE: 因为，当然，它不是你可以真正捕捉到的东西，但我总是希望它看起来像是可以以某种方式捕捉到的照片。

en_test: Photos where you will need a brief moment to think  to figure out the trick.
zh_test: 这些照片需要你能够快速 找出它们背后的技巧
GOOGLE: 您需要短暂思考才能找出窍门的照片。

en_test: So it's more about capturing an idea  than about capturing a moment really.
zh_test: 所以更注重的是捕捉一个灵感 而不是捕捉一个真实存在的瞬间
GOOGLE: 因此，更多的是捕捉一个想法，而不是捕捉一个真正的时刻。

en_test: But what's the trick  that makes it look realistic?
zh_test: 但是使这些照片看起来 很写实的技巧是什么呢？
GOOGLE: 但让它看起来逼真的技巧是什么？

en_test: Is it something about the details  or the colors?
zh_test: 是关于细节？ 还是关于色彩？
GOOGLE: 与细节或颜色有关吗？

en_test: Is it something about the light?
zh_test: 还是关于光线？
GOOGLE: 是不是跟光有关？

en_test: What creates the illusion?
zh_test: 是什么促成了这种幻觉？
GOOGLE: 是什么造成了这种错觉？

en_test: Sometimes the perspective is the illusion.
zh_test: 有时候不同的视角造成不同的幻觉
GOOGLE: 有时，观点是幻觉。

en_test: But in the end, it comes down to how we interpret the world  and how it can be realized on a two-dimensional surface.
zh_test: 但最终，还是要归结于我们如何理解这个世界 以及这种理解如何在一个二维空间得以体现
GOOGLE: 但最终，这取决于我们如何解释世界以及如何在二维表面上实现世界。

en_test: It's not really what is realistic,  it's what we think looks realistic really.
zh_test: 这并不是关于什么是真的 而是关于我们认为什么看起来像是真的
GOOGLE: 这并不是真正的现实，而是我们认为看起来真实的东西。

en_test: So I think the basics  are quite simple.
zh_test: 所以我认为这些基本原理 其实很简单
GOOGLE: 所以我认为基础知识非常简单。

en_test: I just see it as a puzzle of reality  where you can take different pieces of reality and put it together  to create alternate reality.
zh_test: 我把它看做是现实世界的一个拼图 在这里你可以把现实世界的不同片段拼凑起来 创造另一种真实
GOOGLE: 我只是将其视为现实的谜题，你可以将不同的现实片段组合在一起以创建替代现实。

en_test: And let me show you a simple example.
zh_test: 让我来举个简单的例子
GOOGLE: 让我向您展示一个简单的例子。

en_test: Here we have three perfectly imaginable physical objects,  something we all can relate to living in a three-dimensional world.
zh_test: 这里有三个完全可想象到并真实存在的物体 我们可以在现实的三维世界里找到它们
GOOGLE: 这里我们有三个完全可以想象的物理对象，我们都可以将其与生活在三维世界中联系起来。

en_test: But combined in a certain way,  they can create something that still looks three-dimensional,  like it could exist.
zh_test: 但若将这些物体用某种方式组合起来 就可以创造出视觉上依然是三维的物体 就好像它是会存在的
GOOGLE: 但以某种方式结合起来，它们可以创造出看起来仍然是三维的东西，就像它可能存在一样。

en_test: But at the same time, we know it can't.
zh_test: 但是同时我们很清楚它不可能存在
GOOGLE: 但与此同时，我们知道这是不可能的。

en_test: So we trick our brains,  because our brain simply doesn't accept the fact  that it doesn't really make sense.
zh_test: 就这样我们骗了自己的大脑 因为大脑就是不肯接受 这个物体其实并不存在这一事实
GOOGLE: 所以我们欺骗了我们的大脑，因为我们的大脑根本不接受这样的事实：它确实没有意义。

en_test: with combining photographs.
zh_test: 组合照片
GOOGLE: 结合照片。

en_test: It's just really about combining different realities.
zh_test: 也是如此 确实只是把不同的现实画面组合起来
GOOGLE: 这实际上就是将不同的现实结合起来。

en_test: So the things that make a photograph look realistic,  I think it's the things that we don't even think about,  the things all around us in our daily lives.
zh_test: 所以使一张照片看起来逼真的事物 是那些我们平时甚至不会去想 但在日常生活中随处可见的东西
GOOGLE: 因此，让照片看起来真实的东西，我认为是我们甚至没有想到的东西，是我们日常生活中周围的东西。

en_test: But when combining photographs,  this is really important to consider,  because otherwise it just looks wrong somehow.
zh_test: 但是当我们组合照片的时候 这点就值得我们着重思考了 否则它看起来就会别扭
GOOGLE: 但在组合照片时，考虑这一点确实很重要，因为否则它看起来就会有点不对劲。

en_test: So I would like to say that there are three simple rules to follow  to achieve a realistic result.
zh_test: 我想说的是我们要遵守三个简单的原则 为了达到一个逼真的效果
GOOGLE: 所以我想说，要达到现实的结果，需要遵循三个简单的规则。

en_test: As you can see, these images aren't really special.
zh_test: 你们看，这些图像并不特别
GOOGLE: 正如您所看到的，这些图像并不是很特别。

en_test: But combined, they can create something like this.
zh_test: 但是组合起来，它们就可以创造出这样的画面
GOOGLE: 但结合起来，他们可以创造出这样的东西。

en_test: So the first rule is that photos combined  should have the same perspective.
zh_test: 所以第一原则就是所有被组合的照片 都展现同样的视角
GOOGLE: 所以第一条规则是组合的照片应该具有相同的视角。

en_test: Secondly, photos combined  should have the same type of light.
zh_test: 第二，被组合的照片 还要有相同的光线
GOOGLE: 其次，组合的照片应该具有相同类型的光线。

en_test: And these two images both fulfill these two requirements --  shot at the same height and in the same type of light.

zh_test: 我现在工作就是自己设计电脑， 我知道用来设计电脑的 这些机制 不可能存在， 要是没有近期电脑的进步。
GOOGLE: 现在我以设计计算机为生，我知道如果没有计算机的最新进展，我用来设计计算机的机制是不可能的。

en_test: So right now, what I do  is I design objects at such complexity  that it's really impossible for me to design them in the traditional sense.
zh_test: 现在，我做的 是设计复杂到 不可能从传统意义上设计的物体。
GOOGLE: 所以现在，我所做的就是设计如此复杂的对象，以至于我实际上不可能以传统意义上的方式设计它们。

en_test: I don't know what every transistor in the connection machine does.
zh_test: 我不知道连接机器上每个电晶体的作用。
GOOGLE: 我不知道连接机器中每个晶体管的作用。

en_test: There are billions of them.
zh_test: 有几十亿电晶体。
GOOGLE: 它们的数量有数十亿。

en_test: Instead, what I do  and what the designers at Thinking Machines do  is we think at some level of abstraction  and then we hand it to the machine  and the machine takes it beyond what we could ever do,  much farther and faster than we could ever do.
zh_test: 实际上，我所做的 思考机器的设计师们做的， 我们认为是为某种程度的资讯抽取， 然后把它传给机器 而机器把它运用到超出我们所能做的范围， 而且比我们从前所做的更深远更快。
GOOGLE: 相反，我和 Thinking Machines 的设计师所做的就是在某种抽象层面上进行思考，然后将其交给机器，机器将其超越我们所能做到的范围，比我们所能做到的更远、更快。 。

en_test: And in fact, sometimes it takes it by methods  that we don't quite even understand.
zh_test: 实际上，有时候它采用的方法 我们并不很懂。
GOOGLE: 事实上，有时它通过我们甚至不太理解的方法来获取它。

en_test: One method that's particularly interesting  that I've been using a lot lately  is evolution itself.
zh_test: 有个尤其有趣 我最近一直在用的 就是进化本身。
GOOGLE: 我最近经常使用的一种特别有趣的方法是进化本身。

en_test: So what we do  is we put inside the machine  a process of evolution  that takes place on the microsecond time scale.
zh_test: 我们做的就是 在机器里 放入一个进化进程， 这个进程在微妙时间跨度上就能发生。
GOOGLE: 所以我们所做的就是在机器内部放入一个在微秒时间尺度上发生的进化过程。

en_test: So for example,  in the most extreme cases,  we can actually evolve a program  by starting out with random sequences of instructions.
zh_test: 比如， 大部分极端情况下， 我们实际上能 通过从随机的指令序列开始进化一个程式。

en_test: Say, "Computer, would you please make  a hundred million random sequences of instructions.
zh_test: 说“电脑，请你产生 一亿随机指令序列。
GOOGLE: 说：“计算机，请你制作一亿个随机指令序列。

en_test: Now would you please run all of those random sequences of instructions,  run all of those programs,  and pick out the ones that came closest to doing what I wanted."
zh_test: 现在请你运行所有这些随机指令列， 运行所有程式， 并选出最接近我想要的。”
GOOGLE: 现在请您运行所有这些随机指令序列，运行所有这些程序，并选出最接近我想要的那些程序。”

en_test: So in other words, I define what I wanted.
zh_test: 也就是说，我定义我要什么。
GOOGLE: 换句话说，我定义了我想要的东西。

en_test: Let's say I want to sort numbers,  as a simple example I've done it with.
zh_test: 假设我需要分类资料， 这是个我用它试验过的简单例子。

en_test: So find the programs that come closest to sorting numbers.
zh_test: 找到最接近资料分类的程式。
GOOGLE: 因此，找到最接近数字排序的程序。

en_test: So of course, random sequences of instructions  are very unlikely to sort numbers,  so none of them will really do it.

en_test: But one of them, by luck,  may put two numbers in the right order.

en_test: And I say, "Computer,  would you please now take the 10 percent  of those random sequences that did the best job.
zh_test: 我说，“电脑， 请你现在选出序列中百分之十 完成得最好的。
GOOGLE: 我说：“计算机，现在请您从那些表现最好的随机序列中取出 10%。

en_test: Save those. Kill off the rest.
zh_test: 保存这些。删掉其他的。
GOOGLE: 保存那些。杀掉剩下的。

en_test: And now let's reproduce  the ones that sorted numbers the best.
zh_test: 现在来复制 资料分类得最好的这些。
GOOGLE: 现在让我们重现那些对数字排序最好的。

en_test: And let's reproduce them by a process of recombination  analogous to sex."
zh_test: 以类似交配的重组过程 来复制它们。
GOOGLE: 让我们通过类似于性的重组过程来繁殖它们。”

en_test: Take two programs and they produce children  by exchanging their subroutines,  and the children inherit the traits of the subroutines of the two programs.
zh_test: 取两个程式 交换它们的副程式让它们产生子女， 这些子女继承了两个程式副程式的特征。
GOOGLE: 拿两个程序来说，它们通过交换子程序来产生子程序，并且子程序继承了两个程序的子程序的特征。

en_test: So I've got now a new generation of programs  that are produced by combinations  of the programs that did a little bit better job.
zh_test: 所以我得到新一代的 由组合做的比较好的程式 而产生的程式。
GOOGLE: 所以我现在有了新一代的程序，这些程序是由性能更好一点的程序组合而成的。

en_test: Say, "Please repeat that process."
zh_test: 说，“请重复这个过程。”
GOOGLE: 说：“请重复这个过程。”

en_test: Score them again.
zh_test: 再做一次。
GOOGLE: 再次给他们评分。

en_test: Introduce some mutations perhaps.
zh_test: 可能引入一些突变。
GOOGLE: 也许引入一些突变。

en_test: And try that again and do that for another generation.
zh_test: 再试一次并用在新的一代上。
GOOGLE: 再试一次，为下一代人做同样的事情。

en_test: Well every one of those generations just takes a few milliseconds.
zh_test: 这一代上每个程式只需要几毫秒。
GOOGLE: 好吧，每一代都只需要几毫秒。

en_test: So I can do the equivalent  of millions of years of evolution on that  or in the complicated cases, in a few hours.
zh_test: 所以我在电脑上用几分钟 能做等同于 几百万年的进化过程， 或者，情况复杂时，在几小时内完成。
GOOGLE: 所以我可以在几个小时内完成相当于数百万年的进化，或者在复杂的情况下。

en_test: At the end of that, I end up with programs  that are absolutely perfect at sorting numbers.
zh_test: 结束时，我得到 绝对完美的分类资料的程式。
GOOGLE: 最后，我得到了在数字排序方面绝对完美的程序。

en_test: In fact, they are programs that are much more efficient  than programs I could have ever written by hand.
zh_test: 实际上，这些程式比我手写的 任何程式都要有效率。

en_test: Now if I look at those programs,  I can't tell you how they work.
zh_test: 现在，如果我读这些程式， 我说不出它们怎么工作的。

GOOGLE: 事实上，我知道，我对它们能够完成这项工作非常有信心，因为它们来自数十万个完成这项工作的程序。

zh_test: 事实上，它们的生命就是靠着这工作。

en_test: I was riding in a 747  with Marvin Minsky once,  and he pulls out this card and says, "Oh look. Look at this.
zh_test: 我曾经有一次 和马文·明斯基一起坐747， 他拿出一张卡，说，“看，看这。
GOOGLE: 有一次我和马文·明斯基 (Marvin Minsky) 一起乘坐 747，他拿出这张卡片说：“哦，看。看这个。

en_test: In fact, we know that the engineering process doesn't work very well  when it gets complicated.

zh_test: 我的表现很好， 并以优等的成绩毕业。 当我从医学院出来时， 我觉得 我只要记下和明白了所有的东西 – 或者稍退一步 – 将近所有的东西， 那我犯医疗错误的几率就会微乎其微。

en_test: Over the next few weeks,  I beat myself up  and I experienced for the first time  the unhealthy shame that exists  in our culture of medicine --  where I felt alone, isolated,  not feeling the healthy kind of shame that you feel,  because you can't talk about it with your colleagues.

en_test: You know that healthy kind,  when you betray a secret that a best friend made you promise never to reveal  and then you get busted  and then your best friend confronts you  and you have terrible discussions,  but at the end of it all that sick feeling guides you  and you say, I'll never make that mistake again.

GOOGLE: 事情是这样的。

en_test: In a hospital system  where medical knowledge is doubling  every two or three years, we can't keep up with it.
zh_test: 在一个医疗知识 以两到三年为单位成倍增长的 医院体系中，我们无法紧跟着这些知识的增长。
GOOGLE: 在医院系统中，医学知识每两三年就会翻一番，我们却跟不上。

en_test: Sleep deprivation is absolutely pervasive.
zh_test: 睡眠不足的情形绝对是非常普遍的，
GOOGLE: 睡眠不足绝对是普遍现象。

en_test: We can't get rid of it.
zh_test: 而我们也无法摆脱这个问题。
GOOGLE: 我们无法摆脱它。

en_test: We have our cognitive biases,  so that I can take a perfect history on a patient with chest pain.
zh_test: 我们自己的直觉偏差也会直接影响到我们的结论。 比如说，我可以为一位胸痛的病人记录下完美的病历。
GOOGLE: 我们有认知偏差，因此我可以记录胸痛患者的完美病史。

en_test: Now take the same patient with chest pain,  make them moist and garrulous  and put a little bit of alcohol on their breath,  and suddenly my history is laced with contempt.
zh_test: 但如果这位同样的胸痛的病人 当时胡言乱语 再加上呼吸带着些许的酒精味的话， 我写下的病历便会挟带着些许的轻蔑。
GOOGLE: 现在，拿同一个患有胸痛的病人，让他们变得湿润、多嘴，并在他们的呼吸中加入一点酒精，突然之间，我的历史就充满了蔑视。

en_test: I don't take the same history.
zh_test: 而这份病历便会截然不同。
GOOGLE: 我不接受同样的历史。

en_test: I'm not a robot;  I don't do things the same way each time.
zh_test: 我不是机器人， 不会每次都做同样的事情。
GOOGLE: 我不是机器人；我不会每次都以同样的方式做事。

en_test: And my patients aren't cars;  they don't tell me their symptoms in the same way each time.
zh_test: 我的病患也不是车子， 他们不会每次都用相同的方式去描述他们的症状。
GOOGLE: 我的病人不是汽车，而是汽车。他们每次都不会以同样的方式告诉我他们的症状。

en_test: Given all of that, mistakes are inevitable.
zh_test: 因此错误是无可避免的。
GOOGLE: 考虑到所有这些，错误是不可避免的。

en_test: So if you take the system, as I was taught,  and weed out all the error-prone health professionals,  well there won't be anybody left.
zh_test: 如果真像我被教导的体系那般 赶出所有易出错的医护专业人员， 那么这个领域便不会有人留下。
GOOGLE: 因此，如果你采用这个系统，就像我被教导的那样，并淘汰所有容易出错的卫生专业人员，那么就不会有任何人留下了。

en_test: And you know that business  about people not wanting  to talk about their worst cases?
zh_test: 还有就是关于 人们不愿 谈论他们所犯的最糟糕的错误一事。
GOOGLE: 你知道人们不想谈论他们最坏的情况吗？

en_test: On my show, on "White Coat, Black Art,"  I made it a habit of saying, "Here's my worst mistake,"  I would say to everybody  from paramedics to the chief of cardiac surgery,  "Here's my worst mistake," blah, blah, blah, blah, blah,  "What about yours?" and I would point the microphone towards them.
zh_test: 在我的节目《白袍魔艺》中， 我已经会习惯性地说：“这是我最糟糕的错误”。 我会对从急救医士 到心脏外科首席医师的每个人这么说： “这是我最糟糕的错误，如是，如是。” 然后我会把麦克风递给他们，问：“你呢？”
GOOGLE: 在我的节目“白大褂，黑艺术”中，我习惯说，“这是我最严重的错误，”我会对从护理人员到心脏外科主任的每个人说，“这是我最严重的错误，”等等，等等，等等，“那你的呢？”我会把麦克风指向他们。

en_test: And their pupils would dilate,  they would recoil,  then they would look down and swallow hard  and start to tell me their stories.
zh_test: 此时他们的瞳孔会放大， 他们会退却。 然后他们会看着地上，猛吞着口水 并开始向我倾诉他们的故事。
GOOGLE: 他们的瞳孔会放大，他们会退缩，然后他们会低下头，用力吞咽，开始告诉我他们的故事。

en_test: They want to tell their stories. They want to share their stories.
zh_test: 他们想说他们的故事，他们也想分享他们的故事。
GOOGLE: 他们想讲述他们的故事。他们想分享他们的故事。

en_test: They want to be able to say,  "Look, don't make the same mistake I did."
zh_test: 他们想能够说： “听着，别犯和我一样的错。”
GOOGLE: 他们希望能够说：“听着，不要犯我犯过的同样的错误。”

en_test: What they need is an environment to be able to do that.
zh_test: 他们只是需要一个场合来吐露心声。
GOOGLE: 他们需要的是能够做到这一点的环境。

en_test: What they need is a redefined medical culture.
zh_test: 他们需要的是一个重新定义的医学文化，
GOOGLE: 他们需要的是重新定义的医疗文化。

en_test: And it starts with one physician at a time.
zh_test: 从一位又一位个别的医生开始。
GOOGLE: 一次从一名医生开始。

en_test: The redefined physician is human,  knows she's human,  accepts it, isn't proud of making mistakes,  but strives to learn one thing  from what happened  that she can teach to somebody else.
zh_test: 重新定义过的医生也是人类， 明白她自己是人， 并接受这个事实。她并不觉得犯错误是光荣的， 却可以 从其中学习 并教于他人。
GOOGLE: 重新定义的医生是人，知道自己是人，接受它，并不以犯错误为荣，而是努力从发生的事情中学到一件事，以便她可以教给别人。

en_test: She shares her experience with others.
zh_test: 她会与他人分享她的经验，
GOOGLE: 她与其他人分享她的经验。

en_test: She's supportive when other people talk about their mistakes.
zh_test: 并在别人谈论自己过错的时候给于支持。
GOOGLE: 当其他人谈论他们的错误时，她表示支持。

en_test: And she points out other people's mistakes,  not in a gotcha way,  but in a loving, supportive way  so that everybody can benefit.
zh_test: 她不会有一种落井下石的心态， 而会以一种 可以让每个人都从中受惠的关怀，了解的方式 来指出他人的错误。
GOOGLE: 她指出其他人的错误，不是以一种陷阱的方式，而是以一种充满爱和支持的方式，这样每个人都能受益。

en_test: And she works in a culture of medicine  that acknowledges  that human beings run the system,  and when human beings run the system, they will make mistakes from time to time.
zh_test: 而她所工作的医学文化 承认 整个体系是由人在运作， 而当人在运作一个体系的时候，时不时地错误在所难免。
GOOGLE: 她工作的医学文化承认人类运行这个系统，而当人类运行这个系统时，他们会时不时地犯错误。

en_test: So the system is evolving  to create backups  that make it easier to detect those mistakes  that humans inevitably make  and also fosters in a loving, supportive way  places where everybody who is observing  in the health care system  can actually point out things that could be potential mistakes  and is rewarded for doing so, and especially people like me, when we do make mistakes,  we're rewarded for coming clean.
zh_test: 这样系统才可以不断地进化改革， 产生可以让人更加容易察觉 这些无法避免的错误的 补救方案。 与此同时，我们可以培养一个热心关怀的工作环境， 鼓励每一位 在观察我们的 医疗系统的人 随时指出一些潜在的错误。 尤其是鼓励像我一样的人，当我们犯错后， 我们可以去正面面对并加以改正。
GOOGLE: 因此，该系统正在不断发展，以创建备份，以便更容易地发现人类不可避免地犯的错误，并以一种充满爱心和支持的方式，让每个在医疗保健系统中观察的人都可以实际指出可能是潜在错误的事情。并因此而获得奖励，尤其是像我这样的人，当我们确实犯了错误时，我们会因为坦白而获得奖励。

en_test: My name is Brian Goldman.
zh_test: 我是布莱恩.高德曼，
GOOGLE: 我叫布莱恩·戈德曼。

en_test: I am a redefined physician.
zh_test: 我是一位重新定义后的医生。
GOOGLE: 我是一个重新定义的医生。

en_test: I'm human. I make mistakes.
zh_test: 我是一个人类，我也会犯错。
GOOGLE: 我是人类。我犯错了。

en_test: I'm sorry about that,  but I strive to learn one thing  that I can pass on to other people.
zh_test: 我为此感到抱歉， 但我会尽力从中学习 并教于他人。
GOOGLE: 对此我感到很抱歉，但我努力学习一件可以传授给其他人的东西。

en_test: I still don't know what you think of me,  but I can live with that.
zh_test: 我仍然不知各位如何看待我， 但我想我对此可以接受。
GOOGLE: 我仍然不知道你对我的看法，但我可以忍受。

en_test: And let me close with three words of my own:  I do remember.
zh_test: 最后让我以我自己的三个字做为结语： 我记得。
GOOGLE: 让我用我自己的三个字来结束：我确实记得。

en_test: Do you know how many choices you make  in a typical day?
zh_test: 你知道在日常生活中你平均 每天做多少选择？
GOOGLE: 你知道你一天会做出多少个选择吗？

en_test: Do you know how many choices you make  in typical week?
zh_test: 你知道你平均每周 做多少选择？
GOOGLE: 您知道您通常一周会做出多少选择吗？

en_test: I recently did a survey with over 2,000 Americans,  and the average number of choices  that the typical American reports making  is about 70 in a typical day.
zh_test: 我最近在超过2000美国人中 做了一个调查， 结果显示，一个典型的美国人 平均每天 做70个选择。
GOOGLE: 我最近对 ​​2000 多名美国人进行了一项调查，典型的美国报告平均每天做出的选择数量约为 70 个。

en_test: There was also recently a study done with CEOs  in which they followed CEOs around for a whole week.
zh_test: 另外最近还有一个对于CEO们的研究 科学家们在一星期中跟着CEO们
GOOGLE: 最近还有一项针对首席执行官的研究，他们跟踪首席执行官整整一周。

en_test: And these scientists simply documented all the various tasks  that these CEOs engaged in  and how much time they spent engaging  in making decisions related to these tasks.
zh_test: 然后记录下他们所参与和完成的 各种不同的活动与任务 和他们做的所有与这些任务有关的 决定所用的时间。
GOOGLE: 这些科学家只是简单地记录了这些首席执行官所从事的所有各种任务，以及他们花了多少时间来做出与这些任务相关的决策。

en_test: And they found that the average CEO  engaged in about 139 tasks in a week.
zh_test: 科学家们由此发现，每一个CEO平均 每周参与完成大概139个任务。
GOOGLE: 他们发现，CEO 平均每周处理约 139 项任务。

en_test: Each task was made up of many, many, many sub-choices of course.
zh_test: 当然了，每个任务又都是由许多小的选择构成的。
GOOGLE: 当然，每个任务都由很多很多子选择组成。

en_test: 50 percent of their decisions  were made in nine minutes or less.
zh_test: 这其中50%的决定 都是他们在九分钟甚至更短的时间内做出的。
GOOGLE: 他们 50% 的决定是在九分钟或更短的时间内做出的。

en_test: Only about 12 percent of the decisions  did they make an hour or more of their time.
zh_test: 只有其中百分之十二的决定， 用了他们一小时或更长的时间。
GOOGLE: 只有大约 12% 的决定是他们花了一个小时或更多时间做出的。

en_test: Think about your own choices.
zh_test: 想一想你每天做的选择。
GOOGLE: 想想你自己的选择。

en_test: Do you know how many choices  make it into your nine minute category  versus your one hour category? How well do you think you're doing  at managing those choices?
zh_test: 你知道它们中多少 是“九分钟抉择” 又有多少是一小时的选择？ 在管理这些选择上， 你做的如何？
GOOGLE: 您知道有多少种选择可以进入您的九分钟类别和一小时类别吗？您认为您在管理这些选择方面做得如何？

en_test: Today I want to talk  about one of the biggest modern day choosing problems that we have,  which is the choice overload problem.
zh_test: 今天我要讲一讲 现在社会中我们所面对的最严重的选择问题： 选择过多。
GOOGLE: 今天我想谈谈我们面临的最大的现代选择问题之一，那就是选择过载问题。

en_test: I want to talk about the problem  and some potential solutions.
zh_test: 我想要讲一讲这些问题 与一些可行的解决办法。
GOOGLE: 我想谈谈这个问题和一些可能的解决方案。

en_test: Now as I talk about this problem,  I'm going to have some questions for you  and I'm going to want to know your answers.
zh_test: 我现在先将这个问题， 我要问你们一些问题 然后我希望得到你们的答案。
GOOGLE: 现在，当我谈论这个问题时，我会问你一些问题，我想知道你的答案。

en_test: So when I ask you a question,  since I'm blind,  only raise your hand if you want to burn off some calories.
zh_test: 所以当我问你们一个问题 由于我看不见， 不要举手除非你只是想消耗一下卡路里。
GOOGLE: 所以当我问你问题时，因为我是盲人，所以只有当你想消耗一些卡路里时才举手。

en_test: Otherwise, when I ask you a question,  and if your answer is yes,  I'd like you to clap your hands.
zh_test: （笑声) 否则，当我问你们一个问题， 如果你的答案是：是， 我希望你们可以鼓掌。
GOOGLE: 否则，当我问你一个问题时，如果你的答案是肯定的，我希望你拍手。

en_test: So for my first question for you today:  Are you guys ready to hear about the choice overload problem?
zh_test: 所以，我今天给你们的第一个问题是： 对于选择过多这个问题你们准备好听了么？
GOOGLE: 所以，我今天向你们提出的第一个问题是：你们准备好了解选择过载问题了吗？

en_test: Thank you.
zh_test: （观众鼓掌） 谢谢
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

en_test: So when I was a graduate student at Stanford University,  I used to go to this very, very upscale grocery store;  at least at that time it was truly upscale.
zh_test: 当我还是斯坦福大学的一名本科学生时， 我经常去一个非常高级的杂货店； 至少在当时看来那家店是十分高级的。
GOOGLE: 所以当我在斯坦福大学读研究生的时候，我经常去这家非常非常高档的杂货店；至少在当时确实是高档的。

en_test: It was a store called Draeger's.
zh_test: 它的名字是Draeger‘s。
GOOGLE: 那是一家叫德尔格的商店。

en_test: Now this store, it was almost like going to an amusement park.
zh_test: 去那家店，就像是去游乐园一样。
GOOGLE: 现在这家店，简直就像是去游乐园一样。

en_test: They had 250 different kinds of mustards and vinegars  and over 500 different kinds  of fruits and vegetables  and more than two dozen different kinds of bottled water --  and this was during a time when we actually used to drink tap water.
zh_test: 他们有250种不同的黄芥末和醋 还有超过500中不同种类的 蔬菜和水果 还有超过24中不同的瓶装水 而那是我们还在喝水龙头里的水的年代。
GOOGLE: 他们有 250 种不同的芥末和醋，500 多种不同的水果和蔬菜，还有两打不同的瓶装水——而那是在我们实际上喝自来水的时代。

en_test: I used to love going to this store,  but on one occasion I asked myself,  well how come you never buy anything?
zh_test: 我过去十分喜欢去这家店， 但是有一次我问自己， 为什么你从来都不买东西呢？
GOOGLE: 我以前很喜欢去这家商店，但有一次我问自己，为什么你从不买东西？

en_test: Here's their olive oil aisle.
zh_test: 这是卖橄榄油的过道。
GOOGLE: 这是他们的橄榄油过道。

en_test: They had over 75 different kinds of olive oil,  including those that were in a locked case  that came from thousand-year-old olive trees.
zh_test: 他们有75种以上不同的橄榄油， 包括那些被锁在盒子里 从4000年的橄榄树上取来的油。
GOOGLE: 他们有超过 75 种不同的橄榄油，其中包括来自千年橄榄树的锁着的橄榄油。

en_test: So I one day decided to pay a visit to the manager,  and I asked the manager,  "Is this model of offering people all this choice really working?"
zh_test: 于是有一天我决定去拜访一下这家店的经理， 我问他， “这个给人们所有选择的模型真的有用么？”
GOOGLE: 所以有一天我决定拜访经理，我问经理：“这种为人们提供所有选择的模式真的有效吗？”

en_test: And he pointed to the busloads of tourists  that would show up everyday,  with cameras ready usually.
zh_test: 然后他向我示意了那些每天都会来的 一车一车的 举着相机的游客。
GOOGLE: 他指着每天都会出现的满载游客，通常都准备好了相机。

en_test: We decided to do a little experiment,  and we picked jam for our experiment.
zh_test: 我们决定做一个小实验， 然后选择了果酱作为试验品。
GOOGLE: 我们决定做一个小实验，并选择果酱进行实验。

en_test: Here's their jam aisle.
zh_test: 这是卖果酱的走廊。
GOOGLE: 这是他们的果酱通道。

en_test: They had 348 different kinds of jam.
zh_test: 他们有148种不同的果酱。
GOOGLE: 他们有348种不同的果酱。

en_test: We set up a little tasting booth  right near the entrance of the store.
zh_test: 在店门口的地方 我们摆设了一个小的品尝台。
GOOGLE: 我们在商店入口附近设立了一个小品酒亭。

en_test: We there put out six different flavors of jam  or 24 different flavors of jam,  and we looked at two things:  First, in which case  were people more likely to stop, sample some jam?
zh_test: 我们在那儿摆6种 或24种不同味道的果酱， 然后我们观察了两件事： 第一，人们在哪种情况下 更愿意停下脚步品尝一些果酱？
GOOGLE: 我们推出了六种不同口味的果酱或 24 种不同口味的果酱，我们研究了两件事：首先，在什么情况下人们更有可能停下来品尝一些果酱？

en_test: More people stopped when there were 24, about 60 percent,  than when there were six,  about 40 percent.
zh_test: 相比较下，大部分，约60%的人，在有24种果酱走廊停了脚步， 而当有6种果酱时 只有40%的人。
GOOGLE: 24 人时停下来的人（约 60%）比 6 人时停下来的人（约 40%）要多。

en_test: The next thing we looked at  is in which case were people more likely  to buy a jar of jam.
zh_test: 我们观察的另一件事是： 在人们在哪种情况下更愿意 买一罐果酱
GOOGLE: 我们接下来要考虑的是在哪种情况下人们更有可能购买一罐果酱。

en_test: Now we see the opposite effect.
zh_test: 这时，我们观察到了相反的结果。
GOOGLE: 现在我们看到了相反的效果。

en_test: Of the people who stopped when there were 24,  only three percent of them actually bought a jar of jam.
zh_test: 在那些在有24种果酱时停下的人们中， 只有3%的人真正买了果酱。
GOOGLE: 在 24 人停下来的人中，只有 3% 的人真正买了一罐果酱。

en_test: Of the people who stopped when there were six,  well now we saw that 30 percent of them  actually bought a jar of jam.
zh_test: 而此时，在那些在有6种果酱时停下的人们中， 我们发现有30%的人 买了果酱。
GOOGLE: 在 6 个人就停下来的人中，现在我们发现 30% 的人实际上买了一罐果酱。

en_test: Now if you do the math,  people were at least six times more likely to buy a jar of jam  Now choosing not to buy a jar of jam  is probably good for us --  at least it's good for our waistlines --  but it turns out that this choice overload problem affects us  even in very consequential decisions. We choose not to choose,  even when it goes against our best self-interests.
zh_test: 现在如果你算一下的话， 当人们只有六种选择时， 比有24种时 买果酱的倾向上升了至少六倍 选择不买果酱 也许对我们来说是一件好事儿 至少对我们的水桶腰来说， 但是结果证明过度选择甚至在 非常重要的决定上影响我们。 我们甚至在有悖个人利益的情况下， 宁愿放弃选择。

GOOGLE: 现在我将向您介绍我与 Gur Huberman、Emir Kamenica、Wei Jang 一起进行的一项研究，我们研究了近 100 万美国人在美国大约 650 个计划中的退休储蓄决定。

en_test: So what I want to propose to you today  are four simple techniques --  techniques that we have tested in one way or another  in different research venues --  that you can easily apply  in your businesses.

GOOGLE: 但事实上，我们越来越多地看到的是，如果你愿意削减，去掉那些无关的冗余选项，那么销量就会增加，成本就会降低，选择体验就会改善。

en_test: Which brings me to the second technique  for handling the choice overload problem,  which is concretization.
zh_test: 而这个例子就是我们今天要讲的第二个 处理选择过多的技巧， 具体化。
GOOGLE: 这让我想到了处理选择过载问题的第二种技术，即具体化。

en_test: The one little thing we added  was we asked people  to just think about all the positive things that would happen in your life  By doing that simple thing,  there was an increase in enrollment by 20 percent  and there was an increase in the amount of people willing to save  or the amount that they were willing to put down into their savings account  by four percent.

GOOGLE: 我们添加的一件小事是，我们要求人们思考生活中会发生的所有积极的事情，通过做这件简单的事情，入学人数增加了 20%，并且愿意的人数也增加了储蓄或他们愿意存入储蓄账户的金额的百分之四。

en_test: I have talked about four techniques  for mitigating the problem of choice overload --  cut -- get rid of the extraneous alternatives;  concretize -- make it real;  categorize -- we can handle more categories, less choices;  condition for complexity.
zh_test: 我讲了四种可以减缓过多选择的 技巧- 精简-放弃没有用的选择； 具体化-让选择变得更真实一些； 分类-我们能承受的类别比选择多； 从简入繁。

en_test: So those are the three main attackers:  criminals who do it for the money,  hacktivists like Anonymous  doing it for the protest,  but then the last group are nation states,  governments doing the attacks.

GOOGLE: 因此，这就是三个主要的攻击者：为了钱而进行攻击的犯罪分子，像 Anonymous 这样的黑客活动分子为了抗议而进行的攻击，但最后一组是进行攻击的民族国家和政府。

en_test: And then we look at cases  like what happened in DigiNotar.
zh_test: 我们看一下例子 就像DigiNotar公司发生的。
GOOGLE: 然后我们看看 DigiNotar 中发生的情况。

en_test: This is a prime example of what happens  when governments attack  against their own citizens.
zh_test: 这是政府攻击的 典型例子 来反对自己的民众。
GOOGLE: 这是政府攻击本国公民时所发生情况的一个典型例子。

en_test: DigiNotar is a Certificate Authority  from The Netherlands --  or actually, it was.
zh_test: DigiNotar是荷兰的 一个权威证书 或者说它曾经是。
GOOGLE: DigiNotar 是来自荷兰的证书颁发机构——或者实际上，它曾经是。

en_test: It was running into bankruptcy  last fall  because they were hacked into.
zh_test: 它去年秋天遭遇 破产 因为他们遭到入侵。
GOOGLE: 去年秋天，由于遭到黑客攻击，该公司濒临破产。

en_test: Somebody broke in  and they hacked it thoroughly.
zh_test: 有人闯进去 彻底毁了它。
GOOGLE: 有人闯入，他们彻底入侵了它。

en_test: And I asked last week  in a meeting with Dutch government representatives,  I asked one of the leaders of the team  whether he found plausible  that people died  because of the DigiNotar hack.
zh_test: 我上周 在与荷兰政府代表开会时问过， 我问一位领导 是否他发现有可能 有人会 因为Diginotar攻击而死亡。

en_test: And his answer was yes.
zh_test: 他的回答是肯定的。
GOOGLE: 他的回答是肯定的。

en_test: So how do people die  as the result of a hack like this?
zh_test: 那么，究竟如何人们的死亡 归咎于这样一个攻击呢？
GOOGLE: 那么，人们是如何因此类黑客攻击而死亡的呢？

en_test: Well DigiNotar is a C.A.
zh_test: DigiNotar是一个权威证书。
GOOGLE: 那么 DigiNotar 是一个 C.A.

en_test: They sell certificates.
zh_test: 他们卖证书。
GOOGLE: 他们出售证书。

zh_test: 你用证书做什么？
GOOGLE: 你用证书做什么？

en_test: Well you need a certificate  if you have a website that has https,  SSL encrypted services,  services like Gmail.
zh_test: 你需要证书的情况会是 你有一个有https的网站， SSL加密服务， 类似Gmail的服务。
GOOGLE: 如果您的网站具有 https、SSL 加密服务、Gmail 等服务，则您需要证书。

en_test: Now we all, or a big part of us,  use Gmail or one of their competitors,  but these services are especially popular  in totalitarian states  like Iran,  where dissidents  use foreign services like Gmail  because they know they are more trustworthy than the local services  and they are encrypted over SSL connections,  so the local government can't snoop  on their discussions.
zh_test: 当今我们所有人或大部分人， 使用Gmail或它对手们中的任何一家， 这些服务在极权主义国家 尤其流行 比如伊朗， 持异议者 使用诸如Gmail的国外服务 因为他们知道这些比当地的服务更可靠 他们通过SSL的连接加密， 所以当地政府窥探不到 他们的讨论。
GOOGLE: 现在，我们所有人或我们中的很大一部分人都使用 Gmail 或其竞争对手之一，但这些服务在伊朗等极权国家尤其受欢迎，那里的持不同政见者使用 Gmail 等外国服务，因为他们知道这些服务比本地服务更值得信赖，并且它们通过 SSL 连接进行加密，因此当地政府无法窥探他们的讨论。

en_test: Except they can if they hack into a foreign C.A.

GOOGLE: 除非他们可以侵入外国CA。

en_test: and issue rogue certificates.

GOOGLE: 并颁发流氓证书。

GOOGLE: 阿拉伯之春以及埃及等地正在发生的事情又如何呢？

en_test: Well in Egypt,  the rioters looted the headquarters  of the Egyptian secret police  in April 2011,  and when they were looting the building they found lots of papers.
zh_test: 在埃及， 暴徒们洗劫了 埃及秘密警察的总部 那是2011年4月， 他们洗劫时找到很多文件。
GOOGLE: 在埃及，2011年4月，暴徒抢劫了埃及秘密警察总部，他们在抢劫大楼时发现了大量文件。

en_test: Among those papers,  was this binder entitled "FINFISHER."
zh_test: 在这些文件中， 有一个名叫FINFISHER的夹子。
GOOGLE: 在这些文件中，有一本题为“FINFISHER”的活页夹。

en_test: And within that binder were notes  from a company based in Germany  which had sold the Egyptian government  a set of tools  for intercepting --  and in very large scale --  all the communication of the citizens of the country.
zh_test: 夹子中有些笔记 是来自一家德国公司 这家公司卖给埃及政府 一套工具 用来截取-- 很大比例是 国家公众的所有通信。
GOOGLE: 活页夹里有一家德国公司的笔记，该公司向埃及政府出售了一套工具，用于大规模拦截该国公民的所有通信。

en_test: They had sold this tool  for 280,000 Euros to the Egyptian government.
zh_test: 他们把这套工具 以28万欧元卖给埃及政府。
GOOGLE: 他们以 28 万欧元的价格将这个工具卖给了埃及政府。

en_test: The company headquarters are right here.
zh_test: 公司的总部就在那里。
GOOGLE: 公司总部就在这里。

en_test: So Western governments  are providing totalitarian governments with tools  to do this against their own citizens.
zh_test: 所以，西方政府 给极权政府提供工具 来反对他们自己的民众。
GOOGLE: 因此，西方政府正在向极权政府提供针对本国公民的工具。

en_test: But Western governments are doing it to themselves as well.
zh_test: 但西方政府也同样对他们自己这样做。
GOOGLE: 但西方政府也在对自己这样做。

en_test: For example, in Germany,  just a couple of weeks ago  the so-called State Trojan was found,  which was a trojan  used by German government officials  to investigate their own citizens.
zh_test: 比如，在德国， 就是几周前 发现一个叫Scuinst Trojan 的 木马病毒 被德国政府官方用来 调查他们自己的民众。
GOOGLE: 例如，在德国，就在几周前，发现了所谓的国家木马，这是德国政府官员用来调查本国公民的木马。

en_test: If you are a suspect in a criminal case,  well it's pretty obvious, your phone will be tapped.
zh_test: 如果你是一宗刑事案件的嫌疑， 很显然，你的电话会被监听。
GOOGLE: 如果您是刑事案件的嫌疑人，那么很明显，您的电话将被窃听。

en_test: But today, it goes beyond that.
zh_test: 可是今天，事情已经超越了。
GOOGLE: 但今天，它的意义远不止于此。

en_test: They will tap your Internet connection.
zh_test: 他们会监视你的网络连接。
GOOGLE: 他们会窃听您的互联网连接。

en_test: They will even use tools like State Trojan  to infect your computer with a trojan,  which enables them  to watch all your communication,  to listen to your online discussions,  to collect your passwords.
zh_test: 他们会用类似Scuinst Trojan的工具 用一个木马来感染你的电脑， 这样就让他们 监视你所有的通信， 监听你的在线讨论， 收集你的密码。
GOOGLE: 他们甚至会使用 State Trojan 等工具来感染您的计算机，从而使他们能够监视您的所有通信、收听您的在线讨论、收集您的密码。

en_test: Now when we think deeper  about things like these,  the obvious response from people should be  that, "Okay, that sounds bad,  but that doesn't really affect me because I'm a legal citizen.
zh_test: 当我们更深的想一下 这些事情， 人们的反应显然应是 “对啊，听起来很糟糕， 但因为我是合法公民，也不会真正影响我啦。

en_test: Why should I worry?
zh_test: 为什么我要担忧呢？
GOOGLE: 我为什么要担心？

en_test: Because I have nothing to hide."
zh_test: 我没有什么可隐藏的。”
GOOGLE: 因为我没有什么可隐瞒的。”

en_test: And this is an argument,  which doesn't make sense.
zh_test: 这就是争论所在， 没什么道理。
GOOGLE: 这是一个争论，没有任何意义。

en_test: Privacy is implied.
zh_test: 隐私是不言而喻。
GOOGLE: 隐私是隐含的。

en_test: Privacy is not up for discussion.
zh_test: 隐私用不着讨论。
GOOGLE: 隐私不值得讨论。

en_test: This is not a question  between privacy  against security.
zh_test: 这不是个 隐私 反对安全的问题。

en_test: It's a question of freedom  against control.
zh_test: 而是一个 自由反对管制的问题。
GOOGLE: 这是一个反对控制的自由问题。

en_test: And while we might trust our governments  any right we give away will be given away for good.

GOOGLE: 尽管我们可能相信我们的政府，但我们放弃的任何权利都将永远放弃。

en_test: And do we trust, do we blindly trust,  any future government,  a government we might have  50 years from now?

GOOGLE: 我们是否相信，我们是否盲目地相信任何未来的政府，一个我们可能在 50 年后拥有的政府？

en_test: And these are the questions  that we have to worry about for the next 50 years.
zh_test: 这些就是我们要为下一个50年 而担忧的问题。
GOOGLE: 而这些都是我们未来50年不得不担心的问题。

en_test: This is where I live. I live in Kenya,  at the south parts of the Nairobi National Park.
zh_test: 这是我所生活的地方，肯尼亚， 在内罗毕国家公园的南部
GOOGLE: 这就是我住的地方。我住在肯尼亚，内罗毕国家公园的南部。

en_test: Those are my dad's cows at the back,  and behind the cows,  that's the Nairobi National Park.
zh_test: 在我的身后是我父亲的奶牛 在奶牛的后边 就是内罗毕国家公园
GOOGLE: 后面是我爸爸的牛，牛后面就是内罗毕国家公园。

en_test: Nairobi National Park is not fenced in the south widely,  which means wild animals like zebras  migrate out of the park freely.

GOOGLE: 内罗毕国家公园南部没有广泛的围栏，这意味着斑马等野生动物可以自由迁徙出公园。

en_test: So predators like lions follow them,  and this is what they do.
zh_test: 所以像狮子这样的捕食者会跟随他们 这就是他们的所作所为，
GOOGLE: 所以像狮子这样的掠食者会跟随他们，这就是他们所做的。

en_test: They kill our livestock.
zh_test: 他们捕杀了我们的家畜。
GOOGLE: 他们杀死我们的牲畜。

en_test: This is one of the cows which was killed at night,  and I just woke up in the morning and I found it dead,  and I felt so bad,  because it was the only bull we had.
zh_test: 这就是其中一只在夜晚被杀害的奶牛 我在早晨醒来时就发现它已经死了， 我的心情槽透了， 因为这是我家里唯一的公牛
GOOGLE: 这是一头晚上被杀的牛，早上我刚醒来，发现它死了，我感觉很糟糕，因为它是我们唯一的公牛。

en_test: My community, the Maasai, we believe that  we came from heaven with all our animals and all the land  for herding them, and that's why we value them so much.
zh_test: 我们马赛族的人相信 我们是带着我们的动物和家园从天堂而来 然后放牧、生活，这就是我们为什么如此重视它们。

en_test: So I grew up hating lions so much.
zh_test: 所以我逐渐地变得十分厌恶狮子
GOOGLE: 所以我从小就非常讨厌狮子。

zh_test: 莫兰人都是勇士 他们保护我们的家族和牲畜 但是他们同样对这个问题感到沮丧，素手无策
GOOGLE: 莫兰人是保护我们社区和牲畜的战士，他们也对这个问题感到不安。

en_test: So they kill the lions.
zh_test: 所以他们决定杀了这些狮子
GOOGLE: 所以他们杀死了狮子。

en_test: It's one of the six lions which were killed in Nairobi.
zh_test: 这是他们在内罗毕国家公园杀的六个狮子中的其中一个
GOOGLE: 它是在内罗毕被杀的六头狮子之一。

en_test: And I think this is why the Nairobi National Park lions are few.
zh_test: 我想这就是内罗毕公园的狮子会那么少的原因。
GOOGLE: 我认为这就是内罗毕国家公园狮子很少的原因。

en_test: So a boy, from six to nine years old, in my community  is responsible for his dad's cows,  and that's the same thing which happened to me.
zh_test: 在我们家族，凡是六到九岁的男孩 都有肩负着保卫他们父亲奶牛的责任， 同样的事业发生在我身上。
GOOGLE: 因此，在我的社区中，一个六到九岁的男孩负责照顾他父亲的奶牛，这也发生在我身上。

en_test: So I had to find a way of solving this problem.
zh_test: 所以我必须找到一个解决问题的方法。
GOOGLE: 所以我必须找到解决这个问题的方法。

en_test: And the first idea I got was to use fire,  because I thought lions were scared of fire.
zh_test: 我想到的第一个办法是使用火， 因为我知道狮子们都惧怕火。
GOOGLE: 我的第一个想法是使用火，因为我认为狮子害怕火。

en_test: But I came to realize that that didn't really help,  because it was even helping the lions  to see through the cowshed.
zh_test: 但我又意识到这并没有什么成效， 反倒还帮助了狮子 看到了我们的牛棚。
GOOGLE: 但我开始意识到这并没有真正的帮助，因为它甚至可以帮助狮子看穿牛棚。

en_test: So I didn't give up. I continued.
zh_test: 但我并没有因此放弃，我坚持不懈着
GOOGLE: 所以我没有放弃。我继续说道。

en_test: And a second idea I got was  to use a scarecrow.
zh_test: 于是有了第二个办法： 利用稻草人。
GOOGLE: 我的第二个想法是使用稻草人。

en_test: I was trying to trick the lions  [into thinking] that I was standing near the cowshed.
zh_test: 我想要欺骗狮子 让它们误以为是我站在牛舍旁边。
GOOGLE: 我试图欺骗狮子[让它们误以为]我站在牛棚附近。

en_test: But lions are very clever.   They will come the first day and they see the scarecrow, and they go back,  but the second day, they'll come and they say,  this thing is not moving here, it's always here.   So he jumps in and kills the animals.
zh_test: 但是狮子十分聪明。 他们第一天来时看到了稻草人，然后就回去了。 但是第二天，他们会再来并且说： 这个东西从没动过，他一直呆在这儿 所以他们又跳进来，杀死了动物。
GOOGLE: 但狮子非常聪明。他们第一天来，看到稻草人，然后就回去，但是第二天，他们来了，他们说，这个东西不会在这里移动，它总是在这里。于是他跳进去杀死了这些动物。

en_test: So one night, I was walking around the cowshed with a torch,  and that day, the lions didn't come.
zh_test: 有一天晚上，我拿着手电筒在牛棚边走动， 那天晚上，狮子并没有来。
GOOGLE: 所以有一天晚上，我拿着火把在牛棚周围走来走去，那天，狮子没有来。

en_test: And I discovered that lions are afraid of a moving light.
zh_test: 我开始意识到狮子们会害怕移动的光。
GOOGLE: 我发现狮子害怕移动的光。

en_test: So I had an idea.
zh_test: 所以我又有了个主意。
GOOGLE: 所以我有一个主意。

en_test: Since I was a small boy,  I used to work in my room for the whole day,  and I even took apart my mom's new radio,  and that day she almost killed me,  but I learned a lot about electronics.   So I got an old car battery,  an indicator box. It's a small device found in a motorcycle,  and it helps motorists when they want to turn right or left. It blinks.
zh_test: 因为我当时是个小孩子， 我可以一整天不干别的，在自己的房间里鼓捣一天， 我甚至把我妈妈新买的收音机拆得七零八落， 那天她差点杀了我， 尽管如此，我学到了许多关于电子的知识。 所以我找到了一个旧的车用蓄电池， 一个指示器。这是一个从摩托车中找到的小装备， 用来控制摩托车的转向灯，能够让灯闪烁。
GOOGLE: 从小我就在自己的房间里工作了一整天，甚至拆开了妈妈的新收音机，那天她差点杀了我，但我学到了很多关于电子学的知识。所以我得到了一个旧汽车电池，一个指示器盒。这是摩托车上的一个小型装置，当驾车者想要右转或左转时，它可以为他们提供帮助。它闪烁。

en_test: And I got a switch where I can switch on the lights, on and off.
zh_test: 同时我找到了一个开关，可以控制灯的亮灭。
GOOGLE: 我有一个开关，可以打开和关闭灯。

en_test: And that's a small torch from a broken flashlight.
zh_test: 灯泡来自于一个坏掉的手电筒。
GOOGLE: 那是用坏掉的手电筒做成的小手电筒。

en_test: So I set up everything.
zh_test: 一切都准备好了。
GOOGLE: 所以我设置了一切。

en_test: As you can see, the solar panel charges the battery,  and the battery supplies the power  to the small indicator box. I call it a transformer.
zh_test: 就如你所见，由太阳能接收板来给电池充电， 再由电池来指示器给提供能量 我把这个叫做“变压器”，
GOOGLE: 可以看到，太阳能电池板给电池充电，电池给小指示灯盒供电。我称之为变压器。

en_test: And the indicator box makes the lights flash.
zh_test: 这个指示器又会使光线闪动，
GOOGLE: 并且指示灯盒使灯闪烁。

en_test: As you can see, the bulbs face outside,  because that's where the lions come from.
zh_test: 你可以看到，这个电灯泡是朝外的， 因为狮子是从那儿过来的。
GOOGLE: 正如你所看到的，灯泡朝外，因为那是狮子的来源。

en_test: And that's how it looks to lions when they come at night.
zh_test: 当狮子晚上走近的时候看到的就是这个样子。
GOOGLE: 这就是狮子晚上来时的样子。

en_test: The lights flash and trick  the lions into thinking I was walking around the cowshed,  but I was sleeping in my bed.
zh_test: 这个灯光一闪动就会使狮子受到欺骗 它们会以为是我在牛棚附近走动， 但实际上，此时的我正在自己的床上做着春秋大梦。
GOOGLE: 灯光闪烁，让狮子以为我在牛棚里走来走去，但其实我正在床上睡觉。

en_test: Thanks.
zh_test: 谢谢。

en_test: Even after learning a new language and getting a job,  their whole world can be turned upside down in an instant.

GOOGLE: 即使学习了一门新语言并找到了工作，他们的整个世界也会瞬间天翻地覆。

en_test: That's why, after 10 years of hiding my identity,  I decided to risk going to South Korea.

en_test: And I started a new life yet again.
zh_test: 就这样，我又一次开始了新的生活。
GOOGLE: 而我又开始了新的生活。

en_test: Settling down in South Korea  was a lot more challenging than I had expected.
zh_test: 在韩国定居比我想象的更加困难 并且充满了挑战。

en_test: English was so important in South Korea,  so I had to start learning my third language.
zh_test: 英语在韩国太重要了， 所以我必须要开始学习第三门语言——英语。

en_test: Also, I realized there was a wide gap between North and South.
zh_test: 此外，我意识到， 韩国与朝鲜之间有巨大的差异。
GOOGLE: 我也意识到南北之间的差距很大。

en_test: We are all Korean, but inside,  we have become very different, due to 67 years of division.
zh_test: 尽管我们都是朝鲜族人， 但是我们的内在已经变得非常不同了， 由于67年的分裂。

en_test: I even went through an identity crisis.
zh_test: 我甚至经历了自我身份的质疑。
GOOGLE: 我什至经历过身份危机。

en_test: Am I South Korean or North Korean?
zh_test: 我到底是韩国人还是朝鲜人？
GOOGLE: 我是韩国人还是朝鲜人？

en_test: Where am I from? Who am I?
zh_test: 我从哪里来？我是谁？
GOOGLE: 我从哪里来？我是谁？

en_test: Suddenly, there was no country I could proudly call my own.
zh_test: 突然间，我似乎无法骄傲地称任何一个国家 为我自己的国家。
GOOGLE: 突然之间，没有一个国家可以让我自豪地称之为自己的国家了。

en_test: Even though adjusting to life in South Korea was not easy,  I made a plan -- I started studying for the university entrance exam.
zh_test: 尽管适应韩国的生活并不是易事， 但是我还是决定 准备大学入学考试。
GOOGLE: 尽管适应韩国的生活并不容易，但我还是制定了一个计划——开始准备高考。

en_test: Just as I was starting to get used to my new life,  I received a shocking phone call.
zh_test: 就在我刚开始习惯新生活不久， 我接到了一个令人震惊的电话。
GOOGLE: 正当我开始适应新的生活时，我接到了一个令人震惊的电话。

en_test: The North Korean authorities intercepted some money  that I sent to my family,  and, as a punishment, my family was going to be forcibly removed  to a desolate location in the countryside.
zh_test: 朝鲜政府拦截了 我寄回家的部分钱款， 作为惩罚，我的家人要被 强制搬走， 搬到农村的一个偏僻的地方去。
GOOGLE: 朝鲜当局截获了我寄给家人的一些钱，作为惩罚，我的家人将被强行迁移到农村的一个荒凉地方。

en_test: They had to get out quickly.
zh_test: 他们必须要赶快逃走，
GOOGLE: 他们必须赶快出去。

en_test: So I started planning how to help them escape.
zh_test: 所以我开始计划帮助他们逃脱。
GOOGLE: 于是我开始计划如何帮助他们逃脱。

en_test: North Koreans have to travel incredible distances  on the path to freedom.
zh_test: 朝鲜人通往自由的道路 是如此遥不可及。
GOOGLE: 朝鲜人在通往自由的道路上必须走过令人难以置信的距离。

en_test: It's almost impossible to cross the border  between North Korea and South Korea.
zh_test: 要想穿越朝鲜与韩国 的边境几乎是不可能的，
GOOGLE: 跨越朝鲜和韩国之间的边界几乎是不可能的。

en_test: So, ironically, I took a flight back to China  and headed toward the North Korean border.
zh_test: 所以，颇具讽刺意味的是，我坐飞机到了中国 然后再前往中朝边境。
GOOGLE: 因此，具有讽刺意味的是，我乘飞机返回中国，前往朝鲜边境。

en_test: Since my family couldn't speak Chinese,  I had to guide them somehow through more than 2,000 miles  in China, and then into Southeast Asia.
zh_test: 因为我的家人不懂中文， 所以我得帮助他们 在中国穿越2000多公里， 进入东南亚。
GOOGLE: 由于我的家人不会说中文，我不得不以某种方式引导他们在中国穿越2000多英里，然后进入东南亚。

en_test: The journey by bus took one week,  and we were almost caught several times.
zh_test: 我们在巴士上的旅途有一周之久， 好几次都差点被抓住。
GOOGLE: 乘巴士的旅程花了一周的时间，有几次我们差点被抓住。

en_test: One time, our bus was stopped and boarded by a Chinese police officer.
zh_test: 又一次，我们坐的巴士被拦下了， 一个中国警官上了车，
GOOGLE: 有一次，我们的公共汽车被一名中国警察拦截并登上。

en_test: He took everyone's I.D. cards,  and he started asking them questions.
zh_test: 他查看每个人的身份证， 并开始问问题。
GOOGLE: 他拿走了每个人的身份证。卡片，然后他开始问他们问题。

en_test: Since my family couldn't understand Chinese,  I thought my family was going to be arrested.
zh_test: 因为我的家人不懂中文， 我害怕他们会被抓住。
GOOGLE: 由于我的家人不懂中文，我以为我的家人会被逮捕。

en_test: As the Chinese officer approached my family,  I impulsively stood up, and I told him  that these are deaf and dumb people that I was chaperoning.
zh_test: 所以当那个中国警官快检查到我家人时， 我本能地站起来告诉他 这几位是聋哑人， 我是他们的监护人。
GOOGLE: 当中国官员走近我的家人时，我冲动地站起来，告诉他我所陪同的这些人都是又聋又哑的人。

en_test: He looked at me suspiciously,  but luckily, he believed me.
zh_test: 他怀疑地看着我， 但幸运地，他相信了我的话。
GOOGLE: 他疑惑地看着我，但幸运的是，他相信了我。

en_test: We made it all the way to the border of Laos.
zh_test: 就这样我们一路来到了老挝，
GOOGLE: 我们一路到达老挝边境。

en_test: But I had to spend almost all my money  to bribe the border guards in Laos.
zh_test: 但是我却要几乎花光全部积蓄来 贿赂老挝的边境警察。
GOOGLE: 但我不得不花掉几乎所有的钱来贿赂老挝的边防人员。

en_test: But even after we got past the border,  my family was arrested and jailed for illegal border crossing.
zh_test: 而且即使我们过了这一关， 我的家人还是因非法入境， 被捕入狱了。
GOOGLE: 但即使我们过了边境，我的家人也因非法越境而被捕入狱。

en_test: After I paid the fine and bribe,  my family was released in one month.
zh_test: 在我交了罚金和贿赂用的钱后， 我的家人一个月后被释放了，
GOOGLE: 交完罚款和贿赂后，一个月后我一家人就被释放了。

en_test: But soon after, my family was arrested and jailed again,  in the capital of Laos.
zh_test: 但不久后，他们在老挝的首都， 又被抓起来了。
GOOGLE: 但不久之后，我的家人在老挝首都再次被捕入狱。

en_test: This was one of the lowest points in my life.
zh_test: 那是我人生中最低落的时刻之一。
GOOGLE: 这是我一生中的最低点之一。

en_test: I did everything to get my family to freedom,  and we came so close,  but my family was thrown in jail,  just a short distance from the South Korean embassy.
zh_test: 我为了让我的家人获得自由，倾尽所能 然而就在快要成功的时候， 家人却又要经历牢狱之灾， 并且这个监狱离朝鲜大使馆并不远。
GOOGLE: 我竭尽全力让我的家人获得自由，我们是如此接近，但我的家人却被关进了监狱，离韩国大使馆不远。

en_test: I went back and forth between the immigration office  and the police station,  desperately trying to get my family out.
zh_test: 我在移民局和警察局， 来来回回折腾了好多次， 绝望地努力着，希望能把他们救出来，
GOOGLE: 我在移民局和警察局之间来回奔波，拼命想把家人救出来。

en_test: but I didn't have enough money to pay a bribe or fine anymore.
zh_test: 但是我已没有足够的钱 来贿赂或是交罚金了。
GOOGLE: 但我已经没有足够的钱去行贿或罚款了。

en_test: I lost all hope.
zh_test: 我心灰意冷。
GOOGLE: 我失去了所有的希望。

en_test: At that moment, I heard one man's voice ask me,  "What's wrong?"
zh_test: 就在这时，我听见一个人问我， “怎么了？” 我很是诧异，
GOOGLE: 就在这时，我听到一个男人的声音问我：“怎么了？”

en_test: I was so surprised that a total stranger cared enough to ask.
zh_test: 一个完全的陌生人这样关切地询问。
GOOGLE: 我很惊讶一个完全陌生的人竟然如此关心地询问。

en_test: In my broken English, and with a dictionary,  I explained the situation, and without hesitating,  the man went to the ATM,  and he paid the rest of the money for my family,  and two other North Koreans to get out of jail.
zh_test: 我用蹩脚的英文再借助字典， 毫不犹豫地向那个人解释了情况。 那个人走去ATM机， 为我的家人以及另两个朝鲜人 支付了出狱的剩余的所有费用。
GOOGLE: 我用蹩脚的英语和一本字典解释了情况，那个人毫不犹豫地走向自动取款机，为我的家人和另外两个朝鲜人支付了剩余的钱，让他们出狱。

en_test: I thanked him with all my heart, and I asked him,  "Why are you helping me?"
zh_test: 我真心地感谢他，并问道， “你为什么要帮助我？”
GOOGLE: 我衷心感谢他，并问他：“你为什么要帮我？”

en_test: "I'm not helping you," he said.
zh_test: “我并不是在帮助你，”他回答，
GOOGLE: “我不是在帮你，”他说。

en_test: "I'm helping the North Korean people."
zh_test: “我是在帮助朝鲜的人们。“
GOOGLE: “我正在帮助朝鲜人民。”

en_test: I realized that this was a symbolic moment in my life.
zh_test: 我当时就意识到那是我人生很有象征意义的一个时刻。
GOOGLE: 我意识到这是我生命中具有象征意义的时刻。

en_test: The kind stranger symbolized new hope for me and the North Korean people,  when we needed it most.
zh_test: 那个善良的陌生人象征着我以及 朝鲜人最需要的希望。

en_test: And he showed me that the kindness of strangers  and the support of the international community  are truly the rays of hope we North Korean people need.
zh_test: 他使我明白，陌生人的善意 和国际社会的支持 真是我们朝鲜人需要的希望之光。

en_test: Eventually, after our long journey,  my family and I were reunited in South Korea.
zh_test: 最终，在经历了漫长的旅行后， 我和家人终于在韩国重聚。

en_test: But getting to freedom is only half the battle.

zh_test: 很多朝鲜人和他们的家人分离， 并且当他们来到新的国家时， 他们通常都只有很少的钱，或者身无分文。

en_test: We can also act as a bridge  between the people inside North Korea and the outside world.
zh_test: 我们还可以作为 世界与生活在朝鲜的同胞之间 的沟通桥梁。

en_test: Because many of us stay in contact with family members still inside,  and we send information and money  that is helping to change North Korea from inside.
zh_test: 因为我们很多人都和 生活在朝鲜的家人保持联系。 我们寄送回去的信息和钱 都在内在地改变朝鲜。

en_test: I've been so lucky, received so much help and inspiration in my life,  so I want to help give aspiring North Koreans  a chance to prosper with international support.
zh_test: 我是如此幸运， 在人生中得到了这么多帮助和启示， 所以我想帮助那些心怀梦想的朝鲜人 在国际的援助下， 一个实现梦想的机会。
GOOGLE: 我很幸运，在生活中得到了很多帮助和灵感，所以我想帮助有抱负的朝鲜人有机会在国际支持下实现繁荣。

en_test: I'm confident that you will see more and more North Koreans  succeeding all over the world,  including the TED stage.

zh_test: 谢谢
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

zh_test: 这就是洛杉矶南区： 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。
GOOGLE: 这是中南部：酒类商店、快餐店、空地。

en_test: This is South Los Angeles.   Liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
zh_test: 这是南洛杉矶 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。
GOOGLE: 这是南洛杉矶。酒类商店、快餐店、空地。

en_test: Just like 26.5 million other Americans,  I live in a food desert,  South Central Los Angeles,  home of the drive-thru and the drive-by.
zh_test: 和其他两千六百五十万的美国人一样， 我生活在食物的荒漠， 洛杉矶南区， 是得来速（快餐商业模式，顾客不用下车即可获得服务）和飞车的家园。

en_test: Funny thing is, the drive-thrus are killing more people than the drive-bys.

en_test: I got tired of seeing this happening.
zh_test: 我厌倦了这些现实。
GOOGLE: 我厌倦了看到这种事发生。

en_test: And I was wondering, how would you feel if you had no access to healthy food,  if every time you walk out your door you see the ill effects  that the present food system has on your neighborhood?
