en_test: And especially if you then ride with your bicycle,  and pass these cars, then that's not very nice.
zh_test: 尤其是如果你正骑着自行车， 与那些车擦肩而过，就不太好啦。
GOOGLE: 尤其是如果你骑着自行车骑行，并且超过了这些汽车，那就不太好了。

en_test: Also, asphalt can create a lot of noise.
zh_test: 同时，沥青路会产生很大噪音。
GOOGLE: 此外，沥青会产生很大的噪音。

en_test: It's a noisy material,  and if we produce roads like in the Netherlands,  very close to cities, then we would like a silent road.
zh_test: 这种材料有点吵， 如果我们要修的路紧邻城市， 像荷兰的道路那样，我们就会希望噪音小一些。
GOOGLE: 这是一种嘈杂的材料，如果我们像荷兰那样建造非常靠近城市的道路，那么我们会想要一条安静的道路。

en_test: The solution for that is to make roads  out of porous asphalt.
zh_test: 解决的办法就是 使用多孔沥青来修路。
GOOGLE: 解决方案是用多孔沥青建造道路。

en_test: Porous asphalt, a material that we use now  in most of the highways in the Netherlands,  it has pores and water can just rain through it,  so all the rainwater will flow away to the sides,  and you have a road that's easy to drive on,  so no splash water anymore.
zh_test: 多孔沥青这种材料 用在荷兰的多数高速公路上， 它有些小毛孔让水渗过去， 雨水会流向旁边， 路上驾车就容易了， 也没有溅起的水花。
GOOGLE: 多孔沥青是我们现在在荷兰大多数高速公路上使用的一种材料，它有孔隙，水可以直接穿过它，所以所有的雨水都会流到两侧，这样你就有了一条很容易行驶的道路，这样就不再溅水了。

en_test: Also the noise will disappear in these pores.
zh_test: 噪音也会消失在这些毛孔里。
GOOGLE: 噪音也会在这些毛孔中消失。

en_test: Because it's very hollow, all the noise will disappear,  so it's a very silent road.
zh_test: 因为它有很多空洞，相互抵消了噪音， 所以路就很安静。
GOOGLE: 因为它很空旷，所有的噪音都会消失，所以这是一条非常安静的路。

en_test: It also has disadvantages, of course,  and the disadvantage of this road is that raveling can occur.
zh_test: 当然，它也有缺点， 这种路的缺点是沥青可能会松脱。
GOOGLE: 当然，它也有缺点，这条路的缺点是可能会发生散线。

en_test: What is raveling? You see that in this road  that the stones at the surface come off.
zh_test: 什么叫松脱？看看这条路 路面上的石头脱落。
GOOGLE: 什么是拆线？你可以看到，在这条路上，路面上的石头都脱落了。

en_test: First you get one stone, then several more,  and more and more and more and more,  and then they -- well, I will not do that.   But they can damage your windshield,  so you're not happy with that.
zh_test: 开始一块，接着几块， 越来越多， 后来就——我就不演示了。 但它们会损坏你的挡风玻璃， 你肯定不高兴。
GOOGLE: 首先你得到一块石头，然后更多，越来越多，然后他们——好吧，我不会那样做。但它们会损坏您的挡风玻璃，因此您对此不满意。

en_test: And finally, this raveling can also lead to more and more damage.
zh_test: 最后，这种松脱会带来越来越多的损害。
GOOGLE: 最后，这种混乱也会导致越来越多的损害。

en_test: Sometimes you can create potholes with that.
zh_test: 有时候路面会出现坑槽
GOOGLE: 有时你可以用它制造坑洼。

en_test: Ha. He's ready.
zh_test: 哈，他早有准备。
GOOGLE: 哈。他准备好了。

en_test: Potholes, of course, that can become a problem,  but we have a solution.
zh_test: 坑坑洼洼当然会变成问题， 但我们有解决的办法。
GOOGLE: 当然，坑洼可能会成为一个问题，但我们有一个解决方案。

en_test: Here you see actually how the damage appears in this material.
zh_test: 这里你看到的是这种材料上出现的损害。
GOOGLE: 在这里您实际上可以看到这种材料的损坏情况。

en_test: It's a porous asphalt, like I said, so you have only  a small amount of binder between the stones.
zh_test: 这是沥青，就像我说的， 石头中间有少量的粘合剂。
GOOGLE: 正如我所说，它是一种多孔沥青，因此石头之间只有少量粘合剂。

en_test: Due to weathering, due to U.V. light, due to oxidation,  this binder, this bitumen,  the glue between the aggregates is going to shrink,  and if it shrinks, it gets micro-cracks,  and it delaminates from the aggregates.
zh_test: 由于风化、紫外线、氧化等原因 这种粘合剂，这种沥青， 集料之间的黏胶会收缩， 如果它收缩，就会有小裂纹， 从集块开始会出现分层。
GOOGLE: 由于风化，由于紫外线。光，由于氧化，这种粘合剂、这种沥青、集料之间的胶会收缩，如果收缩，就会产生微裂纹，并从集料上分层。

en_test: Then if you drive over the road, you take out the aggregates --  what we just saw here.
zh_test: 如果你在这种路上行驶，你会带出这些集料-- 就是我们看到的。
GOOGLE: 然后，如果你开车过马路，你就会取出这些聚集体——这就是我们刚才在这里看到的。

en_test: To solve this problem, we thought of self-healing materials.
zh_test: 为了解决这个问题，我们考虑到了自我修复材料。
GOOGLE: 为了解决这个问题，我们想到了自愈材料。

en_test: If we can make this material self-healing,  then probably we have a solution.
zh_test: 如果我们能让这种材料自我修复， 就有可能有解决方案。
GOOGLE: 如果我们能让这种材料具有自我修复能力，那么我们或许就有了解决方案。

en_test: So what we can do is use steel wool just to clean pans,  and the steel wool we can cut in very small pieces,  and these very small pieces we can mix to the bitumen.
zh_test: 我们用的就是清洁厨具用的钢丝绒， 钢丝绒可以裁成很小块， 我们把这些小块混进沥青。
GOOGLE: 所以我们能做的就是使用钢丝绒来清洁平底锅，我们可以将钢丝绒切成非常小的碎片，然后将这些非常小的碎片混合到沥青中。

en_test: So then you have asphalt  with very small pieces of steel wool in it.
zh_test: 所以现在的沥青 有一些小钢丝绒在里面。
GOOGLE: 这样你就得到了含有非常小钢丝绒碎片的沥青。

en_test: Then you need a machine, like you see here,  that you can use for cooking -- an induction machine.
zh_test: 你再需要一个像这样的机器， 一个感应电机——它可以用来做饭。
GOOGLE: 然后你需要一台可以用来烹饪的机器，就像你在这里看到的那样——一台电磁炉。

en_test: Induction can heat, especially steel; it's very good at that.
zh_test: 感应电机可以加热东西，尤其擅长加热钢铁
GOOGLE: 感应可以加热，特别是钢；它非常擅长这一点。

en_test: Then what you do is you heat up the steel,  you melt the bitumen,  and the bitumen will flow into these micro-cracks,  and the stones are again fixed to the surface.
zh_test: 所以我们要做的就是把钢铁加热， 把沥青溶化， 沥青就会流进那些小裂缝里， 脱落的小石子就又被粘上了。
GOOGLE: 然后你要做的就是加热钢材，熔化沥青，沥青就会流入这些微裂纹中，石头再次固定在表面上。

en_test: Today I use a microwave because I cannot take  the big induction machine here onstage.
zh_test: 由于感应电机太大了拿不上来， 我在这里就用微波炉演示了。
GOOGLE: 今天我用微波炉，因为我不能把这里的大型电磁炉带到舞台上。

en_test: So a microwave is a similar system.
zh_test: 微波炉跟感应电机的原理类似。
GOOGLE: 所以微波炉是一个类似的系统。

en_test: So I put the specimen in, which I'm now going to take out  to see what happened.
zh_test: 我把样品放进去了，现在把它拿出来 看看发生了什么事。
GOOGLE: 所以我把标本放进去，现在我要把它拿出来看看发生了什么。

en_test: So this is the specimen coming out now.
zh_test: 这是样品现在的样子。
GOOGLE: 这就是现在出来的样本。

en_test: So I said we have such an industrial machine in the lab  to heat up the specimens.
zh_test: 我们实验室里有工业用的机器 来加热样品。
GOOGLE: 所以我说我们实验室里有这样一个工业机器来加热标本。

en_test: We tested a lot of specimens there,  and then the government, they actually saw our results,  and they thought, "Well, that's very interesting. We have to try that."
zh_test: 我们测试过很多样品， 政府也看过我们的结果， 他们决定，“这很有趣，我们应该试一下。”
GOOGLE: 我们在那里测试了很多样本​​，然后政府，他们实际上看到了我们的结果，他们想，“嗯，这非常有趣。我们必须尝试一下。”

en_test: So they donated to us a piece of highway,  400 meters of the A58, where we had to make  a test track to test this material.
zh_test: 政府免费授权了一段高速公路给我们， 在A58号上400米的距离， 我们就在那里做了材料测试。
GOOGLE: 所以他们给我们捐赠了一段高速公路，400米的A58，我们必须在那里建造一条测试跑道来测试这种材料。

en_test: So that's what we did here. You see where we were making the test road,  and then of course this road will last several years  without any damage. That's what we know from practice.
zh_test: 这就是我们做的。你看到的就是做的实验路段， 当然这段路近几年不会坏。 我们在实践中确认了这点。
GOOGLE: 这就是我们在这里所做的。你看我们在哪里修建测试道路，当然这条路可以持续几年而不会受到任何损坏。这是我们从实践中得知的。

en_test: So we took a lot of samples from this road  and we tested them in the lab.
zh_test: 我们在这段路上取了很多样品 在实验室里进行各种测试。
GOOGLE: 所以我们从这条路上采集了很多样本​​并在实验室进行了测试。

en_test: So we did aging on the samples,  did a lot of loading on it, healed them with our induction machine,  and healed them and tested them again.
zh_test: 我们做了老化实验， 加了很多负载，用我们的感应电机给它们加热， 重复加热和测试。
GOOGLE: 因此，我们对样品进行了老化，对其进行了大量加载，用我们的感应机修复它们，然后修复它们并再次测试它们。

en_test: Several times we can repeat that.
zh_test: 我们可以多次重复。
GOOGLE: 我们可以重复几次。

en_test: So actually, the conclusion from this research is that  if we go on the road every four years  with our healing machine -- this is the big version  we have made to go on the real road --  if we go on the road every four years  we can double the surface life of this road,  which of course saves a lot of money.
zh_test: 事实上，这项实验得到的结论是 如果我们每四年在这段路上 用我们的加热机器——超大号微波炉 我们要把这个机器搬到公路上用—— 我们每四年上这段路 路面的寿命会加倍， 当然会省很多钱。
GOOGLE: 所以实际上，这项研究的结论是，如果我们每四年带着我们的治疗机器上路一次——这是我们为走上真正的道路而制作的大版本——如果我们每四年上路一次我们可以使这条道路的路面寿命延长一倍，这当然可以节省很多钱。

en_test: Well, to conclude, I can say  that we made a material  using steel fibers, the addition of steel fibers,  using induction energy to really  increase the surface life of the road,  double the surface life you can even do,  so it will really save a lot of money with very simple tricks.
zh_test: 所以，结论是 我们制造了一种材料 使用钢纤维，加了钢纤维 使用感应能量 有效的增加了路面的寿命， 能使路面的寿命加倍， 用这种简单的技巧就会省很多钱。
GOOGLE: 好吧，总而言之，我可以说我们用钢纤维制作了一种材料，添加了钢纤维，利用感应能量确实增加了道路的表面寿命，甚至可以做到双倍的表面寿命，所以它真的会节省用非常简单的技巧赚很多钱。

en_test: And now you're of course curious if it also worked.
zh_test: 你会好奇是否会有效。
GOOGLE: 现在你当然好奇它是否也有效。

en_test: So we still have the specimen here. It's quite warm.
zh_test: 我们看这个样品。现在还有点烫。
GOOGLE: 所以我们这里还留有标本。天气很暖和。

en_test: Actually, it still has to cool down first  before I can show you that the healing works.
zh_test: 事实上，我要先让它冷却下来 才能向你们展示加热修复是否有效。
GOOGLE: 事实上，在我可以向你展示治疗效果之前，它仍然需要先冷却下来。

en_test: But I will do a trial.
zh_test: 但是要尝试一下。
GOOGLE: 但我会做一个试验。

en_test: Let's see. Yeah, it worked.
zh_test: 看，真的，修好了。
GOOGLE: 让我们来看看。是的，它起作用了。

en_test: Thank you.
zh_test: 谢谢！
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

en_test: When I was 11,  I remember waking up one morning to the sound of joy in my house.
zh_test: 我11岁那年， 记得有一天早晨醒来，听见家里有愉悦的声音。
GOOGLE: 当我11岁的时候，我记得有一天早上我在家里的欢乐声中醒来。

en_test: My father was listening to BBC News on his small, gray radio.
zh_test: 我的父亲在用他的灰色小收音机
GOOGLE: 我父亲正在用他的灰色小收音机听英国广播公司新闻。

en_test: There was a big smile on his face which was unusual then,  because the news mostly depressed him.
zh_test: 他面带笑容，这很少见， 因为大部分的新闻都只会使他沮丧。
GOOGLE: 他脸上挂着灿烂的笑容，这在当时是不寻常的，因为这个消息让他感到非常沮丧。

en_test: "The Taliban are gone!" my father shouted.
zh_test: “塔利班走了！” 父亲大声叫着。
GOOGLE: “塔利班消失了！”我父亲喊道。

en_test: I didn't know what it meant,  but I could see that my father was very, very happy.
zh_test: 我不知道那意味着什么， 但是我能看出父亲非常非常高兴。
GOOGLE: 我不知道这意味着什么，但我看得出来父亲非常非常高兴。

en_test: "You can go to a real school now," he said.
zh_test: “你现在可以去个真正的学校念书了。” 他说。
GOOGLE: “你现在可以去一所真正的学校了，”他说。

en_test: A morning that I will never forget.
zh_test: 我永远不会忘记那个早晨。
GOOGLE: 一个我永远不会忘记的早晨。

en_test: A real school.
zh_test: 一个真正的学校。
GOOGLE: 一所真正的学校。

en_test: You see, I was six when the Taliban took over Afghanistan  and made it illegal for girls to go to school.
zh_test: 我6岁那年，塔利班占领阿富汗 并规定女孩上学是违法的。
GOOGLE: 你看，当塔利班接管阿富汗并规定女孩上学为非法时，我才六岁。

en_test: So for the next five years, I dressed as a boy  to escort my older sister, who was no longer allowed  to be outside alone, to a secret school.
zh_test: 所以在那之后5年，我女扮男装 陪着我姐姐去一个秘密学校 姐姐那时已经不被允许独自外出了。
GOOGLE: 于是在接下来的五年里，我装扮成男孩，护送不再被允许单独外出的姐姐去一所秘密学校。

en_test: It was the only way we both could be educated.
zh_test: 这是我们俩人唯一的受教育方式。
GOOGLE: 这是我们俩都能接受教育的唯一途径。

en_test: Each day, we took a different route  so that no one would suspect where we were going.
zh_test: 我们每天要走不同的路线 这样才没有人会怀疑我们要去哪里。
GOOGLE: 每天，我们都走不同的路线，这样就不会有人怀疑我们要去哪里。

en_test: We would cover our books in grocery bags  so it would seem we were just out shopping.
zh_test: 我们把书放在食品杂货袋中 这样别人就会以为我们只是要去购物
GOOGLE: 我们会把书包在购物袋里，这样看起来我们只是出去购物了。

en_test: The school was in a house,  more than 100 of us packed in one small living room.
zh_test: 学校在一个房屋里， 我们100多人挤在一个小客厅里。
GOOGLE: 学校在一栋房子里，我们一百多人挤在一个小客厅里。

en_test: It was cozy in winter but extremely hot in summer.
zh_test: 冬天很舒服，但夏天却极热。
GOOGLE: 冬天很舒适，但夏天却非常炎热。

en_test: We all knew we were risking our lives --  the teacher, the students and our parents.
zh_test: 我们都知道自己正冒着生命的危险- 老师，学生以及家长都很明白
GOOGLE: 我们都知道我们正在冒着生命危险——老师、学生和家长。

en_test: From time to time, the school would suddenly be canceled  for a week because Taliban were suspicious.
zh_test: 有时，学校会突然停课一周 因为被塔利班怀疑了。
GOOGLE: 有时，学校会因为塔利班的怀疑而突然停课一周。

en_test: We always wondered what they knew about us.
zh_test: 我们总是担心会被塔利班发现。
GOOGLE: 我们总是想知道他们对我们了解多少。

en_test: Were we being followed?
zh_test: 我们在被跟踪吗？
GOOGLE: 我们被跟踪了吗？

en_test: Do they know where we live?
zh_test: 他们知道我们的住处吗？
GOOGLE: 他们知道我们住在哪里吗？

en_test: We were scared,  but still, school was where we wanted to be.
zh_test: 我们很害怕， 但是，我们仍然渴望去学校。
GOOGLE: 我们很害怕，但学校仍然是我们想去的地方。

en_test: I was very lucky to grow up in a family  where education was prized and daughters were treasured.
zh_test: 我很幸运地成长在一个 珍视教育也珍爱女儿的家庭。
GOOGLE: 我很幸运，生长在一个重视教育、珍视女儿的家庭。

en_test: My grandfather was an extraordinary man for his time.
zh_test: 我的祖父在他的年代是位非凡的人。
GOOGLE: 我的祖父在他那个时代是一位非凡的人。

en_test: A total maverick from a remote province of Afghanistan,  he insisted that his daughter, my mom,  go to school, and for that he was disowned by his father.
zh_test: 他出身阿富汗边远地区，有着与他人不同的见解 他坚持让他的女儿，我的母亲， 去上学，并因此被迫与他的父亲断绝父子关系。
GOOGLE: 他来自阿富汗一个偏远省份，是个特立独行的人，他坚持让他的女儿，也就是我的妈妈去上学，为此他被父亲断绝了关系。

en_test: But my educated mother became a teacher.
zh_test: 但是我那受过教育的母亲成为了一名教师。
GOOGLE: 但我受过教育的母亲成了一名老师。

en_test: There she is.
zh_test: 那就是她。
GOOGLE: 她在这里。

en_test: She retired two years ago, only to turn our house  into a school for girls and women in our neighborhood.
zh_test: 她两年前退休了，结果却把我家 变成了一所学校，教育社区中的女孩和妇女
GOOGLE: 她两年前退休了，只是为了把我们的房子变成一所为我们附近的女孩和妇女开设的学校。

en_test: And my father -- that's him --  he was the first ever in his family to receive an education.
zh_test: 我的父亲-那就是他- 他是他家族中第一个受到教育的人。
GOOGLE: 我的父亲——就是他——他是家里第一个接受教育的人。

en_test: There was no question that his children  would receive an education, including his daughters,  despite the Taliban, despite the risks.
zh_test: 因此毫无疑问，他的孩子 应当受到教育，包括他的女儿， 尽管有塔利班，尽管有风险。
GOOGLE: 毫无疑问，他的孩子们，包括他的女儿们，都会接受教育，尽管有塔利班的存在，尽管存在风险。

en_test: To him, there was greater risk in not educating his children.
zh_test: 对他来说，孩子不接受教育才是更大的风险。
GOOGLE: 对他来说，不教育孩子的风险更大。

en_test: During Taliban years, I remember  there were times I would get so frustrated by our life  and always being scared and not seeing a future.
zh_test: 在塔利班控制阿富汗的那些年，我记得 有时我会对自己的生活感到沮丧 总是会害怕，看不见未来。
GOOGLE: 在塔利班的岁月里，我记得有时我会对我们的生活感到沮丧，总是感到害怕，看不到未来。

en_test: I would want to quit,  but my father,  he would say,  "Listen, my daughter,  you can lose everything you own in your life.
zh_test: 我想过要放弃， 但我的父亲 这时就会说 “听着，我的女儿， 你可能失去你生命中的任何东西。
GOOGLE: 我想放弃，但我的父亲会说：“听着，我的女儿，你可能会失去你一生中拥有的一切。

en_test: Your money can be stolen. You can be forced to leave your home during a war.
zh_test: 你的钱可能被偷，你可能因战争而背井离乡。
GOOGLE: 你的钱可能会被偷。战争期间您可能被迫离开家。

en_test: But the one thing that will always remain with you  is what is here,  and if we have to sell our blood to pay your school fees,  we will.
zh_test: 而你唯一能够守护住的东西 就是这里， 如果我们不得不靠卖血来支付你的学费， 我们会毫不犹豫。
GOOGLE: 但你永远不会忘记的一件事就是这里，如果我们必须卖血来支付你的学费，我们会的。

en_test: So do you still not want to continue?"
zh_test: 即便如此你还是不想继续吗？”
GOOGLE: 那你还不想继续吗？”

en_test: Today I am 22.
zh_test: 如今我22岁。
GOOGLE: 今天我22岁了。

en_test: I was raised in a country that has been destroyed  by decades of war.
zh_test: 我所成长的国家被几十年的 战争所摧毁。
GOOGLE: 我在一个被数十年战争摧毁的国家长大。

en_test: Fewer than six percent of women my age have made it beyond high school,  and had my family not been so committed to my education,  I would be one of them.
zh_test: 我这个年龄的女性中，高中毕业的人数不到6%， 如果不是我家人的坚持， 我也会像绝大多数人一样。
GOOGLE: 在我这个年纪的女性中，只有不到百分之六的人能读完高中，如果我的家人不那么致力于我的教育，我也会成为其中之一。

en_test: Instead, I stand here a proud graduate of Middlebury College.
zh_test: 而如今我已经是一名自豪的明德学院的毕业生
GOOGLE: 相反，我作为米德尔伯里学院的毕业生自豪地站在这里。

en_test: When I returned to Afghanistan, my grandfather,  the one exiled from his home for daring to educate his daughters,  was among the first to congratulate me.
zh_test: 当我回到阿富汗时，我的祖父， 那位因让女儿接受教育而被逐出家门的老人， 最先向我表示了祝贺。
GOOGLE: 当我回到阿富汗时，我的祖父是第一批向我表示祝贺的人之一，他因敢于教育女儿而被逐出家门。

en_test: He not only brags about my college degree,  but also that I was the first woman,  and that I am the first woman  to drive him through the streets of Kabul.
zh_test: 他骄傲的不仅仅是因为我的大学学历， 也是因为在女性中，我是第一个， 在女性中，我是第一个 开车带他在喀布尔的大街兜风的人。
GOOGLE: 他不仅吹嘘我的大学学位，还吹嘘我是第一个女人，也是第一个开车送他穿过喀布尔街道的女人。

en_test: My family believes in me.
zh_test: 我的家人很信任我。
GOOGLE: 我的家人相信我。

en_test: I dream big, but my family dreams even bigger for me.
zh_test: 我的梦想很大，但他们对我的期待甚至更高。
GOOGLE: 我的梦想很大，但我的家人对我的梦想更大。

en_test: That's why I am a global ambassador for 10x10,  a global campaign to educate women.
zh_test: 这就是我成为 "10x10" 的全球大使的原因， 这是一个致力于女性教育的全球组织。
GOOGLE: 这就是为什么我成为 10x10 的全球大使，这是一项全球女性教育运动。

en_test: That's why I cofounded SOLA,  the first and perhaps only boarding school  for girls in Afghanistan,  a country where it's still risky for girls to go to school.
zh_test: 那也是我参与创立 SOLA 的原因， 这是第一所，可能也是阿富汗唯一一所 寄宿女校， 因为在阿富汗，让女孩接受教育依然十分危险。
GOOGLE: 这就是我联合创办 SOLA 的原因，这是阿富汗第一所、也许是唯一一所女子寄宿学校，在这个国家，女孩上学仍然存在风险。

en_test: The exciting thing is that I see students at my school  with ambition grabbing at opportunity.
zh_test: 让我兴奋的是，我看见我学校中的学生 能够把握机遇，志向远大。
GOOGLE: 令人兴奋的是，我看到学校里雄心勃勃的学生抓住机会。

en_test: And I see their parents and their fathers  who, like my own, advocate for them,  despite and even in the face of daunting opposition.
zh_test: 我看见她们的双亲，尤其是她们的父亲， 就像我父亲那样支持她们， 尽管从他们脸上也看出了畏惧。
GOOGLE: 我看到他们的父母和他们的父亲，就像我自己的父母一样，尽管甚至面对令人生畏的反对，仍然为他们辩护。

en_test: Like Ahmed. That's not his real name,  and I cannot show you his face,  but Ahmed is the father of one of my students.
zh_test: 比如艾哈迈德，这不是真名， 我也不能让你们看见他的长相， 他是我一个学生的父亲。
GOOGLE: 就像艾哈迈德一样。这不是他的真名，我无法向你展示他的脸，但艾哈迈德是我一名学生的父亲。

en_test: Less than a month ago, he and his daughter  were on their way from SOLA to their village,  and they literally missed being killed  by a roadside bomb by minutes.
zh_test: 不到一个月前，他和他女儿 在从学校回村里的路上 他们差一点就被 路边炸弹炸死。
GOOGLE: 不到一个月前，他和女儿在从 SOLA 前往村庄的路上，差几分钟就被路边炸弹炸死。

en_test: As he arrived home, the phone rang,  a voice warning him  that if he sent his daughter back to school,  they would try again.
zh_test: 他到家时，电话响了， 一个声音警告他 如果他再将女儿送去学校， 刚才的事情就会再次发生。
GOOGLE: 当他回到家时，电话响了，声音警告他，如果他送女儿回学校，他们会再试一次。

en_test: "Kill me now, if you wish," he said,  "but I will not ruin my daughter's future  because of your old and backward ideas."
zh_test: “如果你想，现在就可以杀了我。”他说， “但我不会因你落后的思想 而毁了我女儿的未来。”
GOOGLE: “如果你愿意的话，现在就杀了我吧，”他说道，“但我不会因为你们陈旧落后的思想而毁掉我女儿的未来。”

en_test: What I've come to realize about Afghanistan,  and this is something that is often dismissed in the West,  that behind most of us who succeed  is a father who recognizes the value in his daughter  and who sees that her success is his success.
zh_test: 对于阿富汗，我意识到 ——这是西方国家也不曾意识到的—— 即在我们成功的背后 是一个这样的父亲——他能认识到自己女儿的价值， 也明白女儿的成功，就是他自己的成功。
GOOGLE: 我对阿富汗的认识是，这在西方经常被忽视，我们大多数成功者的背后都有一位父亲，他认识到女儿的价值，并认为她的成功就是他的成功。

en_test: It's not to say that our mothers aren't key in our success.
zh_test: 这并不是说母亲们对于我们的成功并不重要。
GOOGLE: 这并不是说我们的母亲不是我们成功的关键。

en_test: In fact, they're often the initial and convincing negotiators  of a bright future for their daughters,  but in the context of a society like in Afghanistan,  we must have the support of men.
zh_test: 事实上，为了女儿的美好未来，她们通常是 最初和最有说服力的交涉者， 但是在像阿富汗这样的社会中， 我们必须有男性的支持。
GOOGLE: 事实上，她们往往是为女儿争取光明未来的最初且令人信服的谈判者，但在阿富汗这样的社会背景下，我们必须得到男性的支持。

en_test: Under the Taliban, girls who went to school  numbered in the hundreds --  remember, it was illegal.
zh_test: 在塔利班控制下，去上学的女孩 曾经只有几百人—— 请不要忘了，当时是非法的。
GOOGLE: 在塔利班统治下，上学的女孩有数百人——记住，这是非法的。

en_test: But today, more than three million girls are in school in Afghanistan.
zh_test: 但是今天，阿富汗接受教育的女孩已经超过300万。
GOOGLE: 但如今，阿富汗有超过三百万女孩在上学。

en_test: Afghanistan looks so different from here in America.
zh_test: 阿富汗与美国有很大不同。
GOOGLE: 阿富汗看起来与美国截然不同。

en_test: I find that Americans see the fragility in changes.
zh_test: 我发现，美国人能看出我们变化中的脆弱性。
GOOGLE: 我发现美国人看到了变化的脆弱性。

en_test: I fear that these changes will not last  much beyond the U.S. troops' withdrawal.
zh_test: 我担心这些变化在美军撤军之后 能够维持多久。
GOOGLE: 我担心这些变化在美军撤离后不会持续太久。

en_test: But when I am back in Afghanistan,  when I see the students in my school  and their parents who advocate for them,  who encourage them, I see a promising future  and lasting change.
zh_test: 但是当我回到阿富汗 看见我的学生 以及支持她们 并鼓励她们的父母时，我看到了未来的希望， 也看到这种变化会延续下去。
GOOGLE: 但当我回到阿富汗时，当我看到学校里的学生和他们的父母为他们辩护、鼓励他们时，我看到了充满希望的未来和持久的变化。

en_test: To me, Afghanistan is a country of hope and boundless possibilities,  and every single day  the girls of SOLA remind me of that.
zh_test: 对我来说，阿富汗充满了希望和无限的可能性， 每一天 在 SOLA 读书的女孩儿都这么提醒着我。
GOOGLE: 对我来说，阿富汗是一个充满希望和无限可能性的国家，SOLA 的女孩们每天都提醒我这一点。

en_test: Like me, they are dreaming big.
zh_test: 像我一样，她们也有很大的梦想。
GOOGLE: 和我一样，他们也有远大的梦想。

en_test: Thank you.
zh_test: 谢谢。
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

en_test: I have never, ever forgotten the words of my grandmother  who died in her exile:  "Son, resist Gaddafi. Fight him.
zh_test: 我永远也不会忘记我那在流亡中去世的祖母 对我说过的话： “孩子，反抗卡扎菲，与他抗争。
GOOGLE: 我永远不会忘记在流亡期间去世的祖母的话：“儿子，抵抗卡扎菲。与他战斗。

en_test: But don't you ever turn  into a Gaddafi-like revolutionary."
zh_test: 但你千万不要变成 卡扎菲那样的革命者。”
GOOGLE: 但你永远不要变成像卡扎菲那样的革命者。”

en_test: since the Libyan Revolution broke out,  inspired by the waves of mass mobilization  in both the Tunisian and the Egyptian revolutions.
zh_test: 利比亚革命爆发至今 已有两年， 这次革命受到了突尼斯和埃及革命中 全民积极参与的鼓舞。
GOOGLE: 自利比亚革命爆发以来，受到突尼斯和埃及革命群众动员浪潮的启发。

en_test: I joined forces with many other Libyans inside and outside Libya  to call for a day of rage  and to initiate a revolution against the tyrannical regime of Gaddafi.
zh_test: 我同利比亚国内外的同胞们一起 呼吁民众举行“愤怒日”游行 并开始了反抗卡扎菲专制统治的革命。
GOOGLE: 我与利比亚境内外的许多其他利比亚人联合起来，呼吁“愤怒一天”，发起一场反对卡扎菲暴政政权的革命。

en_test: And there it was, a great revolution.
zh_test: 这是一场伟大的革命运动。
GOOGLE: 一场伟大的革命就这样发生了。

en_test: Young Libyan women and men were at the forefront  calling for the fall of the regime,  raising slogans of freedom, dignity, social justice.
zh_test: 利比亚的年轻男女站在革命的最前线 要求专制政府下台， 呼喊着自由、尊严、社会公正的口号。
GOOGLE: 利比亚年轻男女站在最前线，呼吁推翻政权，高举自由、尊严和社会正义的口号。

en_test: They have shown an exemplary bravery  in confronting the brutal dictatorship of Gaddafi.
zh_test: 他们在同残暴的卡扎菲专政的抗争中 表现出的勇气堪作典范。
GOOGLE: 他们在对抗卡扎菲残暴独裁统治时表现出了堪称典范的勇敢精神。

en_test: They have shown a great sense of solidarity  from the far east to the far west to the south.
zh_test: 他们展现出来了高度的团结精神， 从东面到西面再到南面，全国的人民都团结在一起。
GOOGLE: 从远东到远西再到南方，他们表现出了极大的团结意识。

en_test: Eventually, after a period of six months of brutal war  and a toll rate of almost 50,000 dead,  we managed to liberate our country and to topple the tyrant.
zh_test: 最终，经过六个月惨烈的战争， 以50,000人死亡为代价， 我们推翻了暴政统治，迎来了国家的自由。
GOOGLE: 最终，经过六个月的残酷战争和近五万人的死亡，我们成功解放了我们的国家并推翻了暴君。

en_test: However, Gaddafi left behind a heavy burden,  a legacy of tyranny, corruption and seeds of diversions.
zh_test: 但是，卡扎菲给我们留下沉重负担 他留下专政、腐败的陋习，埋下了分裂的种子。
GOOGLE: 然而，卡扎菲留下了沉重的负担、暴政、腐败和转移种子的遗产。

en_test: For four decades Gaddafi's tyrannical regime  destroyed the infrastructure as well as the culture and the moral fabric of Libyan society.
zh_test: 卡扎菲长达40年的专政 破坏了利比亚的基础设施，也破坏了利比亚的文化和道德观念。
GOOGLE: 四十年来，卡扎菲的残暴政权摧毁了利比亚社会的基础设施以及文化和道德结构。

en_test: Aware of the devastation and the challenges,  I was keen among many other women to rebuild the Libyan civil society,  calling for an inclusive and just transition  to democracy and national reconciliation.
zh_test: 我深知卡扎菲独裁所造成的破坏，也深知我们面临的挑战， 我同许多热血女性一起尝试重建利比亚的公民社会， 我们呼吁在利比亚体现宽容与公正的精神 以实现民主和民族间的和解。
GOOGLE: 意识到所遭受的破坏和挑战，我与许多其他妇女一样热衷于重建利比亚民间社会，呼吁包容、公正地向民主和民族和解过渡。

en_test: Almost 200 organizations were established in Benghazi  during and immediately after the fall of Gaddafi --  almost 300 in Tripoli.
zh_test: 在卡扎菲倒台之时及之后 有将近200个组织在班加西成立 而在黎波里有将近300个组织成立。
GOOGLE: 卡扎菲倒台期间和倒台后不久，班加西成立了近 200 个组织，的黎波里则成立了近 300 个组织。

en_test: After a period of 33 years in exile, I went back to Libya,  and with unique enthusiasm,  I started organizing workshops  on capacity building, on human development of leadership skills.
zh_test: 在流亡33年后，我回到利比亚 怀着不同寻常的热情， 我着手组织研讨会， 讨论能力建设以及人类发展中领导力培养的问题。
GOOGLE: 经过 33 年的流亡生涯后，我回到了利比亚，并以独特的热情开始组织关于能力建设和领导技能人类发展的研讨会。

en_test: With an amazing group of women,  I co-founded the Libyan Women's Platform for Peace,  a movement of women, leaders, from different walks of life,  to lobby for the sociopolitical empowerment of women  and to lobby for our right  for equal participation in building democracy and peace.
zh_test: 我和一群了不起的女性一起， 创办了利比亚女性和平平台。 这是一场各行各业女性的运动、领导者的运动。 我们为女性争取参与社会政治生活的权利， 为我们女性争取 平等参与民主与和平建设的权利。
GOOGLE: 我与一群了不起的女性共同创立了利比亚妇女和平平台，这是一个由来自各行各业的妇女、领导人组成的运动，旨在游说赋予妇女社会政治权力，并争取我们平等参与建设的权利。民主与和平。

en_test: I met a very difficult environment in the pre-elections,  an environment which was increasingly polarized,  an environment which was shaped by the selfish politics of dominance and exclusion.
zh_test: 在大选前，国内的形势非常糟糕， 国内两级分化日益严重， 这是因为我们的政治是自私的，是充满了控制和排斥的。
GOOGLE: 我在选举前遇到了一个非常困难的环境，一个日益两极分化的环境，一个由自私的统治和排斥政治塑造的环境。

en_test: I led an initiative by the Libyan Women's Platform for Peace  to lobby for a more inclusive electoral law,  a law that would give every citizen, no matter what your background,  the right to vote and run,  and most importantly to stipulate on political parties  the alternation of male and female candidates vertically and horizontally in their lists,  creating the zipper list.
zh_test: 我在利比亚女性和平平台提出了一项倡议， 呼吁利比亚施行更具包容性的选举法, 让利比亚的每一位公民，无论背景如何， 都有选举和参选的权利， 最重要的是，我呼吁在政党中应当规定 无论在地区间还是在不同级别间， 都由男性和女性轮流担当候选人， 形成交叉式的候选人名单。
GOOGLE: 我领导了利比亚妇女和平平台的一项倡议，游说制定更具包容性的选举法，这项法律将赋予每个公民，无论其背景如何，投票权和参选权，最重要的是规定政党男性和女性候选人在名单中垂直和水平交替，形成拉链名单。

en_test: Eventually, our initiative was adopted and successful.
zh_test: 最终，我们的倡议获得了采纳，也取得了成功。
GOOGLE: 最终，我们的倡议被采纳并取得了成功。

en_test: Women won 17.5 percent of the National Congress  in the first elections ever in 52 years.
zh_test: 在利比亚52年来的第一次大选中， 女性在国民议会中赢得了17.5%的席位。
GOOGLE: 女性在 52 年来的首次选举中赢得了 17.5% 的国会席位。

en_test: However, bit by bit, the euphoria of the elections,  and of the revolution as a whole,  was fading out --  for every day we were waking up to the news of violence.
zh_test: 然而，一点一点地， 大选和革命所带来的欢欣喜悦 在我们国家中消失了， 因为每天早上起床，我们都会看到有关暴力行径的新闻。
GOOGLE: 然而，选举以及整个革命的喜悦正在一点一点地消失——因为我们每天醒来都会听到暴力的消息。

en_test: One day we wake up to the news  of the desecration of ancient mosques and Sufi tombs.
zh_test: 一天我们看到 亵渎古代清真寺和苏非圣徒墓的新闻。
GOOGLE: 有一天，我们一觉醒来，就听到了古代清真寺和苏菲派坟墓遭到亵渎的消息。

en_test: On another day we wake up to the news  of the murder of the American ambassador and the attack on the consulate.
zh_test: 另一天我们看到 谋杀美国大使和袭击美国领事馆的新闻。
GOOGLE: 另一天，我们醒来时听到美国大使被谋杀和领事馆遭到袭击的消息。

en_test: On another day we wake up to the news  of the assassination of army officers.
zh_test: 又一天我们看到 暗杀军官的新闻。
GOOGLE: 另一天，我们醒来时听到军官被暗杀的消息。

en_test: And every day, every day we wake up with the rule of the militias  and their continuous violations of human rights of prisoners  and their disrespect of the rule of law.
zh_test: 还有就是，每天我们都处于国民军的统治之下， 都要忍受他们不断侵犯囚犯的人权， 忍受他们对法治的蔑视。
GOOGLE: 每一天，我们每天醒来都会看到民兵的统治以及他们不断侵犯囚犯的人权和对法治的不尊重。

en_test: Our society, shaped by a revolutionary mindset,  became more polarized  and has driven away from the ideals and the principles --  freedom, dignity, social justice --  Intolerance, exclusion and revenge  became the icons of the [aftermath] of the revolution.

en_test: And he also created a magical atmosphere of trust between us  by confessing his secret,  which was that, as a very young boy starting at age four,  he had been savagely and repeatedly physically abused  by his stepfather,  and the abuse had gotten so bad that he had had to drop out of school in eighth grade,  even though he was very smart,  and he'd spent almost 20 years rebuilding his life.

GOOGLE: 他还通过坦白自己的秘密，在我们之间营造了一种神奇的信任氛围，那就是，作为一个很小的男孩，从四岁开始，他就曾多次遭到继父的野蛮身体虐待，而且虐待的程度非常严重，以至于尽管他非常聪明，但他在八年级时就不得不辍学，并且花了近 20 年的时间重建自己的生活。

en_test: Which is why that Ivy League degree  and the Wall Street job and his bright shiny future  meant so much to him.
zh_test: 这也就是为什么常春藤大学的学位， 华尔街的工作和光明的未来， 对他意义重大。

en_test: If you had told me  that this smart, funny, sensitive man who adored me  would one day dictate whether or not I wore makeup,  how short my skirts were,  where I lived, what jobs I took,  who my friends were and where I spent Christmas,  I would have laughed at you,  because there was not a hint of violence or control  or anger in Conor at the beginning.
zh_test: 如果那时有人对我说 这个聪明、幽默、体贴并喜欢我的男人 会有一天命令我是否化妆， 我的裙子能多短， 我生活在哪，要做什么工作， 能和谁交朋友和在哪度过圣诞， 我会嘲笑你， 因为我在康纳身上看不出一点暴力或者控制欲 或者愤怒的预兆。
GOOGLE: 如果你告诉我，这个聪明、有趣、敏感、崇拜我的男人有一天会决定我是否化妆、我的裙子有多短、我住在哪里、我从事什么工作、我的朋友是谁以及我在哪里度过圣诞节，我会嘲笑你的，因为康纳一开始没有任何暴力、控制或愤怒的迹象。

GOOGLE: 我不知道任何家庭暴力关系的第一阶段都是引诱和迷惑受害者。

zh_test: 开始的第一步 我当时也不知道，第二步是孤立受害者。
GOOGLE: 我也不知道第二步是隔离受害者。

en_test: Now, Conor did not come home one day and announce,  "You know, hey, all this Romeo and Juliet stuff has been great,  but I need to move into the next phase  where I isolate you and I abuse you" —  —  "so I need to get you out of this apartment  where the neighbors can hear you scream  and out of this city where you have friends and family  and coworkers who can see the bruises."

GOOGLE: 现在，康纳并没有有一天回家并宣布，“你知道，嘿，所有这些罗密欧与朱丽叶的东西都很棒，但我需要进入下一阶段，我孤立你并虐待你” - - “所以我需要带你离开这个邻居可以听到你尖叫的公寓，离开这个你的朋友、家人和同事可以看到瘀伤的城市。”

en_test: Instead, Conor came home one Friday evening  and he told me that he had quit his job that day,  his dream job,  and he said that he had quit his job because of me,  because I had made him feel so safe and loved  that he didn't need to prove himself on Wall Street anymore,  and he just wanted to get out of the city  and away from his abusive, dysfunctional family,

en_test: and move to a tiny town in New England  where he could start his life over with me by his side.
zh_test: 搬到新英格兰的某个小镇 和我一起在那里开始新的生活。
GOOGLE: 然后搬到新英格兰的一个小镇，在那里他可以和我一起开始他的生活。

GOOGLE: 现在，我最不想做的就是离开纽约和我梦想的工作，但我认为你为你的灵魂伴侣做出了牺牲，所以我同意了，我辞掉了工作，康纳和我一起离开了曼哈顿。

en_test: I had no idea I was falling into crazy love,  that I was walking headfirst into a carefully laid  physical, financial and psychological trap.
zh_test: 我以为自己陷入了疯狂的爱情，还不知道 我已经懵懂的走进了一张精心编织的 控制你身体、心灵和经济的陷阱。

GOOGLE: 家庭暴力模式的下一步是引入暴力威胁，看看她如何反应。

en_test: And here's where those guns come in.
zh_test: 这就是刚才枪的用途。

zh_test: 我们刚搬到新英格兰小镇 ——我想，康纳应该是觉得这里很安全—— 他就买了三支枪。

GOOGLE: 他在我们车的杂物箱里放了一个。

en_test: And he said that he needed those guns  because of the trauma he'd experienced as a young boy.
zh_test: 他说小时候的精神创伤 使得他需要拥有这些枪

zh_test: 来让他自己保持安全感。

en_test: I was working on my computer trying to finish a freelance writing assignment,  and I got frustrated,  and Conor used my anger as an excuse  to put both of his hands around my neck  and to squeeze so tightly that I could not breathe or scream,  and he used the chokehold  to hit my head repeatedly against the wall.

en_test: Five days later, the ten bruises on my neck had just faded,  and I put on my mother's wedding dress,  and I married him.

en_test: The answer is easy.

GOOGLE: 答案很简单。

en_test: Other outcomes include long-term stalking,  even after the abuser remarries;  denial of financial resources;  and manipulation of the family court system  to terrify the victim and her children,  who are regularly forced by family court judges to spend unsupervised time  with the man who beat their mother.

en_test: But since publishing "Crazy Love,"  I have heard hundreds of stories from men and women  who also got out,  who learned an invaluable life lesson from what happened,  and who rebuilt lives -- joyous, happy lives --  as employees, wives and mothers,  lives completely free of violence, like me.

en_test: I would like to talk to you about  a very special group of animals.
zh_test: 我想和大家聊聊 一种非常不寻常的动物。
GOOGLE: 我想和你们谈谈一群非常特殊的动物。

en_test: There are 10,000 species of birds in the world.
zh_test: 地球上总共有一万种鸟类。
GOOGLE: 世界上有 10,000 种鸟类。

en_test: Vultures are amongst the most threatened group of birds.
zh_test: 秃鹫是他们中最濒临灭绝的一种。
GOOGLE: 秃鹫是最受威胁的鸟类之一。

en_test: When you see a vulture like this, the first thing  that comes to your mind is, these are disgusting, ugly,  greedy creatures that are just after your flesh,  associated with politicians.    I want to change that perception. I want to change  those feelings you have for these birds, because  they need our sympathy. They really do.   And I'll tell you why.
zh_test: 每当你看到秃鹫就像这只，首先 浮现在你脑海中一定是，这是一些令人厌恶， 贪得无厌并且追逐腐肉的可怕生物， 让人禁不住联想到政客们。 我想改变这种看法。我想改变 大家对秃鹫的这些不好的联想，因为 他们需要我们的同情。他们真的很需要。 让我来告诉大家为什么。
GOOGLE: 当你看到这样的秃鹰时，你首先想到的是，这些是恶心、丑陋、贪婪的生物，只追求你的肉体，与政客有联系。我想改变这种看法。我想改变你对这些鸟的感受，因为它们需要我们的同情。他们确实这么做了。我会告诉你原因。

en_test: First of all, why do they have such a bad press?
zh_test: 首先，为什么他们会给我们留下这种坏印象呢？
GOOGLE: 首先，为什么他们受到如此负面的报道？

en_test: When Charles Darwin went across the Atlantic in 1832  on the Beagle, he saw the turkey vulture,  and he said, "These are disgusting birds  with bald scarlet heads that are formed to revel in putridity."   You could not get a worse insult, and that from Charles Darwin.   You know, he changed his mind when he came back,  and I'll tell you why.
zh_test: 1832年 查尔斯 达尔文在搭乘贝格尔号穿越大西洋的 旅途中，发现了土耳其秃鹫， 他当时说道，“这些令人恶心的，长着猩红色 秃头的鸟儿们总是沉湎于腐肉中不可自拔." 你很难找到比这更恶毒的侮辱了，这些话可是查尔斯 达尔文说的。 你们知道吗，达尔文返回英国之后就改变他的看法， 我马上会告诉你们为什么。
GOOGLE: 1832 年，当查尔斯·达尔文 (Charles Darwin) 乘小猎犬号横渡大西洋时，他看到了火鸡秃鹰，他说：“这些是令人厌恶的鸟类，它们有着猩红色的秃头，生来就喜欢腐烂。”查尔斯·达尔文（Charles Darwin）对你进行了最严重的侮辱。你知道，他回来后改变了主意，我会告诉你原因。

en_test: They've also be associated with Disney —  —  personified as goofy, dumb, stupid characters.
zh_test: 秃鹫还曾经被迪斯尼看上—— 像高飞狗一样，被人格化，变成了麻木的，愚蠢的动画角色。

zh_test: 而最近，如果你留意过肯尼亚的新闻 ——（欢呼）—— 肯尼亚的国会议员们被讽刺为像秃鹫一般 贪婪和愚蠢。但是我想叫板它。

en_test: I want to challenge that. Do you know why?
zh_test: 我要质疑它。你们知道为什么吗？

en_test: Because MPs  do not keep the environment clean.   MPs do not help to prevent the spread of diseases.
zh_test: 因为国会议员们 不能保持自然环境的清洁。 不能阻止疾病的传播。
GOOGLE: 因为国会议员不保持环境清洁。国会议员无助于防止疾病传播。

en_test: They are hardly monogamous.    They are far from being extinct.   And, my favorite is, vultures are better looking.    So there's two types of vultures in this planet.
zh_test: 几乎没人遵守一夫一妻制度。 他们离灭绝还很远。 并且，这条我最喜欢，秃鹫比议员们好看多了。 在这个世界上有两大类秃鹫。
GOOGLE: 他们几乎不是一夫一妻制的。它们距离灭绝还很远。而且，我最喜欢的是，秃鹫看起来更好看。所以这个星球上有两种秃鹰。

en_test: There are the New World vultures that are mainly found  in the Americas, like the condors and the caracaras,  and then the Old World vultures, where we have  16 species. From these 16, 11 of them are facing  a high risk of extinction.
zh_test: 新大陆的秃鹫主要生长在 美洲大陆，像是美洲秃鹫和委内瑞拉秃鹫， 而在其他的大陆，那里 总共有16种秃鹫，他们中的11种正面临着 灭绝的风险。
GOOGLE: 有新大陆秃鹫，主要分布在美洲，如秃鹰和卡拉卡拉，还有旧大陆秃鹰，有 16 种。在这16种动物中，有11种面临着很高的灭绝风险。

en_test: So why are vultures important? First of all,  they provide vital ecological services. They clean up.
zh_test: 所以为什么说秃鹫重要呢？首先， 秃鹫对生态循环做出了至关重要的作用。他们净化环境。
GOOGLE: 那么为什么秃鹫很重要呢？首先，它们提供重要的生态服务。他们打扫卫生。

en_test: They're our natural garbage collectors.
zh_test: 秃鹫是我们的大自然垃圾清道夫。
GOOGLE: 他们是我们天然的垃圾收集者。

en_test: They clean up carcasses right to the bone.
zh_test: 他们会把尸体上的肉吃的干干净净只剩白骨。
GOOGLE: 他们把尸体清理得只剩骨头。

en_test: They help to kill all the bacteria. They help absorb anthrax  that would otherwise spread and cause  huge livestock losses and diseases in other animals.
zh_test: 他们能消灭所有尸体上的细菌，他们能吸收炭疽病毒 阻止病毒的传播与扩散 从而使大量的家畜和动物远离死亡和疾病。
GOOGLE: 它们有助于杀死所有细菌。它们有助于吸收炭疽，否则炭疽会传播并导致巨大的牲畜损失和其他动物的疾病。

en_test: Recent studies have shown that in areas where there are  no vultures, carcasses take up to three to four times  to decompose, and this has huge ramifications for the spread of diseases.
zh_test: 最近的研究还显示在那些 没有秃鹫生存的地区，尸体的分解会多花 三到四倍的时间，这给疾病的传播与扩散
GOOGLE: 最近的研究表明，在没有秃鹫的地区，尸体需要三到四次才能分解，这对疾病的传播有巨大的影响。

en_test: Vultures also have tremendous historical significance.
zh_test: 提供了更多的机会。 秃鹫还有非常多的历史意义。
GOOGLE: 秃鹫也具有巨大的历史意义。

en_test: They have been associated in ancient Egyptian culture.
zh_test: 他们和古埃及文化有着密切的联系。
GOOGLE: 它们与古埃及文化有关。

en_test: Nekhbet was the symbol of the protector  and the motherhood, and together with the cobra,  symbolized the unity between Upper and Lower Egypt.
zh_test: 奈库贝特女神在古埃及文化中象征着监护人 和母性，通常和眼镜蛇女神维阿杰特一起出现， 象征着上埃及和下埃及的团结和统一。
GOOGLE: 涅赫贝特是保护者和母性的象征，与眼镜蛇一起象征着上埃及和下埃及之间的团结。

en_test: In Hindu mythology, Jatayu was the vulture god,  and he risked his life in order to save the goddess Sita  from the 10-headed demon Ravana.
zh_test: 在印度教神话中，秃鹫之神名为雅达尤， 他冒着生命危险 从10头恶魔罗波那手中救出了西妲女神。
GOOGLE: 在印度神话中，贾塔尤是秃鹫神，他冒着生命危险从十头恶魔罗波那手中拯救女神西塔。

en_test: In Tibetan culture, they are performing very important  sky burials. In places like Tibet, there are no places  to bury the dead, or wood to cremate them,  so these vultures provide a natural disposal system.
zh_test: 在西藏文化中，秃鹫尤其显得重要 天葬。在那些类似西藏的地方，既没有条件 土葬，也没有木材去进行火葬， 所以秃鹫为当地人提供了一种天然的尸体处理系统。
GOOGLE: 在藏族文化中，他们正在进行非常重要的天葬活动。在西藏这样的地方，没有地方埋葬死者，也没有木材来火化死者，所以这些秃鹫提供了一个自然的处理系统。

en_test: So what is the problem with vultures?
zh_test: 那么秃鹫都面临着哪些问题呢？
GOOGLE: 那么秃鹫有什么问题呢？

en_test: We have eight species of vultures that occur in Kenya,  of which six are highly threatened with extinction.
zh_test: 肯尼亚生长着八种秃鹫， 其中的六种正濒临灭绝。
GOOGLE: 肯尼亚有八种秃鹫，其中六种面临灭绝的高度威胁。

en_test: The reason is that they're getting poisoned, and the reason  that they're getting poisoned is because there's  human-wildlife conflicts. The pastoral communities  are using this poison to target predators,  and in return, the vultures are falling victim to this.
zh_test: 很多秃鹫被毒死，中毒的原因 是因为在肯尼亚正在发生的 人类与野生动物之间对于生存空间的争夺。牧人们 使用毒药来对付掠食动物， 掠食动物被毒死之后，秃鹫们随之成为了下一个受害者。
GOOGLE: 原因是它们中毒了，而它们中毒的原因是因为人类与野生动物的冲突。牧民社区正在使用这种毒药来攻击掠食者，而秃鹫却成为了受害者。

en_test: In South Asia, in countries like India and Pakistan,  four species of vultures are listed as critically endangered,  which means they have less than 10 or 15 years to go extinct,  and the reason is because they are falling prey  by consuming livestock that has been treated  with a painkilling drug like Diclofenac.
zh_test: 在南亚，一些国家类似于印度和巴基斯坦， 四种秃鹫被列为极度濒临灭绝中， 这意味着在他们将会在10到15年之内彻底灭绝， 灭绝的原因是因为秃鹫们 食用了那些生前曾被喂食过 含有双氯芬酸成分止疼药的家畜。
GOOGLE: 在南亚的印度和巴基斯坦等国，有四种秃鹫被列为极度濒危物种，这意味着它们在不到 10 或 15 年的时间内就会灭绝，原因是它们因捕食已被人类捕食的牲畜而成为猎物。用双氯芬酸等止痛药治疗。

en_test: This drug has now been banned for veterinary use in India,  and they have taken a stand.
zh_test: 现在含有双氯芬酸的兽药已经被禁止在印度使用， 印度政府表现出了积极的态度。
GOOGLE: 这种药物现已在印度被禁止用于兽医用途，他们也表明了立场。

en_test: Because there are no vultures, there's been a spread  in the numbers of feral dogs at carcass dump sites,  and when you have feral dogs, you have a huge time bomb  of rabies. The number of cases of rabies  has increased tremendously in India.
zh_test: 因为秃鹫数量的骤减，野狗开始 在牲畜尸体掩埋场周围泛滥成灾， 在野狗泛滥的地区，狂犬病就像定时炸弹一样 随时都会爆发。狂犬病案例的数量 在印度出现了惊人的增长。
GOOGLE: 由于没有秃鹫，尸体倾倒场的野狗数量不断增加，而当你有野狗时，你就会遇到狂犬病的巨大定时炸弹。印度的狂犬病病例数量急剧增加。

en_test: Kenya is going to have one of the largest wind farms in Africa:  353 wind turbines are going to be up at Lake Turkana.
zh_test: 肯尼亚即将拥有全非洲最大规模的风力发电厂： 353台涡轮发电机即将被安装在图尔卡纳湖区。

en_test: I am not against wind energy, but we need to work  with the governments, because wind turbines  do this to birds. They slice them in half.
zh_test: 我不反对开发风能，但是我们应该呼吁 政府重新考虑这项决定，因为风力涡轮机 会对鸟类造成威胁。高速的扇叶会把鸟儿“切”成两半。
GOOGLE: 我并不反对风能，但我们需要与政府合作，因为风力涡轮机会对鸟类造成这种影响。他们把它们切成两半。

en_test: They are bird-blending machines.
zh_test: 它们简直就是鸟类粉碎机。

en_test: In West Africa, there's a horrific trade  of dead vultures to serve the witchcraft and the fetish market.
zh_test: 在西非，一些人毫无怜悯的叫卖 死去的秃鹫来满足巫术和收藏的需求。

en_test: So what's being done? Well, we're conducting research  on these birds. We're putting transmitters on them.

en_test: We're trying to determine their basic ecology,  and see where they go.

en_test: We can see that they travel different countries, so  if you focus on a problem locally, it's not going to help you.

en_test: We're talking to them about appreciating vultures,  about the need from within to appreciate these  wonderful creatures and the services that they provide.

en_test: How can you help? You can become active,  make noise. You can write a letter to your government  and tell them that we need to focus on these very  misunderstood creatures. Volunteer your time  to spread the word. Spread the word.

en_test: When you walk out of this room, you will be informed  about vultures, but speak to your families, to your children,  to your neighbors about vultures.

en_test: They are very graceful. Charles Darwin said  he changed his mind because he watched them fly  effortlessly without energy in the skies.
zh_test: 它们是那么的优雅。查尔斯 达尔文曾说到 他改变了自己的看法，在他看到秃鹫们在空中 优雅而又浑然天成的身姿之后。

en_test: Kenya, this world, will be much poorer  without these wonderful species.
zh_test: 肯尼亚，全世界，都将会有很大的损失 如果失去了这些奇妙的物种。

en_test: Thank you very much.
zh_test: 非常感谢。（鼓掌）
GOOGLE: 非常感谢。

en_test: Everything I do, and everything I do professionally --  my life -- has been shaped  by seven years of work as a young man in Africa.
zh_test: 我所做的一切，不论是生活上还是工作上 我的整个人生--深深受到 年轻时在非洲工作的那七年的影响，
GOOGLE: 我所做的一切，以及我职业生涯所做的一切——我的生活——都是由年轻时在非洲工作的七年所塑造的。

en_test: From 1971 to 1977 --  I look young, but I'm not —  --  I worked in Zambia, Kenya, Ivory Coast, Algeria, Somalia,  in projects of technical cooperation with African countries.
zh_test: 从1971年到1977年。 我看起来很年轻，但其实我老了-- 我曾在赞比亚，肯尼亚，象牙海岸，阿尔及利亚，索马里 参与过不少与非洲各国的技术合作项目。

en_test: I worked for an Italian NGO,  and every single project that we set up in Africa  failed.
zh_test: 当时我在一家意大利非政府组织工作。 我们在非洲建立的每一个项目， 都失败了。

en_test: And I was distraught.
zh_test: 我都快抓狂了。
GOOGLE: 我心烦意乱。

en_test: I thought, age 21, that we Italians were good people  and we were doing good work in Africa.
zh_test: 那时21岁的我觉得我们意大利人是大好人， 我们在为非洲做好事谋福利。
GOOGLE: 21 岁时，我认为我们意大利人都是好人，我们在非洲做得很好。

en_test: Instead, everything we touched we killed.
zh_test: 然而，我们干什么赔什么。

en_test: Our first project, the one that has inspired my first book,  "Ripples from the Zambezi,"  was a project where we Italians  decided to teach Zambian people how to grow food.
zh_test: 我们第一个项目给了我写第一本书的灵感， 书名叫《赞比西河的涟漪》。 在这个项目中，我们意大利人 决定教赞比亚人种粮食。

en_test: So we arrived there with Italian seeds in southern Zambia  in this absolutely magnificent valley  going down to the Zambezi River,  and we taught the local people how to grow Italian tomatoes  and zucchini and ...
zh_test: 所以，我们带着意大利的种子来到了赞比亚南部， 一个壮丽迷人的山谷， 通向赞比西河。 我们教当地人种植意大利西红柿 和西葫芦等等。

en_test: So this neglected space became a constructive one,  and people's hopes and dreams made me laugh out loud, tear up,  and they consoled me during my own tough times.

en_test: I made this last year,  and started receiving hundreds of messages from passionate people  who wanted to make a wall with their community.

en_test: Together, we've shown how powerful our public spaces can be  if we're given the opportunity to have a voice,  and share more with one another.

en_test: In our age of increasing distractions,  it's more important than ever to find ways to maintain perspective,  and remember that life is brief and tender.

GOOGLE: 在我们这个干扰越来越多的时代，找到保持观点的方法比以往任何时候都更加重要，并记住生命短暂而温柔。

en_test: Death is something that we're often discouraged to talk about,  or even think about,  but I've realized that preparing for death  is one of the most empowering things you can do.

en_test: Now, for you who may be less familiar with the term "autism,"  it's a complex brain disorder that affects social communication,  learning and sometimes physical skills.

en_test: And I cannot remember the first moment I encountered autism,  but I cannot recall a day without it.

en_test: I was just three years old when my brother came along,  and I was so excited that  I had a new being in my life.
zh_test: 我三岁的时候，弟弟出生了 我非常兴奋 我有了新的家人

GOOGLE: 他大声尖叫。

GOOGLE: 然而，除了发脾气、沮丧和永无休止的过度活跃之外，还有一些真正独特的东西：纯洁无邪的本性，一个不带偏见地看待世界的男孩，一个从不撒谎的人。

en_test: Extraordinary.

en_test: I couldn't give them money, nothing.
zh_test: 我不能给他们钱，我什么也给不了
GOOGLE: 我不能给他们钱，什么也没有。

en_test: I wasn't a citizen of that country.
zh_test: 我不是那个国家的公民
GOOGLE: 我不是那个国家的公民。

en_test: I could get them in a worse situation  than they were already in.
zh_test: 我的行为很有可能 会让他们的境遇比现在更糟
GOOGLE: 我可以让他们陷入比现在更糟糕的境地。

en_test: I'd have to rely on Free the Slaves to work  within the system for their liberation,  and I trusted that they would.
zh_test: 我只能指望Free the Slaves组织能够在体系内发挥作用 解放他们 我相信他们可以做到
GOOGLE: 我必须依靠解放奴隶组织在体制内工作来解放他们，我相信他们会的。

en_test: As for me, I'd have to wait until I got home  to really feel my heartbreak.
zh_test: 就我来说，我必须等回到家以后 才能去品尝这份心痛
GOOGLE: 对于我来说，我必须等到回家才能真正感受到我的心碎。

en_test: In the Himalayas, I found children carrying stone  for miles down mountainous terrain  to trucks waiting at roads below.
zh_test: 在喜马拉雅，我见到了做苦力的小孩 背着石头走上几公里的山路 到路边等着的卡车旁
GOOGLE: 在喜马拉雅山，我发现孩子们沿着山区搬运石头数英里，运送到在下面道路上等候的卡车。

en_test: The big sheets of slate were heavier  than the children carrying them,  and the kids hoisted them from their heads using these handmade harnesses of sticks and rope  and torn cloth.
zh_test: 那些大石板 比搬运石板的孩子还要重 孩子们用树枝，绳子，破烂的衣服制成背带 绑在自己身上
GOOGLE: 大块石板比孩子们搬运的还要重，孩子们用这些手工制作的木棍、绳子和撕破的布把它们从头上吊起来。

en_test: It's difficult to witness something so overwhelming.
zh_test: 目睹这样沉甸甸的场景是一件极其痛苦的事
GOOGLE: 目睹如此压倒性的事情是很困难的。

en_test: How can we affect something so insidious,  yet so pervasive?
zh_test: 我们怎么才能干预这些隐藏于舆论之外 但却堪称普遍的恶事？
GOOGLE: 我们如何才能影响如此阴险却如此普遍的事情？

en_test: Some don't even know they're enslaved,  people working 16, 17 hours a day without any pay,  because this has been the case all their lives.
zh_test: 一些人甚至都不认为他们在被人奴役 每天工作十六七个小时 得不到半点酬劳 因为他们生来就过着这样的日子
GOOGLE: 有些人甚至不知道自己是奴隶，每天工作16、17个小时，没有任何报酬，因为他们一生都是这样。

en_test: They have nothing to compare it to.
zh_test: 没有任何比较
GOOGLE: 他们没有什么可以比较的。

en_test: When these villagers claimed their freedom,  the slaveholders burned down all of their houses.
zh_test: 如果这些人要为自己争取自由 奴隶主就烧掉他们所有的房子
GOOGLE: 当这些村民要求获得自由时，奴隶主烧毁了他们所有的房屋。

en_test: I mean, these people had nothing,  and they were so petrified, they wanted to give up,  but the woman in the center rallied for them to persevere,  and abolitionists on the ground  helped them get a quarry lease of their own,  so that now they do the same back-breaking work,  but they do it for themselves, and they get paid for it,  and they do it in freedom.
zh_test: 这些人一无所有 他们吓坏了，他们想要放弃 但是照片中间这位女士团结众人坚持到底 在当地的废奴主义者 帮助他们争取采石场的租约 这样，他们继续干着同样的重活 但现在是为自己而干，能拿到酬劳 他们拥有了自由
GOOGLE: 我的意思是，这些人一无所有，他们惊呆了，想要放弃，但是中间的女人团结起来让他们坚持下去，当地的废奴主义者帮助他们获得了自己的采石场租约，所以现在他们做着同样辛苦的工作，但他们是为自己做的，他们为此获得报酬，而且他们是自由地做的。

en_test: Sex trafficking is what we often think of  when we hear the word slavery,  and because of this worldwide awareness,  I was warned that it would be difficult for me to work safely within this particular industry.
zh_test: 非法性交易 是我们在听到奴役时最常联想到的 因为全球皆知 我曾被警告说，若我坚持拍摄这个行业
GOOGLE: 当我们听到奴隶制这个词时，我们经常想到的就是性贩运，由于这种全球性的认识，我被警告说，我很难在这个特定的行业中安全地工作。

en_test: In Kathmandu, I was escorted by women who had  previously been sex slaves themselves.
zh_test: 人身安全将难以得到保障 在加德满都 我由一些从前是性奴的女人随护
GOOGLE: 在加德满都，护送我的是一些以前曾是性奴隶的妇女。

en_test: They ushered me down a narrow set of stairs  that led to this dirty, dimly fluorescent lit basement.
zh_test: 她们带着我走下一段段狭窄的楼梯 到了一个肮脏昏暗的地下室
GOOGLE: 他们带我走下一段狭窄的楼梯，通向这个肮脏、荧光灯昏暗的地下室。

en_test: This wasn't a brothel, per se.
zh_test: 这里本身不是一间妓院
GOOGLE: 这本身不是妓院。

en_test: It was more like a restaurant.
zh_test: 它更像是间餐厅
GOOGLE: 它更像是一家餐厅。

en_test: Cabin restaurants, as they're known in the trade,  are venues for forced prostitution.
zh_test: 包厢餐厅在业内被人熟知 是强迫卖淫的场所
GOOGLE: 正如业内所知，小屋餐厅是强迫卖淫的场所。

en_test: Each has small, private rooms, where the slaves,  women, along with young girls and boys,  some as young as seven years old,  are forced to entertain the clients,  encouraging them to buy more food and alcohol.
zh_test: 一个个小隔间里，性奴们 女人和小孩 有些只有七岁大 被迫取悦客户 好让他们消费更多的食物和酒
GOOGLE: 每个人都有狭小的私人房间，奴隶、妇女以及年轻的女孩和男孩（有些年仅七岁）被迫招待顾客，鼓励他们购买更多的食物和酒。

en_test: Each cubicle is dark and dingy,  identified with a painted number on the wall,  and partitioned by plywood and a curtain.
zh_test: 每个小隔间都很暗很脏 墙上画着号码 由三夹板和窗帘隔开
GOOGLE: 每个隔间又黑又脏，墙上画有编号，并用胶合板和窗帘隔开。

en_test: The workers here often endure tragic sexual abuse  at the hands of their customers. Standing in the near darkness, I remember feeling  this quick, hot fear, and in that instant,  I could only imagine what it must be like  to be trapped in that hell.
zh_test: 在这里工作的人 通常都要忍受客人们残忍的性虐待 记得当时站在几乎是一片黑暗当中 我刹那间感到一阵强烈的恐惧 那一刻我在想 被困在这个地狱里是多么的恐怖
GOOGLE: 这里的工人经常遭受顾客的悲惨性虐待。站在近乎黑暗的地方，我记得感受到了这种快速而炽热的恐惧，在那一刻，我只能想象被困在那个地狱里会是什么样子。

en_test: I had only one way out: the stairs from where I'd come in.
zh_test: 这里只有一个出口：就是我来时走过的楼梯
GOOGLE: 我只有一条出路：从我进来的地方走楼梯。

en_test: There were no back doors.
zh_test: 没有后门
GOOGLE: 没有后门。

en_test: There were no windows large enough to climb through.
zh_test: 没有能过人的窗户
GOOGLE: 没有足够大的窗户可以爬过去。

en_test: These people have no escape at all,  and as we take in such a difficult subject,  it's important to note that slavery, including sex trafficking,  occurs in our own backyard as well.
zh_test: 这些人完全无法逃跑 当我们面对如此艰难的课题 重要的是要知道奴役，包括非法性交易 在我们的后院里同样存在
GOOGLE: 这些人根本无法逃脱，当我们面对如此困难的话题时，重要的是要注意奴隶制，包括性贩运，也发生在我们自己的后院。

en_test: Tens of hundreds of people are enslaved in agriculture,  in restaurants, in domestic servitude,  and the list can go on.
zh_test: 几千人成为农奴 餐馆奴工、家庭奴工 还不止这些
GOOGLE: 成千上万的人在农业、餐馆、家庭奴役中沦为奴隶，这样的例子还可以继续下去。

en_test: Recently, the New York Times reported that  between 100,000 and 300,000 American children  are sold into sex slavery every year.
zh_test: 最近，纽约时报报道 美国每年有10万到30万小孩 被买卖成为性奴
GOOGLE: 最近，《纽约时报》报道称，每年有10万至30万美国儿童被卖为性奴。

en_test: It's all around us. We just don't see it.
zh_test: 这些事就发生在我们身边，我们只是不知道罢了
GOOGLE: 它就在我们周围。我们只是没有看到它。

en_test: The textile industry is another one we often think of  when we hear about slave labor.
zh_test: 纺织业 也是我们听到奴役劳动时经常联想到的
GOOGLE: 当我们听到奴工时，我们经常想到的另一个行业是纺织业。

en_test: I visited villages in India where entire families were enslaved  in the silk trade.
zh_test: 我在印度拜访过一个村子 全家人都是丝绸贸易的奴隶
GOOGLE: 我访问了印度的村庄，那里的整个家庭都被丝绸贸易所奴役。

en_test: This is a family portrait.
zh_test: 这是一家人的“肖像”
GOOGLE: 这是一张全家福。

en_test: The dyed black hands are the father, while the blue  and red hands are his sons.
zh_test: 那双被染黑了的手属于这家的父亲 蓝色和红色的手属于两个儿子
GOOGLE: 染成黑色的手是父亲，蓝色和红色的手是儿子。

en_test: They mix dye in these big barrels,  and they submerge the silk into the liquid up to their elbows,  but the dye is toxic.
zh_test: 他们在大桶里搅拌燃料 然后把丝绸深深地浸进去，直到染料淹到手肘 这些染料都是有毒的
GOOGLE: 他们在这些大桶中混合染料，然后将丝绸浸入液体中，深至肘部，但染料是有毒的。

en_test: My interpreter told me their stories.
zh_test: 翻译告诉我他们的故事
GOOGLE: 我的翻译告诉我他们的故事。

en_test: "We have no freedom," they said.
zh_test: “我们没有自由”，他们说道
GOOGLE: “我们没有自由，”他们说。

en_test: "We hope still, though, that we could leave this house  someday and go someplace else  where we actually get paid for our dyeing."
zh_test: “可我们还是希望，哪天可以逃离这个屋子 去其他的地方 在那里工作能拿到报酬”
GOOGLE: “不过，我们仍然希望有一天我们可以离开这所房子，去别的地方，在那里我们的染色确实能得到报酬。”

en_test: It's estimated that more than 4,000 children  are enslaved on Lake Volta,  the largest man-made lake in the world.
zh_test: 据估计，有超过4000名儿童 在沃尔特湖水库被奴役 那里是世界上最大的人工湖
GOOGLE: 据估计，世界上最大的人工湖沃尔特湖有超过 4,000 名儿童沦为奴隶。

en_test: When we first arrived, I went to have a quick look.
zh_test: 我们一到那里，我就去看了个大概
GOOGLE: 我们刚到的时候，我就去参观了一下。

en_test: I saw what seemed to be a family fishing on a boat,  two older brothers, some younger kids, makes sense right?
zh_test: 我看到似乎是一家人在船上捕鱼 两个哥哥，几个小点的孩子，挺像的吧？
GOOGLE: 我看到好像是一家人在船上钓鱼，两个哥哥，一些年幼的孩子，有道理吧？

en_test: Wrong. They were all enslaved.
zh_test: 错！他们都是奴隶
GOOGLE: 错误的。他们都被奴役了。

en_test: Children are taken from their families  and trafficked and vanished,  and they're forced to work endless hours on these boats  on the lake, even though they do not know how to swim.
zh_test: 孩子们从家里被带出来 被贩卖 被迫在船上无休止的工作 他们在湖上工作，甚至还不会游泳
GOOGLE: 孩子们被从家人身边带走、被贩卖、失踪，他们被迫在湖上的船上无休止地工作，尽管他们不会游泳。

en_test: This young child is eight years old.
zh_test: 这个小男孩8岁大
GOOGLE: 这个小孩子今年八岁了。

en_test: He was trembling when our boat approached,  frightened it would run over his tiny canoe.
zh_test: 当我们的船靠近的时候 他在发抖 他怕我们的船会撞上上他的独木舟
GOOGLE: 当我们的船靠近时，他浑身发抖，生怕它会碾过他的小独木舟。

en_test: He was petrified he would be knocked in the water.
zh_test: 他很害怕会掉到水里
GOOGLE: 他害怕自己会被撞到水里。

en_test: The skeletal tree limbs submerged in Lake Volta  often catch the fishing nets, and weary,  frightened children are thrown into the water  to untether the lines.
zh_test: 湖面下浸着些树的枝干 经常会挂住渔网 这些疲惫、害怕的孩子们就被扔到水中 去解开渔网
GOOGLE: 淹没在沃尔特湖中的骷髅树枝经常会抓住渔网，疲倦、受惊的孩子们会被扔进水里解开渔网。

en_test: Many of them drown.
zh_test: 很多人都淹死了
GOOGLE: 他们中的许多人淹死了。

en_test: For as long as he can recall, he's been forced to work  on the lake.
zh_test: 从他记事开始， 就被迫在湖上工作
GOOGLE: 从他记事起，他就被迫在湖边工作。

en_test: Terrified of his master, he will not run away,  and since he's been treated with cruelty all his life,  he passes that down to the younger slaves  I met these boys at five in the morning,  when they were hauling in the last of their nets,  but they had been working since 1 a.m.
zh_test: 他非常害怕主人，不敢逃跑 由于他从小就被残酷对待 他也用同样的方法 对待比他小的奴隶 我在早上五点时看到这些男孩子们 在收最后一个渔网 可他们从凌晨1点就开始工作了
GOOGLE: 由于害怕他的主人，他不会逃跑，因为他一生都受到残酷的对待，所以他把这一点传给了年轻的奴隶，我在早上五点遇到这些男孩，当时他们正在拖最后一张网。 ，但他们从凌晨 1 点就开始工作了。

en_test: in the cold, windy night.
zh_test: 在这样寒冷，刮风的晚上
GOOGLE: 在寒冷、刮风的夜晚。

en_test: And it's important to note that these nets weigh  more than a thousand pounds when they're full of fish.
zh_test: 要知道这些渔网装满鱼的时候 重量有上千斤啊！
GOOGLE: 值得注意的是，当这些网装满鱼时，其重量将超过一千磅。

en_test: I want to introduce you to Kofi.
zh_test: 我要介绍你们认识Kofi
GOOGLE: 我想向您介绍科菲。

en_test: Kofi was rescued from a fishing village.
zh_test: 他从一个渔村被解救出来
GOOGLE: 科菲从一个渔村被救出。

en_test: I met him at a shelter where Free the Slaves  rehabilitates victims of slavery. Here he's seen taking a bath at the well,  pouring big buckets of water over his head,  and the wonderful news is,  as you and I are sitting here talking today,  Kofi has been reunited with his family,  and what's even better, his family has been given tools  to make a living and to keep their children safe.
zh_test: 见到他是在一个收容所里 Free the Slaves组织用于复元奴役受害者的一个地方 照片上他正在井边洗澡 把一桶桶水往头上倒 好消息是 此时此刻 Kofi 已经和家人团聚了 更让人欣喜的是，他们一家已能够自己谋生 并确保孩子们的安全
GOOGLE: 我在一个庇护所遇见了他，“解放奴隶”组织在那里帮助奴隶制受害者康复。在这里，人们看到他在井边洗澡，把大桶的水倒在头上，好消息是，当你和我今天坐在这里谈话时，科菲已经与他的家人团聚了，更棒的是，他的家人已获得谋生和保证孩子安全的工具。

en_test: Kofi is the embodiment of possibility.
zh_test: Kofi 身上体现了一种可能性
GOOGLE: 科菲是可能性的化身。

en_test: Who will he become because someone took a stand  and made a difference in his life?
zh_test: 正因为有人表明了立场，影响了他的人生 他的未来才可能有所改变
GOOGLE: 因为有人表明立场并改变了他的生活，他会成为谁？

en_test: Driving down a road in Ghana  with partners of Free the Slaves,  a fellow abolitionist on a moped suddenly sped up  to our cruiser and tapped on the window.
zh_test: 开车行驶在加纳的一条路上 与Free the Slaves的伙伴一起 一个骑着电单车的同行人突然加速 靠近我们的车，敲着车窗
GOOGLE: 与“解放奴隶”组织的伙伴一起沿着加纳的一条道路行驶时，一位骑着轻便摩托车的废奴主义者突然加速到我们的巡洋舰上，并敲了敲车窗。

en_test: He told us to follow him down a dirt road into the jungle.
zh_test: 他让我们跟他改走一条土路通向丛林
GOOGLE: 他让我们跟着他沿着一条土路进入丛林。

en_test: At the end of the road, he urged us out of the car,  and told the driver to quickly leave.
zh_test: 在路的尽头，他催促我们下车 让司机赶紧走
GOOGLE: 到了路的尽头，他催促我们下车，并叫司机赶紧离开。

en_test: Then he pointed toward this barely visible footpath,  and said, "This is the path, this is the path. Go."
zh_test: 然后他指着地上一排很不明显的脚印说 “就是这里，就是这条路。走！”
GOOGLE: 然后他指着那条几乎看不见的小路，说道：“这是路，这是路，走吧。”

en_test: As we started down the path, we pushed aside the vines  blocking the way, and after about an hour of walking in,  found that the trail had become flooded by recent rains,  so I hoisted the photo gear above my head  After another two hours of hiking, the winding trail  abruptly ended at a clearing, and before us  was a mass of holes  that could fit into the size of a football field,
zh_test: 我们拨开挡路的藤蔓 徒步走了约一个小时 小径被近期的雨水淹没了 我把拍摄器材举过头顶 趟着齐胸口深的水继续走 又走了两个小时 蜿蜒的小径戛然而止 我们面前的空地上出现了一大片坑洞
GOOGLE: 上路的时候，我们推开挡路的藤蔓，走了大约一个小时后，发现最近下雨，小路已经被淹没了，于是我把摄影器材举过头顶，又走了两个小时。徒步旅行时，蜿蜒的小路突然在一片空地上终止，眼前是一大片足球场大小的洞，

en_test: and all of them were full of enslaved people laboring.
zh_test: 每个都有一个橄榄球场那么大
GOOGLE: 所有这些地方都挤满了正在劳作的奴隶。

en_test: Many women had children strapped to their backs  while they were panning for gold,  wading in water poisoned by mercury.
zh_test: 每个坑洞里都有奴隶在工作 很多妇女还背着自己的小孩 他们在淘金 在被汞污染的脏水里行走
GOOGLE: 许多妇女在淘金时背着孩子，在汞中毒的水中涉水。

en_test: Mercury is used in the extraction process.
zh_test: 汞是用来提取金子的
GOOGLE: 萃取过程中使用汞。

en_test: These miners are enslaved in a mine shaft  in another part of Ghana.
zh_test: 这些人被奴役 在加纳的另一处矿井里
GOOGLE: 这些矿工被奴役在加纳另一个地区的矿井中。

en_test: When they came out of the shaft, they were soaking wet  from their own sweat.
zh_test: 当她们走出矿井时 全身汗湿
GOOGLE: 当他们从竖井里出来时，已经被汗水湿透了。

en_test: I remember looking into their tired, bloodshot eyes,  for many of them had been underground for 72 hours.
zh_test: 我记得他们布满红血丝的眼睛里充满疲惫 其中很多人已在井下工作72个小时
GOOGLE: 我记得我看着他们疲惫、布满血丝的眼睛，因为他们中的许多人已经在地下呆了 72 个小时。

en_test: The shafts are up to 300 feet deep, and they carry out  heavy bags of stone that later will be transported  to another area, where the stone will be pounded  so that they can extract the gold.

zh_test: 任何健康或者患有帕金森疾病的人都能打进来，很便宜 留下录音，每次只要几分钱 我很高兴宣布我们仅在8小时内 就达到了我们目标的6%

en_test: Before March, 2011, I was a photographic retoucher  based in New York City.
zh_test: 2011年3月之前，我是摄影修片师， 常驻纽约市。
GOOGLE: 2011 年 3 月之前，我是纽约市的一名摄影修图师。

en_test: We're pale, gray creatures.
zh_test: 我们苍白无力、面如死灰。
GOOGLE: 我们是苍白、灰色的生物。

en_test: We hide in dark, windowless rooms,  and generally avoid sunlight.
zh_test: 我们总呆在漆黑一片、不见天日的屋子里，工作室没有窗， 主要是为了抵御阳光。
GOOGLE: 我们躲在黑暗、没有窗户的房间里，通常避免阳光照射。

en_test: We make skinny models skinnier, perfect skin more perfect,  and the impossible possible,  and we get criticized in the press all the time,  but some of us are actually talented artists  with years of experience  and a real appreciation for images and photography.
zh_test: 我们帮苗条的模特变得更苗条，把完美的肌肤修缮得更无懈可击， 把不可能的事变成了可能， 我们一直被媒体批判， 但是我们其实是才华横溢的艺术家， 经验丰富， 懂得欣赏图片和照片。
GOOGLE: 我们让瘦削的模特变得更瘦，让完美的皮肤变得更完美，让不可能成为可能，我们一直受到媒体的批评，但我们中的一些人实际上是才华横溢的艺术家，拥有多年的经验和对图像和摄影的真正欣赏。

en_test: On March 11, 2011, I watched from home, as the rest  of the world did, as the tragic events unfolded in Japan.
zh_test: 2011年3月11日，正如全球其他人一样，我在家里看到 日本上演的悲剧。
GOOGLE: 2011年3月11日，我和世界其他地方一样，在家中目睹了日本发生的悲惨事件。

en_test: Soon after, an organization I volunteer with,  All Hands Volunteers, were on the ground, within days,  working as part of the response efforts.
zh_test: 不久之后，我参加做志愿者的一个组织 “携手志愿者”团队马上就赶赴了现场，仅仅在几天之内， 在当地开展应急救援活动。
GOOGLE: 不久之后，我参与的一个志愿者组织“全体志愿者”在几天之内就到达了现场，作为应对工作的一部分。

en_test: I, along with hundreds of other volunteers,  knew we couldn't just sit at home,  so I decided to join them for three weeks.
zh_test: 我和其他百余名志愿者 都深知：我们不能在家干等着。 因此我也决定加入他们的行列，做3周志愿救援活动。
GOOGLE: 我和其他数百名志愿者知道我们不能只是坐在家里，所以我决定加入他们三周。

en_test: On May the 13th, I made my way to the town of ?funato.
zh_test: 5月13日，我来到日本大船渡县，
GOOGLE: 5月13日，我前往大船渡镇。

en_test: It's a small fishing town in Iwate Prefecture,  about 50,000 people,  one of the first that was hit by the wave.
zh_test: 那是日本岩手县的一个小渔村， 人口大约只有5万人， 是当时第一波受灾的地方。
GOOGLE: 这是岩手县的一个小渔镇，约有 5 万人口，是最先遭受海浪袭击的小镇之一。

en_test: The waters here have been recorded at reaching  over 24 meters in height,  and traveled over two miles inland.
zh_test: 当时的海啸洪峰最高时刻 高达逾24米， 冲击到内陆足足有2英里的地方。
GOOGLE: 据记录，这里的海水高度超过 24 米，并向内陆移动了两英里多。

en_test: As you can imagine, the town had been devastated.
zh_test: 你可以想象，这个小镇肯定备受摧残。
GOOGLE: 正如你可以想象的那样，这座城镇已被摧毁。

en_test: We pulled debris from canals and ditches.
zh_test: 我们拨开运河和水沟里的瓦砾，
GOOGLE: 我们从运河和沟渠中清除残骸。

en_test: We cleaned schools. We de-mudded and gutted homes  ready for renovation and rehabilitation.
zh_test: 我们帮助学校和那些被埋没的房屋打扫、清理， 以便重建、翻新。
GOOGLE: 我们打扫了学校。我们对房屋进行了清理和清理，准备进行翻新和修复。

en_test: We cleared tons and tons of stinking, rotting fish carcasses  from the local fish processing plant.
zh_test: 我们清理了大量的发臭、腐烂的鱼尸骨， 那些鱼都是当地工厂里加工、处理的鱼。
GOOGLE: 我们从当地的鱼类加工厂清除了大量发臭、腐烂的鱼尸体。

en_test: We got dirty, and we loved it.
zh_test: 我们自己也变得又脏又臭，但是我们心里很舒坦。
GOOGLE: 我们弄脏了，但我们喜欢它。

en_test: For weeks, all the volunteers and locals alike  had been finding similar things.
zh_test: 一连几周，所有的志愿者和当地居民一样， 都找到了一些类似的东西。
GOOGLE: 几周以来，所有志愿者和当地人都发现了类似的东西。

en_test: They'd been finding photos and photo albums  and cameras and SD cards.
zh_test: 他们不断地发现照片、相册、 相机和SD储存卡。
GOOGLE: 他们一直在寻找照片、相册、相机和 SD 卡。

en_test: And everyone was doing the same.
zh_test: 每个人对此的反应和行动也如出一辙。
GOOGLE: 每个人都在做同样的事情。

en_test: They were collecting them up, and handing them in to  various places around the different towns for safekeeping.
zh_test: 他们把这些照片等东西收集起来，把它们送往 各个镇里进行保管。
GOOGLE: 他们正在收集它们，并将它们交给不同城镇的不同地方妥善保管。

en_test: Now, it wasn't until this point that I realized  that these photos were such a huge part  of the personal loss these people had felt.
zh_test: 直至现在，我才意识到， 丢失了这些照片肯定是 这些人失去的一块重大部分。
GOOGLE: 现在，直到此时我才意识到这些照片是这些人所感受到的个人损失的重要组成部分。

en_test: As they had run from the wave, and for their lives,  absolutely everything they had,  everything had to be left behind.
zh_test: 当他们遭受海啸袭击之时，可想而知，必然四处奔波，寻求一线生机， 自然把其他东西， 他们的所有东西都抛诸脑后。
GOOGLE: 因为他们已经逃离了海浪，为了他们的生命，他们所拥有的一切，一切都必须被抛在身后。

en_test: At the end of my first week there, I found myself  helping out in an evacuation center in the town.
zh_test: 我呆在日本的第一周的最后几天，我发现自己 在帮该镇的一个疏散中心，
GOOGLE: 在那里的第一周结束时，我发现自己在镇上的一个疏散中心帮忙。

en_test: I was helping clean the onsen, the communal onsen,  the huge giant bathtubs.
zh_test: 帮助一个公社温泉清扫 社里的巨大浴盆。
GOOGLE: 我正在帮忙打扫温泉、公共温泉、巨大的浴缸。

en_test: This happened to also be a place in the town where  the evacuation center was collecting the photos.
zh_test: 刚好当地 的疏散中心正在收集人们丢失的照片，
GOOGLE: 这里恰好也是镇上疏散中心收集照片的地方。

en_test: This is where people were handing them in,  and I was honored that day that they actually trusted me  to help them start hand-cleaning them.
zh_test: 人们把收集到的照片送到那个公社温泉， 当时我十分有幸得到了他们的信任， 让我开始清洗、还原那些照片。
GOOGLE: 这是人们把它们交给我的地方，那天我很荣幸他们真的信任我来帮助他们开始洗手。

en_test: Now, it was emotional and it was inspiring,  and I've always heard about thinking outside the box,  but it wasn't until I had actually gotten outside of my box  that something happened.
zh_test: 那些时刻令人触动，也非常有激励意义， 我一直听人们说：要有创意！ 直到那时清理那些照片，我才真的做到了 所谓的“创新”。
GOOGLE: 现在，它是激动人心的，也是鼓舞人心的，我总是听说要跳出框框思考，但直到我真正跳出框框，事情才发生了。

en_test: As I looked through the photos, there were some  were over a hundred years old,  some still in the envelope from the processing lab,  I couldn't help but think as a retoucher  that I could fix that tear and mend that scratch,  and I knew hundreds of people who could do the same.
zh_test: 当我翻看那些照片时，有些 甚至有逾百年的历史， 有些仍被保存在加工实验室的信封里， 我不禁从一个修图师的角度思考， 或许我可以帮他们修复这些被撕破和被划痕的照片， 而且我也认识很多会修图的人可以帮他们复原这些照片。
GOOGLE: 当我翻看这些照片时，有的已经有一百多年的历史了，有的仍然在加工实验室的信封里，我忍不住想，作为一个修图师，我可以修复那个撕裂，修补那个划痕，我认识数百人也能做到同样的事情。

en_test: So that evening, I just reached out on Facebook  and asked a few of them, and by morning  the response had been so overwhelming and so positive,  I knew we had to give it a go.
zh_test: 所以，当天傍晚，我就登陆脸谱网 问了一些修图师朋友，还没到第二天早上， 就有很多很多回复消息，说他们乐意帮忙， 我知道我们应该行动起来，
GOOGLE: 所以那天晚上，我在 Facebook 上联系了其中的一些人，到了早上，他们的反应非常热烈，非常积极，我知道我们必须尝试一下。

en_test: So we started retouching photos.
zh_test: 于是我们就开始了修图行动。
GOOGLE: 于是我们开始修饰照片。

en_test: This was the very first.
zh_test: 这是初次尝试（的一张照片）。
GOOGLE: 这是第一次。

en_test: Not terribly damaged, but where the water had caused  that discoloration on the girl's face  had to be repaired with such accuracy and delicacy.
zh_test: 还不算毁坏得太严重，但是被水浸没的地方 导致照片中小女孩的脸掉色了， 我们不得不精心修复，做到十分精确，
GOOGLE: 损坏并不严重，但女孩脸上因水而变色的地方必须如此精确和细致地修复。

en_test: Otherwise, that little girl isn't going to look  like that little girl anymore, and surely that's as tragic  as having the photo damaged.
zh_test: 否则，小女孩的脸就不会 看上去像她的脸了——那多悲剧啊， 就跟毁了照片一样。
GOOGLE: 否则，那个小女孩就不再是那个小女孩了，那肯定和照片被损坏一样悲惨。

en_test: Over time, more photos came in, thankfully,  and more retouchers were needed,  and so I reached out again on Facebook and LinkedIn,  and within five days, 80 people wanted to help  from 12 different countries.
zh_test: 随着时间推移，越来越多需要修复的照片被运送过来， 我们也需要更多修图师来帮忙处理这些照片， 于是我又登陆脸谱网和职业链接网站寻求帮助， 仅仅5天，就有80位修图师表示愿意来帮忙， 他们来自12个不同的国家。
GOOGLE: 谢天谢地，随着时间的推移，越来越多的照片进来，需要更多的修图师，所以我再次在 Facebook 和 LinkedIn 上联系，五天内，来自 12 个不同国家的 80 个人想要提供帮助。

en_test: Within two weeks, I had 150 people  wanting to join in.
zh_test: 两周内，我共得到150位志愿者的答复， 他们表示愿意加入我们的行列。
GOOGLE: 两周之内，就有 150 人想要加入。

en_test: Within Japan, by July, we'd branched out  to the neighboring town of Rikuzentakata,  further north to a town called Yamada.
zh_test: 截至七月，仅在日本境内，我们就设立了多处分支 有的在就近的陸前高田市， 有的分支北至茨城县。
GOOGLE: 在日本，到了 7 月，我们的业务已扩展到邻近的陆前高田镇，再往北到了一个叫山田的小镇。

en_test: Once a week, we would set up our scanning equipment  in the temporary photo libraries that had been set up,  where people were reclaiming their photos.
zh_test: 每周，我们都在 临时照相馆里架起扫描设备， 人们前来这些临时照相馆领回他们的照片。

en_test: The older ladies sometimes hadn't seen a scanner before,  but within 10 minutes of them finding their lost photo,  they could give it to us, have it scanned,  uploaded to a cloud server, it would be downloaded  by a gaijin, a stranger,  somewhere on the other side of the globe,  and it'd start being fixed.

GOOGLE: 老太太们有时以前没有见过扫描仪，但在她们找到丢失的照片后10分钟内，她们就可以把它给我们，让我们扫描，上传到云服务器，它会被一个陌生人下载。 ，在地球另一端的某个地方，它就会开始被修复。

en_test: It was very time-consuming.

zh_test: 当你走下路沿， 在环卫车旁观察一个城市， 你会慢慢认识到垃圾 真的就像大自然本身的力量。

en_test: It never stops coming.

en_test: It must always be in motion.

en_test: And then there's the stigma.
zh_test: 最后一点，环卫工人被污名化。
GOOGLE: 然后就是耻辱。

en_test: You put on the uniform, and you become invisible  until someone is upset with you for whatever reason  like you've blocked traffic with your truck,  or you're taking a break too close to their home,  or you're drinking coffee in their diner,  and they will come and scorn you,  and tell you that they don't want you anywhere near them.

GOOGLE: 你穿上制服，你就会变得隐形，直到有人因为某种原因对你感到不满，比如你用卡车堵塞了交通，或者你在离他们家太近的地方休息，或者你在他们的家里喝咖啡。吃饭时，他们会过来蔑视你，并告诉你他们不希望你靠近他们。

en_test: I find the stigma especially ironic,  because I strongly believe that sanitation workers  are the most important labor force  on the streets of the city, for three reasons.
zh_test: 我觉得这样的污名化非常地可笑， 因为我坚信环卫工人们 是城市街道上的 最重要的劳动力。 原因有三点。

en_test: They are the first guardians of public health.
zh_test: 他们是公共卫生的第一道屏障。
GOOGLE: 他们是公共卫生的第一卫士。

en_test: If they're not taking away trash  efficiently and effectively every day,  it starts to spill out of its containments,  and the dangers inherent to it threaten us  in very real ways.
zh_test: 如果他们每天不 高效迅速地清理垃圾的话， 垃圾会从容器中泄露， 它本身的毒害会以一种非常真实的方式 威胁到我们的生活。

en_test: Diseases we've had in check for decades and centuries  burst forth again and start to harm us.

en_test: The economy needs them.

en_test: If we can't throw out the old stuff,  we have no room for the new stuff,  so then the engines of the economy  start to sputter when consumption is compromised.

GOOGLE: 如果我们不能扔掉旧东西，我们就没有空间容纳新东西，那么当消费受到损害时，经济引擎就会开始熄火。

en_test: I'm not advocating capitalism, I'm just pointing out their relationship.

en_test: And then there's what I call  our average, necessary quotidian velocity.

en_test: to invest profitably in technologies such as energy  whose capital requirements are huge  and whose development is long and lengthy,  and V.C.s have never, never funded the development  of technologies meant to solve big problems  that possess no immediate commercial value.

GOOGLE: 如今，世界能源消耗中只有不到百分之二来自先进的可再生能源，如太阳能、风能和生物燃料，不到百分之二，其原因纯粹是经济原因。

zh_test: 我没法一概而论。

zh_test: 而20年前就被高度信任的人， 比如法官和护士，现在仍得到高度的信任。

en_test: The rest of us are in between,  and by the way, the average person in the street  is almost exactly midway.

GOOGLE: 但这是好的证据吗？

zh_test: 要不然民意调查能记录什么？

zh_test: 不过就是一些普遍的态度。 你问他们什么，他们就说什么。

zh_test: 如果有人问你，“你信任蔬菜商吗？”
GOOGLE: 现在，如果有人对你说：“你相信蔬菜水果商吗？

zh_test: 你信任卖鱼的吗？

zh_test: 你信任小学老师吗？

en_test: you would probably begin by saying, "To do what?"

zh_test: 当你明白问题到底是什么, 你会说， “嗯。我相信一些人，不相信另一些人。”

en_test: In short, in our real lives,  we seek to place trust in a differentiated way.
zh_test: 简而言之，在我们现实生活中， 我们以不同的方式来寻求信任。

GOOGLE: 我们不会假设我们对某种类型的官员或公职人员或类型的人的每种情况的信任程度都是一致的。

en_test: I might, for example, say that I certainly trust  a certain elementary school teacher I know  to teach the reception class to read,  but in no way to drive the school minibus.

zh_test: 也许最终我知道她确实不是个好司机。

en_test: I might trust my most loquacious friend  to keep a conversation going  but not -- but perhaps not to keep a secret.

zh_test: 就这么简单。
GOOGLE: 简单的。

en_test: So if we've got those evidence in our ordinary lives  of the way that trust is differentiated,  why do we sort of drop all that intelligence  when we think about trust more abstractly?
zh_test: 在日常生活中我们有了这样的证据， 说信任感是有区分的， 那么为什么民意调查时我们一下子糊涂了， 把信任感想得更概念化了呢？
GOOGLE: 因此，如果我们在日常生活中已经获得了信任的区分方式的证据，那么当我们更抽象地思考信任时，为什么我们会放弃所有这些智慧呢？

en_test: I think the polls are very bad guides  to the level of trust that actually exists,  because they try to obliterate the good judgment  that goes into placing trust.
zh_test: 我觉得民意调查是个很差劲的 衡量信任感是否存在的依据。 因为它抹杀了人们良好的判断力。 对考虑信任感的判断力。
GOOGLE: 我认为民意调查对于实际存在的信任程度来说是非常糟糕的指导，因为它们试图抹杀建立信任所需的良好判断。

en_test: Secondly, what about the aim?
zh_test: 第二，那个目的是怎么回事儿呢？
GOOGLE: 其次，目标是什么？

en_test: The aim is to have more trust.
zh_test: 目的是我们需要更多的信任感。
GOOGLE: 目的是获得更多信任。

en_test: Well frankly, I think that's a stupid aim.
zh_test: 坦白说，我觉得这个目的挺可笑的。
GOOGLE: 坦白说，我认为这是一个愚蠢的目标。

en_test: It's not what I would aim at.
zh_test: 这不是我想的那个目的。
GOOGLE: 这不是我的目标。

en_test: I would aim to have more trust in the trustworthy  but not in the untrustworthy.
zh_test: 我会说，人们应该对值得信赖的更加地信任。 而不是去信任不值得信赖的人。
GOOGLE: 我的目标是对值得信赖的人有更多的信任，而不是对不值得信赖的人有更多的信任。

en_test: In fact, I aim positively to try not to trust the untrustworthy.
zh_test: 实际上，我所说的目的是尽量不要信任不值得信赖的人。
GOOGLE: 事实上，我积极的目标是尽量不相信那些不值得信任的人。

en_test: And I think, of those people who, for example,  placed their savings with the very aptly named Mr. Madoff,  who then made off with them,  and I think of them, and I think, well, yes,  too much trust.
zh_test: 比如说，那些 把自己的积蓄交给那个看起来很象样的 却把他们的钱都卷走的麦道夫先生 的人，我觉得那些人呀，怎么说呢，对， 太容易信任别人了。
GOOGLE: 我认为，那些人，例如，将自己的积蓄存入了名字非常恰当的麦道夫先生，然后麦道夫先生带走了他们，我想到了他们，我认为，嗯，是的，太多的信任。

en_test: More trust is not an intelligent aim in this life.
zh_test: 过度地信任别人不是一个很明智的目的。
GOOGLE: 更多信任并不是今生明智的目标。

en_test: Intelligently placed and intelligently refused trust  is the proper aim.
zh_test: 明智地信任和明智地选择不信任 才是正确的目的。
GOOGLE: 明智地放置和明智地拒绝信任才是正确的目标。

en_test: Well once one says that, one says, yeah, okay,  that means that what matters in the first place  is not trust but trustworthiness.
zh_test: 那么有人说，好呀，好， 这不就是说最重要的 不是要去信任，而是信誉度吗？
GOOGLE: 一旦有人这么说，有人会说，是的，好吧，这意味着首先重要的不是信任，而是值得信赖。

en_test: It's judging how trustworthy people are  in particular respects.
zh_test: 就是说要判断别人在某些方面 是否值得信任。
GOOGLE: 它是在判断人们在特定方面的可信度。

en_test: And I think that judgment requires us to look at three things.
zh_test: 我觉得要想正确做出判断需要考虑三点。
GOOGLE: 我认为做出判断需要我们考虑三件事。

en_test: Are they competent? Are they honest? Are they reliable?
zh_test: 要看他们是否称职？是否诚实？是否可靠？
GOOGLE: 他们有能力吗？他们诚实吗？他们可靠吗？

en_test: And if we find that a person is competent  in the relevant matters,  and reliable and honest,  we'll have a pretty good reason to trust them,  because they'll be trustworthy.
zh_test: 如果我们觉得一个人是称职的， 在他自己的领域是称职的。 而且是诚实可靠的。 我们就有理由去相信他们， 因为他们是可信赖的。
GOOGLE: 如果我们发现一个人在相关事务上有能力，并且可靠和诚实，我们就有充分的理由信任他们，因为他们是值得信赖的。

en_test: But if, on the other hand, they're unreliable, we might not.
zh_test: 但是反过来，如果他们不可靠，那我们就不能信任他们。
GOOGLE: 但另一方面，如果它们不可靠，我们可能不会。

en_test: I have friends who are competent and honest,  but I would not trust them to post a letter,  because they're forgetful.
zh_test: 我有一些诚实可靠的朋友， 但我就信不着他们去帮我寄信， 因为他们很健忘。
GOOGLE: 我有一些有能力、诚实的朋友，但我不相信他们会寄信，因为他们很健忘。

en_test: I have friends who are very confident  they can do certain things,  but I realize that they overestimate their own competence.
zh_test: 我有些非常自信的朋友， 他们很能干， 但是我觉得他们有些过于自信。
GOOGLE: 我有一些朋友非常有信心自己可以做某些事情，但我意识到他们高估了自己的能力。

en_test: And I'm very glad to say, I don't think I have many friends  who are competent and reliable but extremely dishonest.
zh_test: 当然我很高兴的是，我的朋友都是 称职可靠，又不是非常不诚实的。
GOOGLE: 我很高兴地说，我不认为我有很多有能力、可靠但极其不诚实的朋友。

en_test: If so, I haven't yet spotted it.
zh_test: 也许有，我还没发现。
GOOGLE: 如果是的话，我还没有发现它。

en_test: But that's what we're looking for:  trustworthiness before trust.
zh_test: 我们需要的就是： 信任别人之前要看他的信誉度。
GOOGLE: 但这正是我们所追求的：首先是值得信赖，其次才是信任。

en_test: Trust is the response.
zh_test: 信任是我们的反应。
GOOGLE: 信任就是回应。

en_test: Trustworthiness is what we have to judge.
zh_test: 信誉度是需要我们来判断的。
GOOGLE: 可信度是我们必须判断的。

en_test: And, of course, it's difficult.
zh_test: 所以当然这不是容易做到的。
GOOGLE: 当然，这很困难。

en_test: Across the last few decades, we've tried to construct  systems of accountability for all sorts of institutions  and professionals and officials and so on  that will make it easier for us to judge their trustworthiness.
zh_test: 过去的几十年里，我们努力地建立 各种机构里的问责制度， 是否达到专业水准或者官方要求等等 这些使我们更容易判断是否有信誉。
GOOGLE: 在过去的几十年里，我们一直试图为各种机构、专业人员和官员等建立问责制度，这将使我们更容易判断他们的可信度。

en_test: A lot of these systems have the converse effect.
zh_test: 很多机构都有这样的逆反应。
GOOGLE: 许多这样的系统具有相反的效果。

en_test: They don't work as they're supposed to.
zh_test: 他们不象他们应该做的那样做事。
GOOGLE: 它们没有按照应有的方式工作。

en_test: I remember I was talking with a midwife who said,  "Well, you see, the problem is it takes longer  to do the paperwork than to deliver the baby."
zh_test: 我记得和我一个助产士聊天，她说 ”你看看，现在的问题是我要 办个什么手续比接生一个孩子还难！“
GOOGLE: 我记得我正在和一位助产士交谈，她说：“嗯，你看，问题是做文书工作比生孩子需要更长的时间。”

en_test: And all over our public life, our institutional life,  we find that problem,  that the system of accountability  that is meant to secure trustworthiness  and evidence of trustworthiness  is actually doing the opposite.
zh_test: 在我们的公共生活里，我们的机构生活里， 我们发现很多问题。 这些机构里的问责制度 这些能保障自己的信誉 能作为值得信任的依据的制度 往往施行起来是相反的。
GOOGLE: 在我们的公共生活、我们的机构生活中，我们发现这个问题，即旨在确保可信度和可信度证据的问责制度实际上在做相反的事情。

en_test: It is distracting people who have to do difficult tasks,  like midwives, from doing them  by requiring them to tick the boxes, as we say.
zh_test: 这就使人们难以专注自己的工作， 比如助产士们， 让他们把时间浪费在填表上。就象我刚提到的。
GOOGLE: 正如我们所说，要求助产士等必须完成困难任务的人在方框中打勾，从而分散了他们的注意力。

en_test: You can all give your own examples there.
zh_test: 你们其实都有这样的经历。
GOOGLE: 你们都可以在那里举出自己的例子。

en_test: So so much for the aim.
zh_test: 关于目的要讲的很多很多。
GOOGLE: 目标就这么多。

en_test: The aim, I think, is more trustworthiness,  and that is going to be different  if we are trying to be trustworthy  and communicate our trustworthiness to other people,  and if we are trying to judge whether other people  or office-holders or politicians are trustworthy.
zh_test: 我想这个目的更重要的是对方的信誉度。 那就完全不一样了。 比如说我们努力去成为值得信任的人， 把我们值得信任的一面展示给别人。 比如说我们先判断别人， 官员或者政客是否值得信任。
GOOGLE: 我认为，目标是更加值得信赖，如果我们试图表现得值得信赖并向其他人传达我们的可信度，如果我们试图判断其他人、公职人员或政客是否值得信赖，情况就会有所不同。

en_test: It's not easy. It is judgment, and simple reaction,  attitudes, don't do adequately here.
zh_test: 这不是容易的事。这是判断，是迅速反应， 是态度，在这里都讲不完。
GOOGLE: 这并不容易。这是判断，是简单的反应、态度，这里做得不够。

en_test: Now thirdly, the task.
zh_test: 那么第三点，关于任务。
GOOGLE: 现在第三，任务。

en_test: Calling the task rebuilding trust, I think,  also gets things backwards.
zh_test: 这个任务叫做重建信任感。 这又是弄反了的。
GOOGLE: 我认为，将任务称为“重建信任”也会让事情倒退。

en_test: It suggests that you and I should rebuild trust.
zh_test: 这个任务建议你和我要重建信任。
GOOGLE: 它建议你和我应该重建信任。

en_test: Well, we can do that for ourselves.
zh_test: 好吧，我们能对自己这么做，
GOOGLE: 好吧，我们可以自己做。

en_test: We can rebuild a bit of trustworthiness.
zh_test: 我们能重建一些自己的信誉，
GOOGLE: 我们可以重建一点信任。

en_test: We can do it two people together trying to improve trust.
zh_test: 我们可以互相努力增加我们的信任。
GOOGLE: 我们可以两个人一起做，努力增进信任。

en_test: But trust, in the end, is distinctive  because it's given by other people.
zh_test: 但关根到底，信任是很独特的。 因为是来自他人的。
GOOGLE: 但归根结底，信任是独特的，因为它是由其他人给予的。

en_test: You can't rebuild what other people give you.
zh_test: 你不可能重建别人对你的看法。
GOOGLE: 你无法重建别人给你的东西。

en_test: You have to give them the basis  for giving you their trust.
zh_test: 你需要做出努力 让人家信任你。
GOOGLE: 你必须给他们信任你的基础。

en_test: So you have to, I think, be trustworthy.
zh_test: 我是说，你要成为一个值得信赖的人。
GOOGLE: 所以我认为你必须值得信赖。

en_test: And that, of course, is because you can't fool  all of the people all of the time, usually.
zh_test: 当然，这就是说你不能 在永远愚弄住所有的人，一般来说。
GOOGLE: 当然，这是因为通常你不可能一直欺骗所有人。

en_test: But you also have to provide usable evidence  that you are trustworthy.
zh_test: 你得提供一些有用的依据， 让别人知道你是值得信赖的。
GOOGLE: 但您还必须提供可用的证据来证明您值得信赖。

en_test: How to do it?
zh_test: 应该怎么做？
GOOGLE: 怎么做？

en_test: Well every day, all over the place, it's being done  by ordinary people, by officials, by institutions,  quite effectively.
zh_test: 其实每天，在不同得地方， 普通人，办公人员，各个机构都在努力， 往往做得很有效呢。
GOOGLE: 每天，各地的普通民众、官员、机构都在非常有效地完成这项工作。

en_test: Let me give you a simple commercial example.
zh_test: 我给你举个简单的商家营销的例子，
GOOGLE: 让我给你举一个简单的商业例子。

en_test: The shop where I buy my socks says I may take them back,  and they don't ask any questions.
zh_test: 有个商店说我可以把买的袜子退回去， 他们绝不问任何问题。
GOOGLE: 我买袜子的商店说我可以退货，他们也没有问任何问题。

en_test: They take them back and give me the money  or give me the pair of socks of the color I wanted.
zh_test: 他们收退货，我拿退货款。 或者给我换是我喜欢颜色的袜子。
GOOGLE: 他们把它们拿回来并给我钱或者给我一双我想要的颜色的袜子。

en_test: That's super. I trust them  because they have made themselves vulnerable to me.
zh_test: 这很好。我信任他们。 因为他们让我觉得他们是处于弱势。
GOOGLE: 太棒了。我信任他们，因为他们让自己在我面前变得脆弱。

en_test: I think there's a big lesson in that.
zh_test: 我觉得这很有教益。
GOOGLE: 我认为这有一个很大的教训。

en_test: If you make yourself vulnerable to the other party,  then that is very good evidence that you are trustworthy  and you have confidence in what you are saying.
zh_test: 如果对于别人，你使自己处于弱势， 这就是个很好的值得信任的依据。 对自己说的话就有自信。
GOOGLE: 如果你让自己容易受到对方的攻击，那么这就是很好的证据，表明你是值得信赖的，并且你对自己所说的话充满信心。

en_test: So in the end, I think what we are aiming for  is not very difficult to discern.
zh_test: 所以最终呢，我们的意图 就不那么难辨别了。
GOOGLE: 所以最后，我认为我们的目标并不是很难辨别。

en_test: It is relationships in which people are trustworthy  and can judge when and how the other person  is trustworthy.
zh_test: 人们是否值得信任是一种人和人之间的关系。 我们可以判断什么时候人们是如何 值得你信任的。
GOOGLE: 在这种关系中，人们是值得信赖的，并且可以判断对方何时以及如何值得信赖。

en_test: So the moral of all this is,  we need to think much less about trust,  let alone about attitudes of trust  detected or mis-detected by opinion polls,  much more about being trustworthy,  and how you give people adequate, useful  and simple evidence that you're trustworthy.
zh_test: 从道义上说， 我们要少考虑信任， 更不要说对信任的态度， 或者凭着民意测验来判断或者误判， 让我们更关注于成为值得信赖的人。 关注于如何提供恰当、有益 简单的依据让人们觉得你是可以信赖的。
GOOGLE: 因此，这一切的寓意是，我们需要少考虑信任，更不用说民意调查检测到或误检测到的信任态度，更多地考虑值得信赖，以及如何向人们提供充分、有用和简单的证据来证明这一点。你值得信赖。

en_test: Thanks.
zh_test: 谢谢！
GOOGLE: 谢谢。

en_test: Throughout the history of computers  we've been striving to shorten the gap between us  and digital information,  the gap between our physical world  and the world in the screen  where our imagination can go wild.
zh_test: 纵观计算机中的历史 我们一直在努力弥合 我们与数字信息之间的隔阂， 还有我们的现实世界 与虚拟世界之间的差距。 在虚拟世界里，我们的想象力是无穷的。
GOOGLE: 纵观计算机的历史，我们一直在努力缩短我们与数字信息之间的差距，缩短我们的物理世界与我们可以尽情发挥想象力的屏幕世界之间的差距。

en_test: And this gap has become shorter,  shorter, and even shorter,  and now this gap is shortened down  to less than a millimeter,  the thickness of a touch-screen glass,  and the power of computing  has become accessible to everyone.
zh_test: 这一差距已经在缩短， 还会继续缩短， 现在这一差距已经缩短到 小于一毫米， 就是触摸屏的玻璃那么薄， 而且计算机已是 人皆有之。
GOOGLE: 而这个差距变得越来越短，越来越短，甚至越来越短，现在这个差距已经缩短到不到一毫米，触摸屏玻璃的厚度，计算的能力已经变得触手可及。

en_test: But I wondered, what if there could be no boundary at all?
zh_test: 但我在想，要是没有虚拟和现实世界之间的边界该多好?
GOOGLE: 但我想知道，如果根本没有边界怎么办？

en_test: I started to imagine what this would look like.
zh_test: 我于是就开始大胆尝试这个想法。
GOOGLE: 我开始想象这会是什么样子。

en_test: First, I created this tool  which penetrates into the digital space,  so when you press it hard on the screen,  it transfers its physical body into pixels.
zh_test: 我首先造出了这个工具， 它可以深入数字空间， 如果你拿这支笔用力按这个屏幕， 这支笔的笔身就会进到由像素点组成的虚拟世界中。
GOOGLE: 首先，我创建了这个渗透到数字空间的工具，因此当你用力按在屏幕上时，它会将其物理实体转换为像素。

en_test: Designers can materialize their ideas  directly in 3D,  and surgeons can practice on virtual organs  underneath the screen.
zh_test: 设计师们可以直接在三维立体空间内 实现他们的想法， 外科医生可以在屏幕里面 练习给虚拟器官动手术。
GOOGLE: 设计师可以直接以 3D 方式实现他们的想法，外科医生可以在屏幕下方的虚拟器官上进行练习。

en_test: So with this tool, this boundary has been broken.
zh_test: 可见，这个工具打破了虚拟和现实世界之间的边界。
GOOGLE: 所以有了这个工具，这个界限就被打破了。

en_test: But our two hands still remain outside the screen.
zh_test: 但我们双手还是在屏幕外。
GOOGLE: 但我们的两只手仍然停留在屏幕之外。

en_test: How can you reach inside and interact  with the digital information  using the full dexterity of our hands?
zh_test: 我们怎样才能把手伸进去 和数字信息进行交互， 从而充分利用我们灵活的双手？
GOOGLE: 如何充分利用我们双手的灵巧性，深入内部并与数字信息进行交互？

en_test: At Microsoft Applied Sciences,  along with my mentor Cati Boulanger,  I redesigned the computer  and turned a little space above the keyboard  into a digital workspace.
zh_test: 我在微软应用科学实验室， 和我的导师卡迪•布兰葛 重新设计了这台计算机 把键盘上方的小空间 挪进数字工作区内。
GOOGLE: 在微软应用科学公司，我和我的导师 Cati Boulanger 一起重新设计了计算机，并将键盘上方的一小块空间变成了数字工作区。

en_test: By combining a transparent display and depth cameras  for sensing your fingers and face,  now you can lift up your hands from the keyboard  and reach inside this 3D space  and grab pixels with your bare hands.
zh_test: 通过将一个透明显示屏与几个深度摄像头结合， 这几个摄像头可以感知你的手指和脸， 现在你可以从键盘上抬起你的双手 伸进这个三维立体空间去 徒手控制里面的虚拟物质——像素点。
GOOGLE: 通过将透明显示屏和深度摄像头相结合来感应您的手指和脸部，现在您可以将手从键盘上抬起并进入这个 3D 空间并徒手抓取像素。

en_test: Because windows and files have a position in the real space,  selecting them is as easy as grabbing a book off your shelf.
zh_test: 因为窗口和文件在现实空间内有了具体位置， 选取它们变得像从书架上拿一本书那么容易。
GOOGLE: 由于窗口和文件在真实空间中都有一个位置，因此选择它们就像从书架上拿起一本书一样简单。

en_test: Then you can flip through this book  on the virtual touch pad below each floating window.
zh_test: 然后你可以翻阅这本书 并在每个浮动窗口下面的虚拟触控板上 划出字词和句子。
GOOGLE: 然后，您可以在每个浮动窗口下方的虚拟触摸板上翻阅这本书。

en_test: Architects can stretch or rotate the models  with their two hands directly.
zh_test: 建筑师们可以直接用他们的双手 拉伸或旋转各种模型。
GOOGLE: 建筑师可以直接用两只手拉伸或旋转模型。

en_test: So in these examples,  we are reaching into the digital world.
zh_test: 在这些例子表明， 我们正在进入数字世界。
GOOGLE: 因此，在这些示例中，我们正在进入数字世界。

en_test: But how about reversing its role  and having the digital information reach us instead?
